loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 49 years old, widow doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale. She is shown in the photo with her nephew. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of 2 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik and her three-years-old son Samvel live in Kapan town, Syunik region. To be able to earn daily bread, Hasmik started her small business two years ago. She trades with kids clothing in the center of Kapan town.
 
Hasmik is proud mother of her son Samvel and does her best to sustain their living. To be able to purchase new stock of clothing and shoes supplies for her store, Hasmik has applied for this loan.
 
She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your help is very important for Hasmik to enlarge her business and cover current demand.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of shoes and clothing for kids to sell in the shop

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 33 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She has a general store and the business has been doing well. Besides running retail shop as her primary activity, she also sells used clothes. 

She will use the loan to buy more stock sugar, cooking oil, flour and rice for sell to her customers and hopes this will enable her to make more income to support her family. She will use the generated profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to open a wholesale shop and have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy more stock sugar, cooking oil, flour and rice for sell to her customers and hopes this will enable her to make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 46 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 4 children. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years. Parveen is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
At 65 years old, Eugenia works hard as a farmer in her town of San Miguel, Bohol. This is something that she do as her livelihood and also to make her feel occupied since this has been her business for 35 years. She is asking a loan to continue her farming. She will use it to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pay for labor of the hired helpers.

Her income will take care of her need for healthy meals, allow her to save and reinvestment in the same business. In the future, she plans to expand her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pay for labor on her rice paddy

loans.name: Patricia Elena

texts.es:
Patricia de 48 años es una microempresaria que decidió seguir los consejos de una amiga e incorporarse en el ámbito comercial, en el que hoy en día cuenta con cinco años de experiencia ofreciéndoles a sus conocidos y amigos, diferentes tipos de productos de uso personal, prendas de vestir, calzado y marroquinería.  Esta dinámica mujer reside en compañía de su esposo y es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad a quienes les ofreció su incondicional amor y cuidado, sin embargo su rol le ha permitido distribuir su tiempo en sus labores como ama de casa y comerciante.  Patricia está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en nuevo surtido de prendas de vestir, maquillaje, bolsos, perfumería, electrodomésticos  y demás encargos de sus clientes.  Con esta inversión sus ventas se incrementaran y ella podrá tener mayores ingresos.  Su meta a futuro es abrir un almacén y remodelar su vivienda. 

 
a.
texts.en:
Patricia is 48 years old and is a small business owner who decided to follow a friend's advice and join the commercial field. She now has five years of experience offering her friends and acquaintances different types of personal care products, clothing, shoes and leather goods. This dynamic woman lives with her husband and is the mother of three adult children to whom she gave her unconditional love and care. Her role has allowed her to distribute her time between her household work and her work as a businesswoman. 

Patricia is requesting her first loan with Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in a new assortment of clothing, make up, bags, perfumes, household appliances and orders from her customers. With this investment her sales will increase and she will be able to have a higher income. Her future goals are to open a warehouse and to remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothing, make up, bags, perfumes, household appliances and other customer orders.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 41 years old. He is married with 1 child. He has had a retail shop business where he sells household goods, a business he has done for 5 years. 

He has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will be using to purchase additional stock of household goods and hopes this will help him have a very big shop with the anticipated profits. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are have a super market and to give his son the best education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods

loans.name: Mischel

texts.en:
Mischel is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She farms rice for a living. This has been her business for two years now. She works hard in order to provide for the needs of her one-year-old son.

She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and hard wood for her house.

Mischel wants to engage in other businesses in the future so she is better equipped in providing for her child when he grows up.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hard wood

loans.name: Napoleón

texts.es:
Napoleón de 65 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta tercer grado en el centro escolar de  su comunidad, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los  oficios domésticos, tienen 6 hijos pero solo 3 viven en casa.  

Desde pequeño, Napoleón se ha dedicado a  la  agricultura, oficio  que  aprendió de  su padre, sus  hijos  lo  apoyan  esta actividad, el lugar donde trabaja está  a pocos nimutos de  su casa, y además su esposa elabora pan con horno artesanal.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos, insecticidas, etc. ya  que está  iniciando la temporada de postrera 

Él sueña con volver a ver a sus hijos mayores que están lejos de este país, ver crecer a sus nietos y seguir trabajando con esta institución que le ha ayudado mucho.
texts.en:
Napoleón is 65 years old and was able to study until the third grade at his community's school. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have six children but only three live at home. 

From a young age Napoleón has worked in agriculture, a trade he learned from his father. His children support him in this work. The place where he works is a few minutes from his home. His wife also makes artisan oven bread. 

He needs this loan to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides, etc. because the final harvest season is starting. He dreams with seeing his grown children again since they are far from this county, seeing his grandchildren grow and continuing to work with this institution that has helped him a lot.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 59-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business. This has been her business for two years now. She enjoyed having this business which is just attached to her home. 

She is asking a loan of PHP22000 to buy soft drinks, liquors, canned food, noodles, toothpaste and coffee. Full shelves will be more inviting to her customers, thus increase her sales. In the future, Susan plans to buy more merchandise that she does not previously carry so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquors, canned food, noodles, toothpaste and coffee

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 31 years, married, and has three children. Her husband runs his own business, providing additional income for his family. Monica operates a general store, which she has been doing for seven years. She earns a monthly income of  35,000 KES.

Monica requested her first loan of KES 3 0,000 with VisionFund Kenya , which she will use to add stock of retail goods, such as baking flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, and margarine, to sell in her shop. 

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to provide for her family's basic needs as well as repay her loan. 

She hopes to become successful in her business as it becomes stable and improved.

loans.use: to purchase stock of retail goods, such as baking flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, and margarine, to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 30 years old, is married and supports 3 children. She has been a small scale farmer for the last 15 years. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from vision fund Kenya to purchase more land for farming  in order to meet her clients demands in the market and the surplus to educate her children to higher levels of learning. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more land for farming  in order to meet her clients demands in the market and the surplus to educate her children to higher levels of learning.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
Melida no cuenta con el capital suficiente para reactivar su negocio, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar una plancha y gas propano para equipar su negocio, así como también embutidos, tomates, aderezo, aceite y bebidas,  para elaborar la venta de hot dogs, panes con pollo y refrescos, lograra mantenerse trabajando y cancelara la nueva deuda.
Los créditos le han sido de mucha ayuda para ir mejorando su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes, con los nuevos ingresos ha cubierto las necesidades de su hogar, cancelado su deuda y compro algunos electrodomésticos para su hogar.
texts.en: Melinda doesn't have the necessary resources to revive her business. She needs a new loan to buy a griddle and propane gas to equip her business. She also needs lunch meats, tomatoes, dressing, oil and drinks to sell hot dogs, bread with chicken and soft drinks. She will manage to keep working and will pay off her new debt. The loans have helped her to keep improving her business and better serve her customers. With the new income she has met the needs of her home, paid off her debt and bought some appliances for her home.

loans.use: to buy a griddle, propane gas, lunch meats, tomatoes, dressing, oil and drinks.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 35-year-old sewer from Busila village, Ungheni region in Moldova. She is married. Adela is the mother of 2 boys, 16 years old and 3 years old. Her husband, Nicolae, is a shoemaker.

Adela has been working as a sewer for 10 years for different companies. Now she want to start her own business. For this start-up, Adela needs a sewing machine for curtains.

Motivated and hardworking, she wants to be self reliable and to fulfill her dreams.

Adela will use this loan to purchase a sewing machine for curtains.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 31 years old, from the village of Chalaubani. She has a school-aged daughter and mother, who has a small agricultural activity. Nino was unable to start any stable job, as there is a high unemployment rate in the region. Sometimes she goes to Turkey to generate some income, but it the job is hard for her.

Nino planned to start her own business in Georgia, specifically trading with clothing and bed linens. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements are to have business experience or stable revenue, until the start-up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows the rural poor like Nino to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business.

She will purchase stock of products and start selling in her community with price mark-ups.
This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Nino will be able to make savings and provide better future for her daughter.

The credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased as a result of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start a trading business with clothing and bed linens.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi, who is a 23-year-old young man, lives in Tbilisi city. He has a wife and a little daughter. The couple get income only from their parent's transfers, from which they made savings and opened a confectionery in a good location two months ago. Giorgi always has high quality products and has his own loyal costumers.

Now he needs financial support to purchase a special pastry slicer machine to continue running his business in a more profitable way. Giorgi has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Giorgi has hired workers and the new machinery will be great help for them to increase the amount of products.

The loan will greatly assist Giorgi and he will be able to improve his economic situation, as his business will become more productive for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a special pastry slicing machine and increase the amount of products he can make.

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad habita vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace muchos años, y junto a ella habitan sus dos hijas y su nieto de 5 años de edad. María es una mujer emprendedora que todos los días se esfuerza por salir adelante, desde hace 8 años se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, lo que le ha permitido sostener a su familia y sacar adelante a sus hijas. María desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito a FUSAI para construir su servicio sanitario con pila, y es gracias a esta buena experiencia que solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: María is 53 years old and has lived in her own home for many years. Her two daughters and her 5-year-old grandson live with her. María is an enterprising woman who every day strives to get ahead. She has been working as a housekeeper for eight years which has allowed her to support her family and raise her daughters. María wants to change the roof of her home. She previously requested a loan from FUSAI to build a bathroom with a sink, and it is thanks to this positive experience that she is requesting a new loan to invest in galvanized steel, wood, nails and wire to change the roof of her home and give her family a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized steel, wood, nails and wire.

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
Julián de 69 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta segundo grado  ya que la  situación económica  de   su familia le impedía prepararse académicamente, está acompañado y tiene 9 hijos de los cuales solo una hija vive con ellos y también los nietos.


Julián desde su infancia se  ha dedicado a la  agricultura,  oficio  que  aprendió de  su padre, sus hijos mayores llegan a ayudarle de vez en cuando ya que por la edad no puede realizar el trabajo solo.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos, venenos, insecticidas, entre otros, y de esta manera asegurar una buena cosecha.

Él sueña con que el invierno sea bueno para no perder su cosecha, seguir trabajando en la agricultura lo cual es su pasión, además sueña con ver crecer a sus nietos y que ellos si puedan acceder a la educación.
texts.en: Julián is 69 years old. He managed to study up until the second grade when the economic situation of his family prevented him from preparing academically. He lives with a partner and has 9 children, of whom only one daughter lives with them, and also grandchildren. Julián since childhood has been working in agriculture, a trade he learned from his father. His older sons come to help from time to time as his age means he cannot do the job alone. He needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, poisons, insecticides, etc., and in this way ensure a good harvest. He dreams that winter will be good and keep his crop. He continues to work in agriculture which is his passion. He also dreams of seeing his grandchildren grow up and that they can have access to education.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, poisons, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita has been engaged in selling food for 10 years. She is 47 years old married woman and has four children. Her oldest child is 26 years old and her youngest child 16 years old. Her husband is pedicab (cycle rickshaw) driver. They work together to provide the needs of their children. 

Julita is asking a loan of PHP6000 to buy ingredients such as pork, vegetables, spices and flour. In the future, Julita wishes to expand her business so that they could better earnings.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables, spices and flour

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson aged 37, is honest and hardworking, a farmer since 2010 and comes from Kabale-Nyamarunda sub- county. He is like most of the men, had viable business ideas but didn’t have enough capital to improve on his farming, not until he joined Ugafode, where he attained training on how to establish and run commercial farming.

Jackson is married with 5 children aged between 17 and 3, 4 are school going. After the training, he now wants to borrow a loan of ugx2,000,000 to buy fertilizers because he wants to improve on his farming to meet international standards and see all his children graduate. He does not have any additional source of income and thus would wish funders to avail more products like electricity extension to rural households. 

He appreciates the relentless support.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in hand-carved Balinese masks. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood and bring in additional carvers at his workshop.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

Nyoman learned to carve at a very young age. "Handicrafts are becoming the main wage earner in my village. My experiences have led me to concentrate on carved masks. I learned to design from my father; this craft is taught and learned from generation to generation. The material I commonly used is hibiscus wood. It has good characteristics and it isn't too heavy."

"Since my health is not so good anymore, I can not carve alone, so I need more carvers to help me. We live in a community of the world that helps one another and shares, so it will be great to help them by providing a job. That is also how I feel about all of you who support me through this loan. Right now I am  building up my inventory and I can really use the capital. Thanks so much for your help and support."

Use the link below to view Nyoman's hand-carved Balinese masks on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/3268">http://www.novica.com/kiva/3268

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood and bring in additional carvers at his workshop

loans.name: Weseiyo Women Group

texts.en:
Lydia, raising her hand in the photo is a member of Weseiyo women group. She is 37 years old with four children who are in primary school and she is married and lives with her 4 children and husband. 

She runs a business of vegetables and cassava farming. She is taking a loan to purchase farming inputs e.g. seeds and fertilizers.She hopes that her business will thrive thus enabling her to increase the level of income. This will enable her to be in position to provide food and pay school fees for her children. 
Lydia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs e.g. seeds and fertilizers.She hopes that her business will thrive thus enabling her to increase her level of income.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce aged 45, is honest and hardworking and comes from Kiryanjagi-Kabamba sub- County. She is a grain miller and has been doing this since 1995 and she as most of the women, had viable business ideas but didn’t have enough capital to buy more maize and beans produce, not until she joined Ugafode, where she attained training on how to establish and run profitable business activities.

Joyce is married and takes care of 9 children aged between 23 and 5, 7 are school going. After the training, she now wants to borrow a loan of ugx1,500,000 to buy stock of cereals for selling, thus improving on her business. The income will increase her income and thus enable her to educate her children to higher institutions of learning.
 Her additional income from farming is too seasonal, competitive and thus unreliable. She would wish funders to avail more products like road improvement especially in rural areas.

loans.use: To buy cereals for selling

loans.name: Candelaria Isabel

texts.es: Candelaria de 58 años es una confeccionista reconocida en el municipio de Soledad, ella aprendió este arte con un instructor que llego a su pueblo natal Magangué en Bolívar, ella le encantaba coser y con todo el esmero aprendió a confeccionar edredones y sábanas.  Tiempo después continuó confeccionando prendas de vestir las cuales ofrecía por docenas.  Hace 10 años viajó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, porque su hijo empezaba a estudiar en la universidad y en un barrio del municipio de Soledad se instaló y ubicó en su vivienda su taller de confecciones.  Hoy en día cuenta con una clientela consolidada a quienes les ha confeccionado a la medida y según sus especificaciones y con el fruto de su trabajo pudo ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos.  Actualmente está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar telas, encajes, algodón sintético para elaborar sábanas y edredones.  Con esta inversión pretende tener muy buenas ganancias y dinamizar la producción.  Su meta a futuro es comprar su casa propia y dejar de pagar arriendo, así mismo inaugurar su almacén.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 58-years old.  She is a well-known seamstress in Soledad.  Candelaria learned the art from an instructor who came to her native town of Magangué in Bolívar.  Candelaria loved sewing, and with great attention to detail, she learned to make quilts and sheets.  A while later, she started making clothing, which she sold by the dozen.  
Ten years ago, Candelaria moved to Barranquilla because her son began studying at the university.  In a neighborhood of Soledad, Candelaria set up her home and in it, her dressmaking workshop.  She now has a strong clientele for whom she makes custom-made items according to their specifications.  With the fruits of her work, Candelaria has been able to offer comfort and well-being to her children. 
Candelaria is currently applying for her first credikiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to purchase fabric, lace and synthetic cotton for making sheets and quilts.  With this investment, she plans to increase her earnings and invigorate her production.  
Candelaria's goal for the future is to purchase her own home and stop paying rent.  In addition, she wants to open a small grocery.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, lace and synthetic cotton to make sheets and quilts.

loans.name: Blanca Sonia

texts.es:
Blanca, con la utilización de créditos está mejorando la venta de tortillas y ha incorporado la venta de pollos, sus clientes han aumentado, es evidente un progreso económico con el que ha ido cancelando sus deudas y disminuyendo las necesidades familiares.
Ella está consciente que para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos debe cubrir las demandas que hacen, por lo que ha solicitado un nuevo financiamiento para comprar maíz, cal, leña y bolsas para elaborar la venta de tortillas, así mismo invertirá en pollos y concentrado para fortalecer el negocio y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Using the loans, Blanca is improving her tortilla sales and has started selling chickens. Her customers have increased, and it is clear there has been financial progress, and with it she has cancelled her debts and diminished her family needs. She is conscious that in order to maintain her customers satisfied, she must fulfill their demands. Therefore, she has requested a new loan to buy corn, lime, firewood and bags to prepare the sale of tortillas. Also, she will invest in chickens and concentrated fee to strengthen the business and have financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood and bags to make her tortillas sale. Also, to invest in chickens and concentrated feed to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Roque

texts.es: Roque es un microempresario que toda su vida se ha dedicado a la comercialización de diferentes artículos y hace tres años encontró la oportunidad de vender a ferreterías y tiendas de barrio accesorios para el aseo como escobas, traperos, esponjillas, cepillos entre otros artículos.  Como su precio era bastante asequible decidió invertir en estos productos y ha obtenido excelentes resultados.  Su modalidad de comercialización es preventa, así determina los pedidos de sus clientes y semanalmente los entrega, en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para poder responder a la demanda e invertirá en diferentes marcas de cepillos, traperos, escobas y demás.  Su meta a futuro es abrir su propia distribuidora y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Roque is a micro-entrepreneur who has worked his entire life selling different articles. Three years ago he found the opportunity to sell cleaning accessories such as brooms, mops, and brushes to hardware stores and neighbourhood stores. As the price was quite affordable he decided to invest in these products and has obtained excellent results. His way of selling is pre-sales and he establishes the orders of his clients and delivers weekly. Currently he is applying for his first 'credikiva' (loan) through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to respond to the demand and invest in different brands of brushes, mops, brooms, etc. His future goal is to open his own distribution and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in different brands of brushes, mops, brooms, etc.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua aged 45, is honest and hardworking, produce dealer since 2008 and comes from Kanyabebe-kyakabadima sub- County. As with most men, he had viable business ideas but didn’t have enough capital to buy more maize and beans produce, not until he joined Ugafode, where he attained training on how to establish and run profitable business activities.

Joshua is married with 6 children aged between 20 and 3, 5 are school going. After the training, he now wants to borrow a loan of ugx2,000,000/= to buy maize and beans because he wants to improve on his business. This will earn enough income to educate his children and see all of them graduate. He has additional income from farming  though it is too seasonal, competitive and thus unreliable.

loans.use: To boost his his agricultural produce trade business

loans.name: Baby Nisar

texts.en:
Baby Nisar is 29 years old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband(also shown in the photo). She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  While her job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. 

Therefore, Baby Nisar has availed Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Jedida

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jedida; thirty nine years old, married with eight children. She  joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has undergone training on enterprise management. Jedida does maize and beans farming to earn a living.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase fertilizer for top dressing so that she can increase her farm produce. She plans to use the profits generated to cater for her family basic needs, save money for future use and re invest and expand her business.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make payment promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will boost crop yield thus meet family needs with ease.

loans.name: Uumwe Wi Vinya S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Rhoda, 53 years old, married and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 to benefit from training especially enterprise development.

She does livestock keeping; keeps poultry and dairy. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more indigenous chicks and also dairy feeds. She believes this will help increase eggs and milk production hence earn more income. With increased income, she will be able to feed and pay school feels for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more indigenous chicken and dairy feeds hence increase milk and eggs production for more income to pay school fees for her chidren.

loans.name: Faith Women Group

texts.en:
Agnes is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photo. She is married with four children of whom one is in high school. She joined hand in hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the 2012 to benefit from the training on enterprise development.

Her economic activity is mixed farming and also operates a food cafe. She is borrowing Kiva loan to renovate the food cafe premises.  This will enable her attract more customers hence earn more income to pay school fees for her children as well as provide better food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To pay for renovation expenses of the food cafe premises hence attract more customers and earn more income to pay for better food,clothing and education for her children.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La Señora Isidora de 56  años de edad es casada, vive con su esposo en casa propia y no tiene hijos que dependan de ellos, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, cuajada, tamales, rosquillas y pan, esta actividad la realiza todos los días, vende desde su casa y también de manera ambulante.
Doña Isidora tiene 10 años de dedicarse al comercio, es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora que desea salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, verduras, carnes, pollo, leche, etc. para poder elaborar sus productos. Espera que esta inversión le permita poder salir adelante y obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Isidora su sueño es terminar de reparar su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Junio del 2015.
texts.en:
Señora Isidora is 56-years old. She is married and lives with her husband in their own home. They do not have dependent children.

Doña Isidora makes her living selling tortillas, cottage cheese, pastries and bread. She works everyday selling her products from her home and as a street vendor. Doña Isidora has been in this line of work for ten years. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

Doña Isidora is requesting the loan to purchase corn, firewood, vegetables, meat, chicken, milk etc. for making her products. She hopes this investment will allow her to get ahead and to earn the income she needs to improve her quality of life.

Doña Isidora's dream is to finish making repairs to her home. San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2015.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, vegetables, meat, chicken, milk etc. for her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is married and has four children. She lives in El Alto, Bolivia in her husband’s parents’ house.

Paulina works as a carpenter building dog houses to sell. She has applied for a 6,000 BOB loan through Kiva's field partner IMPRO to buy more carpentry tools so that she can be more efficient at her work. Her husband is helping her, but she needs your support.

loans.use: to buy more carpentry tools so that she can be more efficient at her work.

loans.name: Kantu De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa ella es soltera y tiene 55 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ponches, negocio de carpintería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Kantu de San Jeronimo." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Señora Rosa. She is single and is 55 years old. She has two children. She works in her business of selling beauty products. She sells lipsticks, creams, and perfumes. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. Through this business she wants her family to get ahead. She has already been in this business for a number of years. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell beauty products. She is applying for the loan to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

The other members work in businesses of selling punch, carpentry, grocery store, and restaurant.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: José Paz

texts.es:
José de 58 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo dos viven en casa y también los nietos, 
además su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde su infancia, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, el lugar donde trabaja está a pocos minutos de su casa y sus hijos lo apoyan.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas para aplicar a sus cultivos.
Él espera que el invierno le favorezca para sacar una buena cosecha para alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
José, 58, is married and has 4 children, of whom only two live at home and also the grandchildren, in addition his wife is a homemaker. 

Jose has worked in agriculture since childhood; he learned this trade from his father. Where he works is just minutes from his home and his sons help him.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizer for his crops. He hopes that the winter is favorable for a good harvest to feed his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en:
Oswaldo is a married man. Oswaldo's wife is a farmer 

He is a mason and he needs a loan to buy a concrete mixer for his business because he wants to be more than a mason and he knows that if he buys the mixer he will get more money renting it.

Oswaldo is father of 3 kids and his house needs to have more services such as sewerage services so Oswaldo hopes that you can help him to improve his situation and his family's.

loans.use: to buy a concrete mixer

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a mechanic. He is father of a son. He is divorced but he lives with his son.

Jose pays rent and he needs a loan to buy a compressor machine for his workshop. Jose also pays rent for his workshop.

Jose would like to have his own house in the future. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a compressor

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin lives with his 3 kids. Edwin is a widower. The family lives in Arajllanga, where he has his own house.

Edwin sells milk and makes cheese. His children help him with the business but they go to school.

Edwin needs a loan to buy a milk cow. Edwin's house is made of adobe and he would like to have a bigger farm in the future. He is an experienced farmer and he is ready to work harder.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a single mother who lives with her daughter in her parents’ house. She works hard making cheese, but she is happy and healthy.

Irene has applied for a 7,000 BOB loan through Kiva's field partner IMPRO to buy a milk cow. She wants to use her increase in profits to install a sewage system in the family’s house. She hopes you can help her accomplish this goal.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana runs a liquor store and she needs a loan to buy merchandise for her business.

Ana is a single mother of a child. She is living with her parents. Ana would like to have a bigger business in the future.

She is responsible and she knows how to run a store. Although she didn't finish school, she would like to finish her studies and maybe got to university.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a seamstress. She makes sweaters and she also sells blankets.

She needs a loan to buy wool for her business.

Martha is not married but she lives with a man. The couple have 2 children and she pays rent, but in order to save money she takes care of the place where she lives like some kind of janitor.

Martha hopes you can help her. She goes to many fairs to sell her sweaters and she would like to have her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy wool for her business

loans.name: Placido

texts.es: Placido de 53 años, inició su negocio gracias a su amplia experiencia en Billares, cuando era joven laboró en varios negocios de este formato y palpo la oportunidad de iniciar su Billar al considerar que es una actividad de interés público y gran afluencia.  Con sus propios ahorros y mucha motivación en el año 2007, habría culminado las últimas estocadas en su local para dar inicio a la apertura de juego de salón, un sitio para compartir con amistades que revelar tácticas y métodos de juego.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar insumos y realizar remodelaciones en su local.  Su meta a futuro es abrir otra sucursal y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Placido is 53-years old.  He started his business because of his ample experience with billiards.  When he was young, he worked in various billiard businesses.  He felt that opening a pool hall would be a great opportunity considering that it's an well-attended activity that the public is interested in.  With his own savings, and a lot of motivation, he finalized his last details and opened the game room in 2007.  It's a place where friends can share strategies and methods of play.  
Placido is currently applying for his first credikiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so he can purchase supplies and do some remodeling in his establishment.  His goal for the future is to open another branch and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and do some remodeling in his establishment.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a cook and she works at a restaurant. She is still living with her parents but she helps them with money.

Elsa is taking cooking classes; she is studying to be a professional chef and she needs a loan to pay tuition.

Elsa is single. She doesn't have children. She is healthy and she likes to study, so she hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina de 50  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijas  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 15  años al negocio de venta de rosquillas, y tamales, sus clientes son todas sus amistades y vecinos y también personas que transitan por el mercado, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Josefina está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, cuajada, manteca, leña, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente  con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Uno de sus sueños es seguir mejorando en su negocio y aumentar su clientela.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del  2015
texts.en:
Señora Josefina is 50-years old. She lives with her husband and daughters in their own home. For the last fifteen years, doña Josefina has made her living with a business selling pastries and tamales. Her customers are her friends and neighbors and also people who pass through the market.

Doña Josefina lives in a small town that belongs to a municipality in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead. She works day after day to improve her quality of life.

Doña Josefina is requesting the loan to purchase products such as corn, cottage cheese, butter, firewood etc. With the help of the loan, she plans to improve her income and also her quality of life. She wants to continue working with Prisma.

One of doña Josefina's dreams is to keep improving her business and increase her clientele. San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to purchase corn, cottage cheese, butter, firewood etc. for her business.

loans.name: Doris Milena

texts.en:
Doris is 19 years old and lives in the municipality of San Antonio de Prado, at the south end of Medellín. Her mother represents the most important thing in the world to her, for all the sacrifices that she has made for her daughter. That’s why she feels a big responsibility to her, and a motivation to look for success in her life, because her biggest dream is to help her mother and support her.

Doris wants to study so she can improve her education and be able to start her own business someday. She´s willing to study a technique in cooking and pastry. Right now she doesn’t have the money to pay for education and her mother doesn't either, so she´s asking for a loan that can help pay for her education. She has been working for many years with her mother in an arepas business (tortilla of corn) but she wants to learn more to do better.

You can help Doris to pay for her education so that she can help her mother and accomplish all of her dreams. She is really young but full of desire to have a good quality of life and to give her mother that too.

Loan now and let her educate herself and start her business life on the right foot.

loans.use: to pay for her studies

loans.name: Marvin Daniel

texts.es:
Marvin, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, tiene 4 hijos con su pareja.

Marvin, se dedica a la construcción desde hace 14 años, comenzó como ayudante de albañil y por su responsabilidad sus clientes le fueron tomando confianza y fue por esa razón que decidió dedicarse a la construcción, porque tiene capacidad y el trabajo le encanto.- Anteriormente ayudaba a su papá para cuidar el 
ganado, alimentarlo y hacer todo lo que tiene que ver con la ganadería.

Marvin, necesita el dinero para pagar la operación de emergencia que le realizaran a su madre y posteriormente cubrir los gastos médicos que surjan luego de la operación.

Marvin, desea que su madre se recupere y lograr ser un arquitecto.
texts.en:
Marvin, who is 32 years old, went to school through ninth grade. He is married, and he and his wife have four children.

Marvin has worked in construction for 14 years. He began as a mason's assistant, and because of his responsibility, his customers took confidence in him. It was for this reason that he decided to work in construction, because he had the ability and he loved the work. Previously, he helped his father to care for the livestock, feed them, and do everything that has to be done in the cattle business.

Marin needs the money to pay for an emergency operation for his mother and later to cover the medical expenses that will arise after the operation.

Marvin hopes that his mother can recover and that he can manage to become an architect.

loans.use: to pay for an emergency operation for his mother and later to cover the medical expenses that will arise after the operation.

loans.name: Nelson Asunción

texts.es:
Nelson de 42 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ha procreado 4 hijos de los cuales ya solo dos viven con él. 

Nelson siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, además se realiza crianza de ganado y sus hijos le ayudan luego que regresan de estudiar.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas para aplicar a sus cultivos.

Él sueña con seguir  trabajando con la institución ya  que  se  le  ha brindado  el apoyo  y él se siente muy agradecido.
texts.en:
Nelson is 42 years old, and was able to study through the second grade. He is married, and his wife handles the household chores. He has four children, of which, only two live with him.

Nelson has always earned a living in agriculture. He learned this work from his father. He also raises cattle and his children help him and then return to their studies. He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies to use on his crops.

He dreams about continuing to work with the institution that has provided him the support, and he feels very thankful.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to use on his crops.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Candida, de 67 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela, está casada, su esposo es albañil, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo una vive con ella, los demás ya son independientes.

Candida, se dedica a la venta de verduras todos los días por la mañana y en la tarde de 1:00 p.m. a 7:00 p.m. vende en un cafetín que tiene cerca de su casa, desde hace 2 años, en el cual también le ayuda su hija. 

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en la tienda y para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas y así poder incrementar sus ganancias. 

En un futuro ella planea construir un cafetín más grande para colocar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Candida is 67-years old.  She never went to school.  She is married, and her husband is a bricklayer.  They have five children, only one of whom still lives with them.  The others live on their own. 

Candida makes her living selling vegetables every day during the morning.  In the afternoons, from 1:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m., she works in a small café, which she has near her home.  She has had the café for two years, and her daughter helps her there. 

She needs the loan to invest in the store and to purchase a griddle for making "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) so she can increase her income. 

In the future, Candida plans to build a bigger café so she can stock more merchandise.

loans.use: to invest in her shop and to purchase a griddle for making "pupusas" (a stuffed tortilla).

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora María Jacinta de 67 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 13 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas y pan, su venta es el municipio de Pespire con las personas que tienen negocios o pulperías, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña María Jacinta está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, cuajada,  leña, etc. para poder seguir elaborando su producto con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2015.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Jacinta is 67 years old. She lives with her husband and their daughter in their own house. For 13 years she has worked in the business of selling rosquillas [cornmeal and cheese donuts] and bread. Her sales are in the township of Pespire to the people who have businesses or grocery stores. She is an entrepreneurial woman with the desire to get ahead, and she strives every day to improve her quality of life.

Doña Maria Jacinta is applying for the loan to purchase products such as corn, fresh cheese, firewood, etc., in order to be able to continue making her products. With the help of this loan, she plans to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a successive client with the desire to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele and at the same time improve her future alongside her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, fresh cheese, firewood, etc., for her business

loans.name: Dukore I Group

texts.fr:
Pulchérie fait partie du groupe  DukoreI et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 29ans et est mariée à Dismas, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, dont  1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce d'avocat et bananes depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’avocats et  de bananes  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle et construire une maison.
texts.en:
Pulchérie is part of the group DukoreI and lives in Gitega. She is 29 years old and married to Dismas, a farmer. Together they have four children, of whom one is a student.

Pulchérie has been doing commerce in avocados and bananas for ten years. 

She is on her 12th loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of avocados and bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a parcel of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of avocados and bananas to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Mwakaka Group

texts.fr:
Adélaïde  fait partie du groupe  Mwakaka  et  habite à  Muramvya. C’est une veuve de 48 ans. Elle a 4 enfants, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est  à son septième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  faire vivre sa famille, diversifier les articles  à vendre, et voir ses enfants étudier
texts.en:
Adélaïde is part of the group Mwakaka and lives in Muramvya. She is a widow, 48 years old, and she has four children, all students.

Adélaïde has been doing commerce in clothing for ten years. 

She is on her 7th loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of clothing to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Zemestaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZOENABO est la représentante du groupe ZEMESTAABA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé à 18 ans.  02 vont  à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Madame est restauratrice depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Elle  veut s’acheter 05 sacs de riz, 05 bidons d’huile et 01 bouc par jour pour sa restauration.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation (une villa).
texts.en:
Ms. ZOENABO is the representative of the group ZEMESTAABA. A married woman, she is the mother of two children. The elder is 22, and the younger is 18. Both go to school. She has three persons to support. 

Ms. ZOENABO has been a restauranteur for ten years. She gets her supplies at the district market. She wants to purchase 5 sacks of rice, 5 containers of oil, and one goat a day, for her restaurant. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to build a residential house (stand-alone).

loans.use: to purchase some rice and oil and also a goat each day for her restaurant

loans.name: Felicita Antonia

texts.es:
Felicita, tiene una venta de frutas, vive con su hijo de 29 años de edad y sus nietos de 12 y 15 años de edad, todos comparten una misma vivienda, ella es la jefa de su hogar trabaja para cubrir las necesidades de su familia y disfruta mucho de sus papeles como madre y abuela. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace 15 años, trabaja todos los días.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar melocotones, manzanas, guineos, sandias, etc., tendrá mercadería más variada lo cual le permitirá atraer nuevos clientes y tener un aumento de ventas con las que sus ingresos incrementaran y podrá cumplir con sus compromisos.
Las aspiraciones de ella son que sus dependientes estudien en la universidad y se conviertan en profesionales y seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicita has a small fruit store. She lives with her 29 year old son and her grandchildren of 12 and 15 years old; they all share the same house. She is the head of their household; she works to meet the needs of her family and she greatly enjoys her roles as mother and grandmother.

Her business has been located in the municipal market for 15 years; she works every day. She is requesting a loan to buy peaches, apples, bananas, watermelons, etc. She will have more varied merchandise, which will allow her to attract new customers and to have an increase in sales. With this her income will increase and she will be able to meet her commitments.

Her aspirations are that her dependents study at university and become professionals, and to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: buy peaches, apples, bananas, watermelons, etc., in order to have more varied merchandise and attract new customers.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is a 27-year-old married man, and a refugee. He has  2 children.

He is an honest, hard-working, and successful man. Elnur earns money for his family by raising livestock, and selling their meat and wool at a local bazaar. Elnur started keeping dairy cows 6 years ago. Since then, he has developed and grown his business steadily to a point where he is able to get more then 13 litres of milk every day, which he sells to his customers in a local bazaar. 

In Azerbaijan the most popular dishes are made from meat; such as Bozbash, Kutab, Kebab etc. When he was young, Elnur started this business with a small amount of capital, and he now loves his business, and wants to improve it. He would like to grow his business and buy more cows, and improve both his business and family conditions. 

He needs some fun and Kiva Lenders support.

loans.use: to grow his business and buy more cows, and to improve both his business and family conditions

loans.name: Grace Ann

texts.en:
Grace Ann owns a sari-sari (variety) store business in Baybay, Leyte. She has been doing this business for six years. Her husband is a farmer and sometimes works at a construction site as a construction worker. They work hard to earn a living. 

They have three young children to nurture. The oldest child is 9 years old and the youngest child is 2 years old. Grace Ann is requesting a loan to buy grocery items such as toiletries, biscuits, chips, candies, noodles, canned goods, laundry soap, spices and soft drinks. In the future, she wants her business to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, biscuits, chips, candies, noodles, canned goods, laundry soap, spices and soft drinks

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio owns and operates a furniture shop. He produces and sells furniture items like chairs, dining table and other household decor. He has been engaged in that kind of livelihood for more than 10 years now. 

He is a married man with five dependents. His oldest is 16, while the youngest is 9. 

Antonio has requested a loan to purchase a side car (a small, low vehicle attached to the side of a motorcycle for carrying passengers) and wood. These could be of great help for Antonio's day to day activity. It could provide ease in transporting his finished products to his respective clients. In addition to that, he could also cater to various orders and enable his earnings to improve. In this way, he could provide his family with good food and better living conditions.

He is grateful for the availability of the funds, with which he could continue to finance his ongoing business to become more sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to  purchase a side car (a small, low vehicle attached to the side of a motorcycle for carrying passengers) and wood

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 40 years old and from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her eldest is 17 and her youngest is 6. 

For 16 years, she has been in the business of selling coconut wine, raising hogs and farming rice with her husband. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, five piglets and fertilizer for her farm. This is Merilyn's way of expanding her business so she can better support the needs of her family.

Like most mothers, she hope to see her children become successful in their studies someday. She also dreamed of making their life better by using her loan properly so it can give them the most return of their investment.

loans.use: to  buy feed, five piglets and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Greselle

texts.en:
Greselle is a 31-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has two children, ages 13 and 11 years old. Her husband is a chainsaw operator, while she is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been doing this business for six years. 

With the help of the funds she is requesting, Greselle wishes to buy eight piglets and feed. In this way, it gives her a chance to expand her business and to upturn her earnings.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Dinnah

texts.en:
Dinnah is 30 years old, married and supports two children. 

She has been a small-scale farmer for the last 10 years. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production and supply. 

She plans to use the anticipated proceeds to repay the loan and educate her children to higher levels of learning. 

Her hope is to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production.

loans.name: Lancelot

texts.en:
Lancelot is the owner of The Jamaican Jerk Center in Queens. He has been around food for years in both his personal and professional life. Growing up, he watched both his grandmother and mother run a cafeteria for several companies in Jamaica. And upon his arrival to the States, he worked in a wide variety of settings, from fine dining to fast food restaurants. 

Through his experience he has gained skills that are valuable in multiple segments of the food industry and has successfully signed lunch contracts with several companies. Lance currently has daily clients depending on him while he runs his business from home through a delivery system. 

Lance did not begin his business with a strong financial base. However, he is proud to have been able to register his business and attain all of the required permits and licenses necessary to achieve his entrepreneurial goals. He is currently seeking a loan to purchase additional cooking equipment in order  to meet the demands of his clients during both lunch and dinner hours, six days a week. 

His vision for the future is to open a restaurant. Although he doesn’t have the funds now, he knows that with continued focus and commitment to his customers, he’ll someday be able to enter the food industry with a storefront instead.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking equipment

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 49 years old and from the community of San Miguel in Bohol. She is married with five children; most of them are already adults, but the remaining two are still ages 12 and 18. 

Merilyn's husband is not earning enough from farming so she works hard to help him by selling snacks. She sells deep-fried bananas in caramelized sugar, locally known as banana cue. She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients such as cooking oil, sugar and bananas. It is her dream that she will be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar and bananas

loans.name: Veronico

texts.en:
Veronico is from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has run a sari-sari or variety store business for many years now. He also fishes for a living and raises hogs for additional income. 

There is so much opportunity in his place, especially for fishermen like him. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, feed and gasoline. With this, he will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in his store, thus augmenting his sales and income for his family. 

His profit will be for his family's daily consumption and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, feed and gasoline

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is 25 years old and from the town of Bien Unido. Her husband is a fisherman. They have a simple life, but she dreams of more for her family, specially for her 2-year-old son. 

She helps her husband in their fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets for their fishing, bamboo matting and hardwood for house renovation, and rice for family consumption.

Stephanie hopes to see their business continue thriving and expanding so she can give her children a better life through education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bamboo matting, hardwood and rice

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 29 years old and has a motorcycle transport business in Mombasa town. He is married and blessed with one child. He has been in this business for the last two years, and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition so as to serve more customers and make more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits to build a green grocery stall for his wife. 

His future hopes and dreams are to expand his transport business by buying another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition so as to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: José Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo, no estudio, está casado y su esposa únicamente se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya tienen sus propias familias y actualmente solo vive con su esposa, su hijo menor y una nieta.

Leonardo, se ha dedicado a la agricultura durante toda su vida, también se dedica a la ganadería desde hace siete años; su hijo menor le ayuda en la agricultura y la ganadería. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes para el cultivo de 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. 

En el futuro sueña con ampliar su pequeña ganadería y comercializar lácteos y derivados de la leche.
texts.en:
Leonardo did not receive an education.  He is married and his wife only works as a homemaker.  They have five children, four have their own families and only one lives at home along with a granddaughter. 

Leonardo has worked in agriculture all his life and for seven years has been involved in livestock farming.  His youngest son help in both activities.

The loan he is requesting is to buy farm supplies like manure and fertilizers for his 14,000 square meter cornfield.  In the future his goal is to expand his small livestock activity and sell milk and dairy products.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like manure and fertilizers for his 14,000 square meter cornfield.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es: Sandra de 29 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su familia conformada por su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una persona que se dedica a la comercialización de fruta desde hace tres años, por lo cual es muy reconocida en la zona donde se instala la cual es en las afueras de un centro educativo, por lo cual las personas que transitan por dicho lugar consumen su producto siendo los estudiantes de dicho instituto  sus principales clientes. Sandra con el objetivo de ver mejorado su negocio y cada día ofrecer más productos a su clientes desea hacer una inversión en la compra de mayor cantidad de frutas, pero debido a que no cuenta con el capital necesario ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder comprar: guineo, sandia, melón, piña, papaya, etc. para aumentar las ventas de su negocio el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos los cuales le ayudan de gran manera para solventar los fastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sandra is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her family, which includes her life partner and their two children ages 11 and 7 years old.  For three years she has made a living selling fruit, which she is well known for in the area where she works.  She positions her business outside of a school, so that people passing through will buy her produce, and students of the school are her principal clients.  

Sandra aims to see her business improve and every day bring more products to her customers, therefore she wants to invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of fruit.  But because she does not have the necessary capital she has decided to apply for a loan with FUSAI, which will enable her to buy bananas, watermelon, melon, pineapple, papaya and more to increase her sales.  This business is her main source of income, which greatly helps to pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy bananas, watermelon, melon, pineapple, papaya, etc, to increase the sales of her business.

loans.name: Elvia Nataly

texts.es: Mostrando sus deseos de superación Elvia poco a poco y con el apoyo de la institución ha logrado ir mejorando su vivienda en la que habita junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad. Elvia se gana la vida recorriendo las calles de su municipio para ofrecer sus productos como son: pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa interior, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. La vivienda en la que Elvia aún le falta para terminar de construirla, ya que un cuarto de ella no tiene techo ni puertas, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, polines, pines, y puertas para instalar puertas y techo a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Through her desire to improve her situation little by little, Elvia has received the support of the institution to improve the house where she lives with her husband and two children, ages 9 and 3.  She earns a living as a street vendor in her town and sells products like pants, shirts, blouses and underwear.  She also has her husband's support.

Elvia's home is still unfinished and one of the rooms is lacking a roof and doors.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, beams, nails and doors to to finish the room.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, beams, nails and doors to install a door and a roof over her house.

loans.name: Jose Ever

texts.es:
José,  de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado, su pareja tiene una pequeña tienda y él vive con dos hijas y un nieto en su casa.

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años, actividad que se la enseño su padre, también trabajo como ayudante de albañil cuando no trabajaba en la agricultura.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas, para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

En el futuro desea aumentar sus cultivos y mejorarlos con más asistencia técnica, así como también incrementar su producción para obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 44, has a second grade education.  His partner runs a small store and they live with two daughters and a grandson at home.

For 25 years Jose has worked in agriculture which he learned from his father.  He also worked as a bricklayer assistant when not working in agriculture.

He needs the loan to buy farm supplies for his 7,000 square meter cornfield.

In the future he wants to expand his cropland and improve it through more technical assistance.  He also wants to increase production to earn more profit and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for his 7,000 square meter cornfield.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es: Leopoldo se siente muy agradecido ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual le permitió reparar el techo de su vivienda en la que habita desde hace 40 años, los mismos que tiene de vida, ya que es una herencia de su madre. Leopoldo tiene ya 17 años de vender colchas y cubrecamas, actividad que le ha permitido salir adelante, por lo que él desea contar con una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: colchas y sabanas, además de productos básicos para instalar una tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en: Leopoldo feels very grateful, as he previously asked for a loan, which allowed him to repair the roof of his home, where he has lived for 40 years, as long as he has been alive, and which he inherited from his mother. Leopoldo has now been selling blankets and covers for 17 years, an activity which has allowed him to get ahead, which is why he wants to have a larger amount of products to offer to his clients. This is why he asks for a loan from FUSAI, to invest in: blankets and sheets, and also staple products to open a store in his home.

loans.use: to invest in blankets and sheets, and also on staple products to open a store in his home

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
El señor Lorenzo de 63  años de  edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de leña y de maíz, su venta es de forma ambulante y varios clientes desde hace mucho tiempo,  sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y también personas del comercio de San Lorenzo, les  ofrece buena atención y buenos productos y el servicio agregado que les lleva el producto a casa de sus clientes para entregárselos.
Don Lorenzo es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de cuatro llantas nuevas para mejorar su vehículo de trabajo y también piensa comprar varias cargas de maíz.
Uno de sus sueños es  crecer con su negocio para seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 63, lives in his own house with his wife and children. For ten years he has made a living selling firewood and corn. He works as a street vendor and has many long-standing customers.  His customers are neighbors and merchants in San Lorenzo.  He offers attentive customer service and good products, and the added value is that he delivers goods directly to his customers.

Lorenzo is an entrepreneur with a desire to improve his quality of life.  He wants to continue working with Prisma and is requesting a loan to buy four tires to improve his work vehicle.  He also wants to buy several loads of corn.  

One of his goals is to expand his business to continue improving his quality of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2015

loans.use: To buy corn and four tires for his business.

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Roxana, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, está acompañada, es agricultor, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y apoya a su compañero de vida en la agricultura. 

Roxana, tiene una pupuseria, pero anteriormente trabajaba como armador, pero por no tener un lugar propio donde vivir, tuvieron que regresar a su lugar de origen y comenzar de nuevo en la agricultura, de donde siempre ha dependido la mayor parte de su vida.

Ella necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar abono y pesticidas para cultivar maíz y maicillo, ya que trabajan propio pero por motivos de sequía perdieron su inversión y necesitan apoyo financiero para comenzar de nuevo. 

En el futuro le gustaría tener un negocio propio para tener más ingresos y estar económicamente estables y que a sus hijos no les falte lo necesario.
texts.en:
Roxana, 29, studied until her first year of high school.  Her partner works in agriculture and she is a homemaker and also helps him with the farm activity.

Roxana has a "pupuseria" (selling pupusas) but used to work as a metal worker.  Since they did not have their own home to live in they had to go back where they were from originally and start fresh in agriculture, which is what she has depended on most of her life.

Now she is in need of a loan to buy manure and pesticides for her corn and millet crops.  Due to the drought they lost their investment and need financial support to start over.

In the future she would like to have her own business and earn more income for a stable economy so her children will lack for nothing.

loans.use: To buy manure and pesticides for her crop and millet crops.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rosa, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera y ha tenido que buscar la manera de sacar adelante a su hijo, tiene tienda y colabora en un comité de mejoramiento de calles en su comunidad para el desarrollo de la misma.

Rosa, siempre ha tenido tienda porque su padre le enseño desde que era muy pequeña, hace unos meses falleció y por lo tanto ha tenido algún desbalance en su tienda. 

Ella necesita el dinero para mejorar el inventario y tenerla como antes y que sus clientes no se vayan con las manos vacías. 

Ella sueña con tener una familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old and has a high school education. She is a single mother and has had to look for a way to help her son to move forward. Rosa has a shop and also collaborates at a committee looking to improve the streets in the community so that the area can develop.

Rosa has always had a shop because her father taught her this work from a young age. Rosa's father died a few months ago and so the shop is not in a great state.

Rosa needs this loan in order to increase stock and to have the shop as it was before so that customers do not leave empty handed.

Rosa dreams of having a family.

loans.use: to improve inventory and to have it as before.

loans.name: Luis Emmanuel

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 24 años de edad, creció con sus padres quienes le formaron y le inculcaron principios que lo han llevado a ser una persona muy educada y reconocida en su comunidad, aprendió los trabajos de construcción de su padre, de esta manera adquirió experiencia y hoy en día  se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos de la cual le sirve para llevar el sustento diario a su familia la cual está formada por su esposa y su hijo. 


El Joven se dedica a la albañilería desde la edad de 18 años, actividad que aprendió junto a su padre a quien acompañaba en todas sus jornadas de trabajo, también su esposa le da un aporte económico a su familia pues ella se dedica a administrar una tienda que es de su propiedad de esta forma juntos pueden satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar y solventar con las obligaciones financieras.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, café, consomés, bebidas, etc para surtir la tienda. 


Las metas que tiene a futuro son las de tener una tienda más amplia y surtida, comprar un vehículo que le sirva para trasladarse y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 24 year old and grew up with his parents, who taught him the principles that have helped him to be a well-mannered and well-recognised person in his community. Luis learned the building trade from his father, and earned experience with him. Today, this work has become Luis' main source of income, which helps him to support his family, made up of his wife and son.

Luis has been a builder since he was 18 years old, a trade that he learned from his father whom he accompanied to work every day. Luis' wife also supports the family financially as she manages a shop that she owns. This work allows the couple to provide necessities for the home and to cover bills.

This loan will be used to buy basic products such as rice, sugar, coffee, soups, drinks and more in order to stock up the shop.

In the future, Luis' goal is for the shop to be bigger and better stocked, and to buy a vehicle to get around. Luis also wants to offer his family the best possible life.

loans.use: to buy basic products such as rice, sugar, coffee, soups, drinks and more in order to stock up the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her vehicle as she needs it to travel to see the doctor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and other staple products.

loans.name: Kantigi Group

texts.fr: DRAMANE est le Monsieur qui a le mouton sur la photo ; c’est un cultivateur Malien  âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants âgés de 2   à  14 ans dont 3 scolarisés. Sa femme est une ménagère. Il est non scolarisé, et exerce l’activité d’embouche et d’élevage il y a 10 ans de cela. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchésde sa localité et liquide ses animaux dans les mêmes marchés. Le bénéfice qu’il gagne lui permet de faire face aux charges de sa famille.
