DRAMANE  fait recourt à L’IMF pour développer son activité en augmentant le nombre de ses animaux. Ayant appris ce métier, il se sent à l’aise de l’exercer car il se voit  participer au développement économique de sa communauté en plus de l’amour qu’il le porte.  DRAMANE est souvent confronté au problème de vente des animaux    et souhaite de devenir  lui-même un grand exportateur dans les jours à venir.
texts.en:
Dramane is the man holding the sheep in picture. He a Malian farmer who is 36 years old, married and the father of 6 children aged between 2 and 14, 3 of whom go to school. His wife is a cleaner. Dramane did not get an education; he has been breeding and fattening animals for 10 years. He gets his supplies at his local markets and sells his livestock at the same markets. The profits he earns allow him to cover his family's daily expenses.

Dramane is turning to the MFI in order to develop his business activities by increasing his livestock numbers. Having learned his trade, he is happy to be doing it because, as well as loving what he does, he sees himself contributing to his community's economic development. Dramane often has to face problems selling his livestock and would like one day to become a large exporter of livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Una mujer admirable es como describen a Francisca una mujer que a sus 54 años de edad no deja de mostrar su fortaleza y tenacidad, dedicándose a la venta de vitaminas y productos de belleza, actividad que le permite sostener los gastos económicos de su vivienda. Francisca hace 22 años logro invertir en su casita en la que habita muy feliz desde esa fecha. Francisca desea que sus ventas mejoren, es por ello que ha decidido invertir en su mercadería y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: vitaminas, maquillaje, lociones, desodorantes, cremas, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Francisca is described as a remarkable woman. She is 54 years old and shows strength and tenacity, making a living selling vitamins and beauty products, a business which allows her to meet the household expenses.

Twenty-two years ago, Francisca invested in a small house; she has been living there very happily ever since. Francisca wants her sales to improve, so she has decided to invest in merchandise and is therefore requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in vitamins, make-up, lotions, deodorants and creams, amongst other products.

loans.use: to invest in vitamins, make-up, lotions, deodorants and creams, amongst other products.

loans.name: Gina

texts.fr:
Gina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Gina is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Gina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Gina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
texts.en:
Gina is 36 years old, married and has three children, two of whom who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gina has a fishing business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline and other fishing supplies.

Gina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Muvakani Mbukilye S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Caroline, 39 years old, married with three children, two of whom are in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development. 

Caroline operates a beauty salon. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy beauty products like hair braids. This will enable her to meet customers' needs and earn more income to pay for her children's education. 

Caroline is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like hair braids to meet customers' needs and increase income to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary. She is married and blessed with nine children. She grows maize, beans and potatoes. 

Having received training on enterprise and financial management from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she learnt how to draw her budget and plan well for the future. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer that will help boost farming. She plans to use profits generated from the enterprise to boost the business and pay for her children's school fees.

She is very grateful to Kiva and Hand in Hand for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Anne

texts.fr:
Anne vit avec son mari et sa fille à la campagne. Elle pratique toute sorte d’élevage telle que l’élevage de vache laitière, de porcs et de la volaille. Elle fait aussi de l’achat et revente de lait. Elle aime diversifier ses activités car elle vend également des vêtements friperie et du riz. 
Pendant ces 3 années de partenariat avec Vahatra, elle a pu étendre sa ferme en élevant quelques porcs. Les bénéfices lui ont permis d’acheter quelques mobiliers pour la maison. Avec ce prêt, elle compte collecter plus de lait pour les revendre, stocker du paddy à vendre quand le prix du riz sur le marché augmentera  et acheter une balle de friperie à vendre en détail.
Anne est très contente d’avoir amélioré le bien-être de sa famille et diversifier ses activités. Son but est d’augmenter le capital de toutes ses activités.
texts.en:
Anne lives with her husband and daughter in the country. She farms all types of livestock such as dairy cows, pigs and poultry. She also buys and sells milk. She likes to diversify her activities and also sells second-hand clothing and rice. During her 3-year partnership with Vahatra, she has been able to expand her farming activities by rearing pigs. The profits have enabled her to buy some furniture for the house.

She plans to use this loan to collect more milk for resale, to stock paddy rice to sell when the market price goes up, and to buy a bale of second-hand clothing to sell to retail customers.

Anne is very happy to have improved her family's well-being and to have diversified her business activities. Her goal is to increase the income she gets from all her various activities.

loans.use: to buy milk, paddy rice to sell when the price goes up, and a bale of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Elba

texts.es: Rosa 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de sopa de mondongos desde hace 4 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando y repellando las paredes, pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra para que ella junto con su familia tengan una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has been making a living for four years selling sopa de mondongo (tripe soup); she manages to pay for some of the household expenses with the income she gets from sales.

Rosa wants to improve her house by cementing and plastering the walls but, as she doesn't have sufficient capital, she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials and pay workers, so that she and her family will have a respectable home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay workers

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
FATOUMATA est  la Dame qui a ses mains sur le sac de riz sur la photo, elle est  malienne non scolarisée, âgée de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants  âgées de 08 à 24 ans dont tous fréquentent l’école. Son mari est un cultivateur et éleveur. Elle fait le commerce de riz et l’élevage depuis plus de  4 ans. Elle  s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnant et revend  dans les mêmes marchés. Le profit qu’elle réalise la permet d’aider son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
Elle emprunte de l’argent auprès du RMCR pour financer et accroitre son activité au moment propice en achetant beaucoup de sacs de riz.  Souvent confronté au problème de baisse de prix de ses produits sur le marché lors des ventes, FATOUMATA souhaite  devenir une grande commençante et éleveur dans le  futur afinr acheter un terrain en ville avec le profit.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is the woman holding the bag of rice in the photo. She is Malian and did not go to school. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of 8 children aged between 8 and 24, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer and livestock breeder. Fatoumata has been selling rice and rearing livestock for over 4 years. She gets her supplies at the surrounding markets and resells at the same markets. The profits that she earns enable her to help her husband take care of the family's needs.

She is borrowing money from RMCR in order to finance and expand her business at this favourable time by buying many bags of rice. She often faces the problem of decreasing prices for her products on the market when she makes her sales. Fatoumata would like to become a large retailer and livestock farmer in the future so that she can buy some land in town with the profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice for resale.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité San Juan es un grupo nuevo, se encuentra en el primer ciclo, la integran 16 mujeres humildes, solidarias y emprendedoras, todas ellas se dedican a actividades rurales donde ponen sus esfuerzos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Clementina, junto con su marido y sus hijos trabajan la tierra y crían todo tipo de animales domésticos ya sea chanchos, gallinas, patos, etc., y luego las comercializa, y de esa forma se ganan la vida de una manera digna y humilde, es una familia muy unida y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar gallinas, cerdos, patos y otros para poder criar y después venderlos para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Juan committee is a new group. It is in its first cycle, and is made up of 16 humble, supportive and enterprising women. All of them work at rural activities and put their efforts into improving their living conditions.

Clementina, her mother and her children work the land and raise all types of domestic animals, be they pigs, chickens, ducks, etc. She then sells them and that it how they earn their living in a dignified and humble way. It is a very close family and they are fighters.

She is asking for this loan to buy chickens, pigs, ducks and more to raise them and the sell them to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, ducks and other animals to raise.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas desde hace 9 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, la clienta quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las puertas y repellando las paredes pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 44 years old. She lives in her own house with her family group. She has sold empanadas for 9 years and with what she earns from her sales she is able to get ahead with the household expenses. She wants to improve her home by changing the doors and re-plastering the walls. Since she doesn't have enough capital, she is asking for a loan to buy construction materials and to pay for labor costs to have a home that is worthy for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Tekoporave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Tekoporave Rekavo lo que en castellano quiere decir “en busca de una mejor calidad de vida”, ya que eso es lo que todas buscan para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido de todas.
Entre ellas se destaca a la Sra. Hermenegilda por su laboriosidad y esfuerzo por salir adelante junto con su familia, ella cumple el rol de presidenta y al igual que todas las integrantes, ella se dedica al humilde trabajo de cría y venta de animales, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales para la cría, como ser gallinas, cerdos y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en: This group is named "Tekoporave Rekavo" which means in Castilian "in search of a better quality of life" because that is what all of the members are seeking, to be able to help their families through the united work of all. Among these women is Hermenegilda, who through her efforts and industriousness to get ahead together with her family, has taken on the role of president. Like all of the members, her work is a humble labor raising and selling animals. She is a very hardworking woman and a fighter who wants to get ahead. She is seeking this loan to purchase animals to raise, such as chickens, pigs and others. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase animals to raise and sell such as chickens, pigs and others.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se encuentra dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son 21 mujeres, todas ellas luchadoras y emprendedoras que quieren salir adelante por medio de las capacitaciones y de la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edita, quien es modista, ella es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, y gracias a sus buenas confecciones se ha hecho ya de muy buena clientela que siempre les hace muchos pedidos. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Edita solicita de este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilo y agujas, y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y más venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is in the poverty elimination program. They are 21 women. All of them are fighters and entrepreneurs who want to get ahead through trainings and with the help of Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the members is Edita. She is a seamstress and she is very good at what she does. Thanks to the good work that she has done she has a very good clientele who always order a lot from her. She is a very hardworking and dedicated woman who wants to improve her living conditions.

Edita is asking for this loan to buy fabrics, thread, needles and more. This will help her to increase production and sell more, which will help improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles and more.

loans.name: Natividad De Mercedes

texts.es: Don natividad de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la crianza de ganado bovino desde hace 30 años inicio desde pequeño ya que le ayudaba a su padre, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Natividad is 62 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife. He has grown corn and raised livestock for 30 years. He started when he was small, because he helped his father. He sells his products in the different markets that are close to his home. He is asking for al loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc, so that he can continue with his work, since this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel tiene 43 años, está casado con la Sra. Teodora de 51 años, ellos tienen 3 hijos, el Sr. Miguel es de profesión carpintero y su esposa es ama de casa, y ambos se ayudan mutuamente.
Don Miguel se inició en su trabajo hace más de 25 años, con un pequeño capital que el tenia y que después con la ayuda de su familia ha ido creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para comprar materia prima (maderas aserradas, calvos y herramientas), lo cual ayudaría a mejorar sus ingresos por el volumen de venta.
texts.en:
Miguel is 43 years old. He is married to Teodora, who is 51. They have 3 children. Miguel is a carpenter and his wife is a housewife. They both help each other.  

Miguel started this work more than 25 years ago with a little bit of capital that he had. Later, with his family's help, it grew. He is asking for this loan to buy raw materials (sawn wood, nails and tools), This will help improve his income from the sales volume.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (sawn wood, nails and tools)

loans.name: Tujikaze Arutani Women Group

texts.en:
Teresia, shown raising her hand, is a member of Tujikaze Arutani women's group. She is fifty six years old and a mother of six. 

She joined hand in hand eastern Africa in March 2013 and has received training on enterprise management and financial planning. The training has equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise to grown maize and beans.

Teresia requires a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. The loan will assist her to increase her proceeds and augment her income. She will therefore be able to meet family's needs with ease.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Walter Giovanni

texts.es: La vivienda en la que vive Walter junto a sus padres y hermanos es muy humilde pero se siente feliz de contar con la compañía de su familia. Él se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de fotógrafo en una institución gubernamental desde hace ya 2 años, además cuenta con su propio negocio de venta de licuados, lo que le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Walter desea invertir en su negocio, ya que sabe que este es muy rentable y gracias a su ubicación cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frutas, leche, azúcar, hielo, esencias y mesas para mejorar la atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Walter’s home, which is near to his parents and siblings, is very modest but he is happy to have the company of his family.  He has been making a living for two years by lending his services as a photographer in a government organisation, in addition he has his own business selling smoothies, which means he is able to have a higher income.  

Walter wants to invest in his business, he knows that it is very profitable, and thanks to his location more and more customers buy his products each day.  For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: fruit, milk, sugar, ice, essences and extracts and tables to improve the service for his customers.

loans.use: to invest in: fruit, milk, sugar, ice, essences and extracts and tables to improve the service for his customers.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 34-year-old married man with two children. He has been employed in a security company since 2007, and works hard to develop his career and overcome poverty. 

He is well known in his village with his good reputation and hard work.

George has a limited monthly salary, but is financially responsible for his mother and siblings. He needs a loan from Kiva's field partner UGAFODE Microfinance, to support his retail business.  He plans to purchase new stock items that are on high demand.

He hopes to open his own business and expand throughout the region.  He is hard working and appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase stock items.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 29/05/2013 et unis par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Isseu est la responsable,elle est âgée de 54ans  mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois garçons .
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de de tissus et de bijoux .Avec son nouveau crédit de 370000 elle va se payer des rouleaux de tissus divers et des paquets de bijoux qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaire et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created on the 29th of May, 2013, and is united by good social and professional relationships. Isseu is the group leader. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom are boys. She sells fabrics and jewellery. 

She will use her new loan of 370 000 francs to buy some rolls of fabrics and some packages of jewellery that she will resell to retail customers in her district. 

The profits she earns from her business allow her to cover her food needs and to build her savings with the "banc villageois".

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric and some jewellery.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 44-year-old married man with 4 children (all attend school).  He has been a cattle trader since 2008. He comes from Kayrushesha-Hoima and has viable business ideas on how to raise his cattle but lacked the capital to do so until he joined for a loan. He initially borrowed 3,000,000 UGX.

Before joining UGAFODE in 2014, he was not confident about  managing a profitable business. He now wants to borrow 5,000,000 UGX to improve his business.  This loan will also help him expand  his business by buying more land. He faces challenges like competition and seasonality. He appreciates the Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Januario

texts.pt:
O  senhor Januário de 32  anos de idade é  pedreiro por conta própria e comerciante, casado, pai de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino secundário e outro ainda sem idade escolar, sustenta sua mãe enviando lhe dinheiro vive em casa própria.
Com do empréstimo  irá comprar arroz, farinha, açúcar, cervejas, refrescos para reforçar a sua barraca que esta na sua casa onde conta com ajuda de sua esposa.
O seu sonho é crescer no negócio, fazer dependências para arrendar como forma de reforçar a renda familiar. 
Tem como desafios financeiros  e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as mesmas e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Januário is 32 years old and is a self-employed builder and businessman. He is married and is the father of two children, one of whom goes to high school and the other is not yet school aged. He supports his mother by sending her money. He lives in his own home.

With this loan Januário will buy rice, flour, sugar, beer and soft drink to re-stock the store he runs from home where he is helped by his wife. 

Januário's dream is to expand his business and build rooms to rent out as a way of supplementing the family income. His main challenges are financial so he would like to take out more loans to help him overcome these challenges and reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, beer and soft drink

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado Maria Auxiliadora, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas ponen su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gloria, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y mejorando. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, panificados, lácteos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
There are 20 women who are members of this group called Maria Auxiliadora, they are in the poverty elimination program where they all put forth their best effort to be able to grow and get ahead.

One of the members is Gloria, who has a well-stocked store which, with a lot of sacrifice and effort, has been growing and improving. She is a very hard-working person who puts her all into being able to grow and get ahead.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase vegetables, fruit, baked goods, dairy products and more, so as to be able to continue with her sales, and in this way be able to continue struggling to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, baked goods, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Adama Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 07 Janvier 1997 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son trente quatrième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Adama Hawa (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 44 ans, mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 05 garçons et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de détails.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter elle compte acheter du riz, de l’huile et d’autres condiments pour sa boutique d’une valeur de 100000 et acheter de la semence pour faire de l’agriculture d’un montant de 50000f.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte assister ses enfants dans leur habillement, soins médicaux et aider son mari dans la gestion des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" was created on the 7th of January, 1997. This group is starting its 34th loan cycle and is made up of woman who all live in the same area. They enjoy good relations and a good group spirit. Their main activity is retail.

Adama Hawa  (sitting on the far right and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of 7 children, 5 boys and 2 girls. She is a retailer. She plans to use this new loan to buy 100 000 francs worth of rice, oil, and other condiments for her shop, and to buy 50 000 francs worth of seeds for farming.

She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's clothing and medical expenses, and to help her husband manage the family budget.

loans.use: to buy condiments and seeds.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is the name of the lady appearing in the photo. She is 26 years old, married and a mother of two children.
She does maize and bean farming as her economic activity. She has greatly benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training which equipped her with skills to effectively manage her business. 

She is borrowing from Kiva in order to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. She hopes that this will enable her to boost her proceeds. She will therefore be able to improve the living standards of her family which includes quality education and modern housing. 

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Faith And Hope Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in this photo is Maurine, a member of Faith and Hope Women Group. She is twenty-eight years old, married, and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

Maurine operates a grocery kiosk where she sells fruits and vegetables such as kale, cabbages, mangoes, oranges and carrots. She has benefited from the HiH EA enterprise. With financial management training, she has gained skills that help in running and managing her business well.

Maurine is borrowing a Kiva loan to add stock that will help satisfy her customers' needs and maximize profits. Income from this enterprise will help take care of her family's basic needs, such as education and medical care. 

Maurine is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kale, cabbages, mangoes, oranges, and carrots that will help satisfy her customers' needs and maximize  profits.

loans.name: Las Juanas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Juanas  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la Ciudad de Caacupé, son 15 mujeres muy unidas que quieren crecer y salir adelante por medio del trabajo unido.
La señora Gloria, ayuda a mantener a su familia con una Olería que tiene,  y comenta que este es el medio con el cual ayuda a su familia. El  fin del préstamo es la obtención de más capital  para la compra de Arcilla y leña, ambos materias prima para la elaboración de ladrillos. La señora está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar por medio de su trabajo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Juanas. It is in its loan cycle number 1 in the women's committee program. It is located in the city of Caacupé, and they are 15 very close-knit women who want to grow and get ahead through their work together. 

Gloria helps to support her family with a brick kiln that she has, and says that this is the means with which she helps her family. The end of the goal is to get more capital to purchase clay and firewood, both raw materials to make bricks. She is very grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to grow and improve through her work. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase clay and firewood, both raw materials for making bricks.

loans.name: André

texts.pt:
O senhor André de 62 anos de idade   é pensionista, casado pai de 7 filhos dos quais 3 ainda menores e 1 destes a estudar 4 já maiores sustenta 1 neto deficiente que vive com ele e é orfão vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo este  pretende comprar  roupas usadas, refrigerantes e diversos produtos de 1a necessidade para reforçar o seu negocio .
O seu sonho é crescer no negocio, ter um estabelecimento próprio e em condições na sua casa e com os empréstimos anteriores conseguiu fazer a sua casa pois era de material convencional.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e o financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar como segurança numa empresa próxima a sua residência, e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
André is 62 years old and a pensioner. He is married and the father of seven children of whom three are still underage and one of them is studying. The other four are all adults. André supports one grandchild who has a disability and lives with him because he is an orphan. André lives in his own home. 

André says that the money from this loan will be used to to buy second hand clothes, soft drink and various staple goods to restock his business.

André's dream is to expand his business and run his own store in good condition in his home. With his previous loans André was able to build his own home since it was made from traditional materials.

André says that his greatest difficulty is his finances. He has been working as a security guard in a company close to his house as he plans to take out more loans to overcome his difficulties and reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes, soft drink and various staple goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase various fruits for sale.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Amistad está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas estan dentro de la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 integrantes se encuentran luchando por mejorar su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gissela quien  a  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de las ventas en su copetín de todo tipo de productos. Ella comenta que poco a poco ha ido poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Gissela pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder surtir su copetín, como ser golosinas, bebidas, comestibles y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de poder mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The group called La Amistad is in its loan cycle number 1 in the women's committee program, where they all are using the poverty elimination tool, where three of the members are struggling to improve their poverty situation.

One of the members is Gissela who, through her efforts and continual work and through the sales in her store of all sorts of products, says that little by little she has been putting her all into being able to grow and get ahead.

Gissela asks for this loan to be able to purchase various supplies to be able to stock her store, such as sweets, drinks, food, and more, and in this way be able to continue with her sales. They are grateful for the opportunity that they are all getting to be able to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, drinks, food and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Shannon

texts.en:
Shannon is a U.S. veteran who lives in Ohio with his wife and four children. He currently works full-time in the information technology industry.

Over the years, however, Shannon has created various custom shirts for family and friends. Through doing so, he realized that he had a talent for producing quality t- shirts. After successfully testing his custom shirts on his main target community, Shannon decided to launch his online clothing company during July of this year.

Currently, Shannon is seeking a loan to purchase a digital direct-to-garment printer that he could use to produce his products locally. Doing so would allow him to purchase necessary supplies through vendors directly and would also allow him to use his skills and expertise in design to create his products himself.

Shannon’s greatest challenge thus far in running his business has been the inability to secure necessary loans/financing. Despite such challenges, he has had great success in gaining support from the military community he belongs to, which he describes as highly dedicated, fiercely loyal and supportive.

loans.use: to purchase a digital direct-to-garment printer.

loans.name: Leysil

texts.en:
Leysil is a 32-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She has two children ages 11 and one year old.

To earn a living, she sells firewood in their place while her husband works hard as a construction worker. They work together to upturn their livelihood. 

Leysil has been doing this business of selling firewood for four years. She needs a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more firewood to sell. In the future, she wishes to have enough capital to run and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia had been married at an early age. Since then, she sells food (snacks) to earn a living. She is now 57 years old and has five adult children. Her oldest child is 40 years old while her youngest child is 18 years old. Her husband is a construction worker and works hard to provide the needs of their family.

Lilia wants to expand her business to upturn their livelihood. With this, she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, food coloring, spices and sugar.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, food coloring, spices and sugar

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is originally from Haiti and has been living in the United States for the past 34 years.

He has a passion for pens and considers himself to be a pen “connoisseur.” Jose has always been intrigued by modern designs. In recent years he incorporated some previous ideas into a design for a product he has named The Squareberry Pen.

Jose wanted to turn his passion for and creativity in modern design into a lucrative business brand and therefore began conceptualizing his business model back in March, 2014.

The most difficult obstacle he has encountered has been finding a one-stop pen manufacturer. Through his research and developing stages of his business, he has learned that some projects and designs for The Squareberry Pen will most likely have to be outsourced from one company to another.

He is currently seeking a loan to produce an authentic 3D prototype that is market-ready for production. He is looking to purchase promotional materials and branding assets and would also like to build a legal budget to protect his trademark and design.

loans.use: to purchase promotional materials and branding assets and to build a legal budget to protect his trademark and design.

loans.name: Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
Nhanh, 47, is a farmer living in a rural village of Battambang province and she has three children.

Nowadays, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in her job for ten years.

Nhanh has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already and she has fully repaid her previous loan. Her past loan helped her to improve her family’s living.

Because she lacks funds to do farming, she is now leading a group of three members to take a new loan. As a group leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed and to pay for labor fees to increase her crop yields. She hopes that she is able to earn more income to upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed and to pay for labor fees to increase her crop yields.

loans.name: Sray's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a remote area of Battambang province, Sray is 38 years old and is a mother of three dependent children who are all in school. The main source of her family’s income is from cassava growing. Meanwhile, she is working for others for a fee to supplement her income, and she has been involved in her business for twelve years.

Due to lacking funds, she decided to request a new loan in order to buy seed and fertilizer for supporting her farming to produce good yields. This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has a better house to stay in through her past loans. In a group of three, she is the leader. She hopes that she can get more income so that she has the ability to upgrade her family’s living and life style.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for supporting her farming to produce good yields

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Caacupé. Las 15 integrantes del comité realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias. 
La señora Maria ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la Elaboración y posterior venta de butifarras  que realiza El  fin del préstamo es la obtención de más capital  para   la compra de insumos para su elaboración de sus butifarras, como ser carne, condimentos, panificados y otros. La señora está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
The group called San Cayetano is in its loan cycle number 1 in the women's committee program. It is located in the city of Caacupé. The 15 members of the committee put out a lot of effort to be able to get ahead with their families.

Maria helps sustain her family by making, and later selling, sausages which she prepares. The loan is to be used to get more capital to purchase supplies to make sausages, such as meat, seasonings, baked goods and more. She is very grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to grow and get ahead with her small business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make her sausage, such as meat, seasonings, baked goods and more.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Miguel  está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Victoria quien tiene una lavandería en su casa, es una mujeres muy trabajadora, que se gana la vida de una manera honesta y sacrificada. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para poder empezar con su trabajo y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Victoria Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos  para usar en su negocio, como ser jabón en polvo, jabones en barra, suavizantes para ropas, y otros, y de esa forma seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called San Miguel and it is in its loan cycle number 1 in the women's committee program, where they are completing the poverty elimination questionnaire, where one of them is below the poverty line, which is to say in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Victoria who has a laundry in her house. She is a very hard-working woman, who earns her living in an honest and self-sacrificing way. Every day, she gets up very early to be able to begin with her work and in this way be able to help her family.

Victoria asks for this loan to purchase supplies to use in her business such as powdered soap, bar soap, fabric softeners, and more, and in this way continue struggling as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase powdered soap, bar soap, fabric softeners, and more.

loans.name: 4 Estrellas De La Noche Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “4 ESTRELLAS DE LA NOCHE” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Patricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras y papa, venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de muebles, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Patricia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras y papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace más de catorce años.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta, quienes le ayudan en la venta de su negocio son sus hijos.  Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The 4 Estrellas de la Noche loan group will begin its seventeenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani, it is made up of ten members and is led by officers, of whom Patricia is the president. The businesses which the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are vegetable and potato sales, food sales, blanket sales, furniture sales and shoe sales.

The loan that they are getting will help the small business owners of whom Patricia is one. She says that five years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Now, she has a business selling vegetables and potatoes. She comments that she learned her business from her mother more than fourteen years ago.

The loan that she is now getting out is to increase her capital (purchase potatoes in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in El Alto and later will sell them in her sales location. She is helped in her sales by her children. This manner of working allows her to get resources to support her family economically since she is in a common-law marriage and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Mayflor

texts.en:
Mayflor is a 21-year-old single woman from Mahaplag, Leyte.

She buys and sells frozen goods to earn a living. She has been doing this business for two years.

Mayflor works hard to reach her goal to be successful in her life. She dreams to expand her business to have a better means of living in the future.

She is asking a loan to buy frozen goods such as hotdogs, chorizo, ham and meat.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods such as hotdogs, chorizo, ham and meat.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 42-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and her youngest child is 12 years old.

Myrna has been engaged in a hog-raising business for four years. She also sells firewood for additional income.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy piglets and feed.

Myrna’s hope is to expand her hog-raising business in order to have better earnings in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald has been engaged in a hog-raising business for two years. He is 32 years old and has no children. Recently, his partner has been attending school to finish a degree so they could have a better living in the future.

Ronald has been aiming to improve his business, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional piglets and feed to increase his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from Mahaplag, Leyte and owns a sari-sari (variety) store business.  She has been in this business for five years. She is 56 years old and dreams of expanding this business in the future to have better earnings. 

Virginia is a married woman and has six children. Some of them are still dependent on her so she works hard to provide their needs. 

Virginia needs additional capital to continue running her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy grocery items such as chocolate drinks, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, juice, chips, noodles, toiletries, canned goods, and biscuits.

loans.use: to buy chocolate drinks, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, juice, chips, noodles, toiletries, canned goods, and biscuits.

loans.name: Manoeun's Group

texts.en:
Living in Battambang province, Manoeun is 39 years old and a mother of two dependent children who are in school.

For her living, she grows cassava as the main source of income. She sometimes works for others for a fee to get additional income to meet her family’s needs. She has been involved in these businesses for 12 years.

Now she has not enough funds to do farming for this season, which causes her to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to solve this problem.

This is the first loan cycle for her. As the leader of two, she will use her entire loan portion to buy pesticide for supporting her crops and fertilizer to produce good yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income so that she will be able to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticide for supporting her crops and fertilizer to produce good yields.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 53-year-old woman. She earns a living by doing a hog-raising business. She is married and blessed with one son, aged 10 years old.

Rufina's husband is a farmer and works hard for their future. Rufina also engages in a food vending business. She is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets and feed, and to buy ingredients for her food selling business like vegetables, pork, spices, and flour. 

Rufina’s only wish is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed, and also vegetables, pork, spices and flour

loans.name: Las Rosas 1 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS 1” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eloyza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de CD’s, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de coca, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de busos. 

El crédito que sacarán beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eloysa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CD’s lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra CD’s por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Las Rosas 1 communal loan group will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers, of whom Eloyza is the president. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are CD sales, clothing sales, food sales, coconut sales, a neighborhood store, blanket sales, sweater sales, and tracksuit sales.

The loan that they are getting out will benefit the small business owners of whom Eloysa is one. She says that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who was a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling CDs; she learned how a number of years ago at her own initiative.

The loan that she is now getting will be to increase her capital (purchase CDs in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later will sell them in her sales location. This way of working allows her to get resources to support her family economically, since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health center the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase CDs in bulk.

loans.name: Las Inversionistas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Inversionistas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde seis señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Ceferina solicita de este préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de comestibles que comercializa en su casa, ya que quiere comprar carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella está luchando y pone todo de sí para poder crecer y dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
The group called Las Inversionistas is in its loan cycle number 1 in the committee program. They are completing the poverty elimination questionnaire, where six of the women are below the poverty lines, which is to say in extreme poverty, struggling to improve their living conditions.

Ceferina asks for this loan to invest in her business selling food which she sells in her house, so she wants to purchase meat, seasonings, baked goods, vegetables, and more. She is a very hard-working person who puts forth a lot of effort to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She is struggling and puts her whole self into being able to grow and give her loved ones everything that she was not able to have.

loans.use: to purchase meat, seasonings, baked goods, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
O senhor Francisco de 38 anos de idade é padeiro de profissão e nas horas livres faz agricultura num regadio próximo a sua residência, é solteiro e pai de 2 filhos 1 dos quais  frequentar o ensino primário,outro sem idade escolar, vive com a mãe na casa de seus pais.
Diz que com os empréstimos anteriores  adquirir um espaço nas proximidades da casa de seus pais e ampliou a produção nas suas machambas  e com este  pretende comprar cimento, varões, chapas de zinco, arames ,pregos,  pedra, e areia  para iniciar a construção de sua casa.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar para oferecer um lar melhor  a sua família, ampliar a produção na sua machamba.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência de fundos e para supera-los recorre a venda de produtos da machamba, e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Francisco is 38 years old and is a professional builder. In his free time he works as a farmer on a plot of irrigated land near his house. He is a single father of two children, one of whom goes to primary school while the other is not yet school aged. He lives with his mother in his parents' house. 

Francisco states that with his previous loans he acquired a plot of land near his parents' home and increased the amount of crops on his farms. 

With this loan Francisco plans to buy cement, rods, tin sheeting, wire, nails, stones and sand to start building his house. His dream is to finish the building work on his house and furnish it so he can provide his family with a better home and increase the amount of crops he grows on his farm. 

Francisco struggles with not having enough money but to overcome this he plans to sell the crops from his farm and take out more loans to overcome his difficulties and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods, tin sheeting, wire, nails, stones and sand

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 38-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has two daughters, 15 and 11 years old. Her husband is a motorcycle driver while she runs a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this business for three years.

Rosemarie is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy grocery items such as noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, chocolates, powdered milk and juice, coffee, sugar, spices and soft drinks. In the future, she wishes to expand her business to increase her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, chocolates, powdered milk and juice, coffee, sugar, spices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is 53 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leonidas is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional farm supplies like fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for her farm.

Leonidas has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from nipa (traditional thatched) roofing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional farm supplies like fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for her farm.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lorena works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Lorena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 50 years old and married with six children, three of whom in school. Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Lorna has been in this business for four years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 40 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Ma. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for two years.

In the future Ma. Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Melojane

texts.en:
Melojane works hard to support her family. Melojane is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Melojane has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Melojane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly, 42 years old, is a married mother of three children, living in Kampong Cham province.

The sources of her family’s income are from teaching small children at school and growing rice. She has been involved in these businesses for more than five years and it earns her about 26,100 KHR per day. After offsetting her family’s expenses, she is able to save about 15,000 KHR each day.

The crops have not grown well and the rice price in market is also decreased, which caused her to gain a lower income than she expected. Now she has not enough funds to do farming for this season, so she decided to apply for a new loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to increase productivity. She hopes that this loan will help her to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to increase her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi works hard to support her family. Naomi is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

Naomi has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
A villager from Takeo province, Sokhom is 51 years old. She is a mother of three dependent children, all of whom are in school.

She struggles for a living via rice growing and cow raising to supplement her income. She has been involved with her farming for 31 years and it earns her about 31,100 KHR per day.

This is first time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to pay tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Ma Chona

texts.en:
Ma Chona is a 47-year-old woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has three children, ages 24, 21, and 19 years old. 

For many years, Ma Chona has been engaged in selling dry goods such as assorted pants, shirts, dresses, and uniforms. She also sells towels and underwear. She is proficient in this business and works hard to increase her earnings. 

Now, Ma Chona wishes to expand her business. She is requesting funds to use for bidding on two blocks of space, for her business in the market, for additional livelihood.

loans.use: to use for bidding on two blocks of space.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 60 years old and married with eleven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Pacita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation.

Pacita has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation.

loans.name: Srey Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Srey Thoeurn is aged 37 years old, a mother of two children (one of them is in school), living in Kampong Cham province. Growing has been the main source of her family’s income for twenty years and her husband is driving a motor taxi to earn additional income to support her family’s living.

She is able to earn about 26,000 KHR per day and able to save about 12,000 KHR each day for their emergency needs. Her business is threaten by the depreciation of rice’s price in the market.

Due to lacking funds to do farming for this season, she is now leading a group of five to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund, and this is her first loan cycle. As a group leader, she is willing to use her loan portion to pay for the plowing fee to grow her crops well. She hopes to gain more yields than the previous year through this loan portion.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fee to grow her crops well

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Jesús Alfredo

texts.es: Jesús reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y cuenta con 15 años de experiencia ofreciendo servicios de mantenimiento y reparación de televisores y bicicletas.  Sus vecinos, amigos y referidos, llevan a su vivienda los artículos para su reparación o pignorar estos artículos, sin embargo en ocasiones no los retiran y Jesús procede a venderlos.  Él no desaprovecha las oportunidades de negocio que se le presenten y también vende frutas de temporada, su horario laboral es a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. y ha logrado tener éxito gracias a su empeño y dedicación.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en surtido de fruta y comprar televisores y bicicletas.  Con esta inversión tendrá más oportunidades de invertir en promociones de frutas  y comprará televisores y bicicletas de oportunidad. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su cobertura y continuar ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Jesús lives with his spouse in a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla and has 15 years of experience offering maintenance and repair services for televisions and bicycles. His neighbors, friends, and people referred to him bring their items to his house for repair or touch-ups on these items. However, sometimes they don't pick them up and Jesús then sells them. He doesn't let business opportunities pass him by when they come up and he also sells fruit in season. His work schedules is from 7 am to 10 pm and he has had success thanks to his determination and dedication. Currently, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in an assortment of fruit and to purchase televisions and bicycles. With this investment, he will have more opportunities to invest in fruit sales and to purchase televisions and bicycles at good opportunities. His goal for the future is to expand his coverage and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to invest in an assortment of fruit and to purchase televisions and bicycles.

loans.name: Bholanath Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Rina, standing to the left, is a 41-year-old mother of four dependent children living in a interior village in Koraput district. For her living, she has been farming rice to support her family for 25 years. Her business helps her to save around 3,000 India rupees (INR) every month after offsetting her family’s expenses. Recently, her rice was sold at a low price because of the drought, and this is the main challenge for her business. Now, along with her group member, she is applying for a loan of 36,000 INR with Peoples Forum (a Kiva partner).

Rina will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her farmland and boost her crop yields. She hopes her rice will grow well and she will be able to sell it at a high price to update her lifestyle to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her farmland and boost her crop yields.

loans.name: Bholanath Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Sanamati, who is 33 and is standing to the left, is a determined, unstoppable, and friendly woman. She hails from Koraput district of Odisha and is the featured borrower of Bholanath SHG-B. She lives with her husband, who is an auto rickshaw driver, and two sons who are pursuing their studies in different grades.

Regardless of the adversities that she has encountered in life (economic, family, and work related), Sanamati started a restaurant business 3 years ago. She has various challenges, most notably competition. However, overcoming this obstacle, Sanamati is managing to strengthen her business. Her business is thriving, and she wishes to offer employment.

Along with her group member, Sanamati is requesting a loan of 36,000 India rupees (INR). She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy an assortment of beverages and ingredients like oil, curry powder, cumin, and other necessities for the preparation of food items. This way, she will be able to grow with a strong and stable business that can compete with the others in the area.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of beverages and ingredients like oil, curry powder, cumin, and other necessities.

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Damas trabajadoras, todas son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que quieren salir adelante para poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos.
Una persona que se destaca es la Sra. Eusebia, quien se dedica al reciclado de todo tipo de productos, como ser cartones, aluminio, hierros y otros, que ella recolecta de manera ambulante, y también compra en cantidad para poder revenderlos. Ella está contenta por su trabajo ya que con ello mantiene a su familia de una manera humilde.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cartones, aluminios y otros productos para poder comprar y luego revender en cantidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con su humilde trabajo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The members of the group Damas Trabajadoras ['Women Workers'] are all fighters and very hard workers who want to get ahead in order to be able to help their families and their loved ones.

One person who stands out is Mrs. Eusebia. She makes a living by recycling all types of products, such as cardboard, aluminum, iron, and others, which she collects while traveling and also which she bulk purchases in order to be able to resell them. She is content with her work as this supports her family in a humble manner.

She requests this loan in order to bulk purchase cardboard, aluminum, and other products to resell, and thus be able to continue with her humble work. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cardboard, aluminum and other products to resell.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is an amazing mother who lives in Irbid, she has three children and she is working hard to insure a good life for them and does not let them need anything.
Mahas`s husband is working with low income in the army and he could not cover all the needs for his big family, because of that she wants to help him in anyway, and because she is very productive woman and ambitious woman she decided to open her own business.

Maha has started her business in 2011 and she took a loan to buy a simple sewing machine to start sewing clothes to sell.
Then she decided to develop her experience in this field and take classes in sewing because of that she has to put her children with her mom until she finished her classes.

After she finished her classes and become a professional in sewing, she took a loan and expanded her work and opened her independent sewing shop.
Maha wants to expand her shop and buy what she needs to raise her profits; she applied for a loan to help her buy yarns and fabrics and to add new sewing machines. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: buy yarns and fabrics and to add new sewing machines for her expanding business

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is 22 years old and is studying for a B.Sc. degree in Agriculture. She lives in Irbid with her family, and she is working really hard to get ahead and to grow.

Amani dreams of having a good job so that she could help to pay for her daily expenses and help her family in their household expenses.

She has requested this loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue her education, and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees for her B.Sc. in Agriculture

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Sidiki  est membre du groupe Benkadi, c’est lui  qui tient le mouton en main, marié et père de  6 enfants qui sont âgés de 3 à15 ans, trois fréquentent l’Ecole, il réside  au Mali, âgés de 48 ans. Il fait l’embouche bovine et ovine. Les rêves et les espoirs de Sidiki est d’acheter beaucoup de bœufs et moutons, après ses ventent de tirer plus de bénéfice pour subvenir aux besoins familiale. Par manque d argent il  fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir acheter plus d’animaux pour emboucher. Il s’approvisionne dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone et revend dans les villes.il peut gagner comme bénéfice  75 000 FCFA par tête après les ventes. Le prêt l’aidera à tirer de bénéfice enfin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille : santé, scolaire etc., depuis 20 ans il fait l’embouche bovines et ovines. Les obstacles auxquels se heurte  de Sidiki est souvent l’épidémie.
texts.en:
Sidiki is a member of the Benkadi group, he is the one holding the sheep in the picture. He is married and the father of 6 children aged between 3 and 15, 3 of whom attend school. He lives in Mali and is 48 years old. He practices cattle- and sheep-fattening.

The hopes and dreams of Sidiki include buying more cattle and sheep and, once he sells them, making more profits so that he can meet his family's needs. Lacking funds, he is turning to RMCR so that he can buy more livestock to fatten. He gets his supplies at the weekly markets in his area and resells his livestock in the towns. He can earn up to 75 000 francs in profit per head sold. This loan will enable him to earn a profit so that he can meet his family's needs, including covering health and educational expenses.

Sidiki has been fattening cattle and sheep for 20 years. Some of the obstacles he often faces include infectious animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: Bholanath Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Moti is a 44-year-old farmer and a single mother from Koraput district. The lady standing to the left in a blue sari is Moti. She is the mother of a 15-year-old daughter and is hardworking, humble, and responsible. Since she was a girl she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching.

Thanks to this, Moti has achieved good progress. Today she has a variety of crops, which has helped her generate income to support her child.

Moti and her fellow group member have asked for a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR). She will use her portion of the loan to buy organic manures and fertilizers, which will help her to increase her yield's quality and increase her customer base resulting to higher return on investment.

Her biggest dream is to offer her daughter a good education and improve her living conditions. She knows that with the support of Peoples Forum and Kiva, she will achieve it.

loans.use: to buy organic manures and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gomaa

texts.en:
Gomaa is 58 years old, married and has 5 children.  One of them has a mental disability. 

Gomaa has a poultry sales project and is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy more chickens to increase his income for his family and afford his daughter's marriage expenses.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Rabee

texts.en:
Rabee is 49 years old, married and has 3 children. For a long time, he has had a small fattening project and he previously requested a 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates. 

He is requesting another 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to expand his project and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Anjay

texts.en:
Anjay is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 37, married in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, she runs a store that primarily supports for their family. Everyday she never get tired tending her store. Anjay is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. 

Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities.In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell

loans.name: Nael

texts.en:
Nael is a 28-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two kids; a son and a daughter. Nael works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary things.

Nael took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. by taking this loan, Nael will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids.
Nael appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 29-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and kids in a simple house. Khalil works as an employee in electricity workshop where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Khalil took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Khalil will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids.
Khalil appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Marzoq

texts.en:
Marzoq is a 35-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and five kids in a simple house. Marzoq works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Marzoq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Marzoq will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids.
Marzoq appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Bholanath Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Radha, who is 29 years old and standing to the right, is a single mother. She has two children of 11 and 7 years of age. Radha studied until 6th grade, but did not continue studying because she had to help her parents make plastic bags and hammocks to earn a living for her family. Currently, she lives in her parents' house.

Radha begins her day at 5 a.m. in order to get her children ready for school and also to do some household chores, then over the course of the day she performs her main source of work, which is the crafting and making of bags and roped hammocks. Since she was little she made a living doing this work, because her parents took up this trade and it has been transmitted from generation to generation within the family.

Radha, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR). She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase colors, crayons, threads, glues, and other materials that are indispensable for her business.

Radha dreams of expanding her business and creating a place where she is able to hire people to help her work. Also, another desire that she has is to construct her own house, where she will be able to live together with her children, because at the moment she lives with her parents.

loans.use: to purchase colors, crayons, threads, glue, and other materials that are indispensable for her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 22 years old, recently married and has a wood sales and carpentry project. He makes simple furniture such as chairs and tables.

 Ahmad is requesting a 5000 EGP to buy more wood to meet the increasing demands of his customers and to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more wood for his carpentry business

loans.name: Rabee

texts.en:
Rabee is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a small fattening project in which he uses milk to make cheese and butter for domestic use and for sale in the local market.

 He is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to generate more income and cover his family's increasing monthly expenses.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 48 years old and has fourteen children.  Teodora is married and has six children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Teodora has been pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets, gasoline and other materials for fishing.

Vilma has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, gasoline and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Bholanath Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Asumati is 27 years old and from Koraput district. She is the one standing to the right in the photo. She is a sensible, charismatic, and hardworking woman who makes a living offering her dressmaking services.

With her husband, Asumati watches out for the care and future of her two younger children. Her husband is a differently abled person and is not capable to work for earning his livelihood. Asumati started her job with a conviction that gives her hope. It gives her children opportunities to progress. She wants them to be the first generation university students in the family. That is her big dream.
