Thinking about her work, of strengthening it and giving it variation, Asumati, along with her fellow group member, is asking for a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR). She will use her portion of the loan to buy supplies to start direct dressmaking like fabric, thread, and needles. She is looking to offer cheaper clothing to her neighbors and to capture the town market and have a happy and steady living.

loans.use: to buy supplies to start direct dressmaking like fabric, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Marie Fatini's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 07 Janvier 1997 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son trente quatrième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Marie Fatini  (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 59 ans, mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de glace et l’agriculture.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter tout les jours de la glace d’une valeur de 30000f pour aller le revendre dans les villages et des semences d’une valeur de 50000f pour pouvoir cultiver.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created 7 January 1997 during its inauguration. This group is made up of women from the same area, and they have just started their 34th loan cycle. They all get along well and share a good group spirit. They work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Marie Fatini (who is seated on the far right with her hand raised [in the photo]) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 59 years old, married, and a mother of seven children, of whom four are boys and three are girls.

Marie Fatini works selling ice and is a farmer. With this new loan, she plans to buy ice, daily, worth 30,000 francs CFA, which she will resell in the villages. She will also buy seeds worth 50,000 francs CFA to use in her farming.

With these earnings, she hopes to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy ice and seeds

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 32 years old, married, and has two children, who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines.  Evangeline requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evangeline has been farming sugarcane for 2 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 4 times in the past to sustain her business.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sabalitono Group

texts.fr: Dans le groupe Celle qui a la calebasse pleine d’arachide est Djeneba. Elle est Malienne et âgée de 28ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont  1 garçon et 2 filles tous scolarisés. Elle a pour activité d’acheter des arachides en panier  et revendre après avoir trouvé le niveau d’un sac et ces intérêts  seront investis pour prendre une partie de la charge de ses enfants dans le domaine de nourriture, habillement, santé et aussi les frais de scolarisation. Elle exerce ce commerce d’arachide depuis 2 ans, et fait recourt auprès de la caisse pour augmenter le nombre de sacs d’arachides, elle s’approvisionne et vend dans le marché de sa localité
texts.en:
Djeneba is the one who is holding the gourde full of groundnuts. She is from Mali, 28 years old, married, and the mother of three children--one son and two daughters. All of the children are in school.

Djeneba works buying groundnuts in bulk and reselling them by the bag. She has done this for two years and procures the groundnuts and resells them in a local market. She is seeking this loan to increase her quantity of groundnuts.

Earnings will be used to cover some of her children's needs--food, clothing, healthcare, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to resell

loans.name: Fassoyiriwaton Group

texts.fr: Elle s’appele Aminata celle qui a les 2 tasses pleines d’arachide et du sesame  en main sur la photo.Elle est agée de 24 ans et reside au Mali , mariée et mère  de 2 filles toutes scolarisées. Elle fait la culture d’arachide et du sesame depuis 6 ans et sollicite un prêt pour augmenter le volume de sa culture , dont le profit sera un atout pour ses 2 filles dans le domaine  de la scolarisation, l’habillement  et faliciter l’accès à l’eau potable. Elle vend l’arachide et le sésame dans le marché de sa localité.
texts.en:
Aminata, who is holding the two bowls full of groundnuts and sesame in the photo, is 24 years old and lives in Mali. She is married and has two daughters, who both are in school. 

Aminata has farmed groundnuts and sesame for six years, and she is seeking a loan to increase the volume of her farming. She sells her groundnuts and sesame in the local market.

Profits will be used to cover her daughter's school fees, clothing, and access to drinking water.

loans.use: to farm groundnuts and sesame

loans.name: Awa Sane's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 07 Janvier 1997 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son trente quatrième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Awa Sane  (debout à l’extrême gauche avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 58 ans, veuve et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de salades.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter tout les jours de la salade dans les jardins environnants d’un montant de 20000f pour le revendre en détails dans le marché central. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte assurer la dépense quotidienne, la scolarité et l’habillement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created 7 January 1997 during its inauguration. This group is made up of women from the same area, and they have just started their 34th loan cycle. They get along well and share a good group spirit. They work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Awa Sane (who is standing on the left with her hand raised [in the photo]), is the featured borrower of the group. She is 58 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children--four sons and three daughters. 

Awa Sane works selling lettuce. With this new loan, she plans to buy lettuce, each day, from the surrounding gardens for a value of 20,000 francs CFA, which she will resell at retail in the central market.

With her earnings, she plans to ensure the daily expenses, such as her children's school fees and clothing.

loans.use: to buy lettuce

loans.name: Tuyết

texts.en:
Tuyết is 33 years old, and she is married.  She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for 4 years.  Tuyết lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in the village (moreover, the market need is low in this region).
 
One of the most critical challenges that she faces is that she does not have a latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and other equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business.  She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.  With her business profits, Tuyết hopes that her business performs well, that she is able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and that she is able to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and other equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Diệp

texts.en:
Diệp is 42 years old, and she is married.  She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years.  Diệp lives in the Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in the Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in the village (moreover, this job is unstable).
 
One of the most critical challenges that she faces is that her latrine is not hygienic.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and other equipment to build a toilet.

This is Diệp's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.  With her business profits, Diệp hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and other equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gemma works hard to support her family.  She has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending and motorcycle transport.  Gemma is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials, like paint and plywood, to maintain her boarding house for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.  Gemma has sustained her business activities through 25 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream - to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like paint and plywood, to maintain her boarding house.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen only need financial help to achieve her dreams.

She is a modest girl who lives with her family in Jarash and is 23 years old, Haneen is studying at the University majoring in Computer Information Systems.

She chose this major for her believes that there are many job opportunities in this field, she wants to graduate and find a good work with good salary, but the financial problems that faced by her family is obstacle standing in front of her.  So she decided to apply for an education loan to be able to cover her university fees and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to cover her university fees for her B.Sc. in IT

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Halimata est celle qui tient la corde du bélier dans le groupe.C’est une éléveuse d’ovin de nationalite Malienne agée de 40 ans mariée et mère de 5 enfants 2 garçons et 3 filles tous scolarisés. Elle exerce cette activité d’élévage d’ovin dépuis 8 ans, le prêt lui permetra d’ acheter beaucoup de béliers pour vendre ,et le revenu sera consacré à bien nourrire ses enfants, à leurs acheter des chaussures et vêtements,payer les frais de scolarisation et parvenir aussi au besoin sanitaire.Elle s’approvisionne et vend dans le marché dans localité
texts.en:
Halimata is the one who is holding the ram's leash in the photo. She is a livestock farmer who is from Mali. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of five children, two sons and three daughters. All of the children are in school.

Halimata has done this type of work for eight years. She procures her rams in the local market. This loan will serve to buy many rams, which she will resell. 

Earnings will help to feed her children, buy them shoes and clothing, cover their school fees, and meet their healthcare needs.

loans.use: to buy rams to resell later

loans.name: Emile

texts.fr:
32 ans, marié, Emile est un père de famille consciencieux et rigoureux. Il a un petit enfant de 4 ans et qui est en classe de 11ème dans une école privée pas loin de leur domicile.
Il exerce une activité de vente des  sacs dames à l'occasion depuis 2009. Auparavant, il travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche comme sa femme et qui l'est encore en ce moment. Il demande un crédit pour développer son commerce. Il va acheter 2 balles de sacs dame à l'occasion pour compléter et améliorer son achalandage afin d'attirer beaucoup plus de clients.
Son objectif est de pouvoir offrir à sa famille une meilleure condition de vie, il projette de construire sa propre maison pour éviter de louer.
texts.en:
Emile is 32 years old, married, and the father of a conscientious and strong family. He has one four-year-old child who attends a private elementary school not far from their home.

Emile has worked selling women's handbags at retail since 2009. Previously, he worked in a company in the free trade zone, like his wife (who is still there). 

He is seeking a loan to develop his business. He is going to buy two bales of women's handbags at retail to complement and enhance his stock in order to attract more customers.

His goal is to be able to offer his family a better quality of life. He dreams of building a home, so that he doesn't have to pay rent anymore.

loans.use: to buy two bales of handbags

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province, where she has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for 4 years.  Her family is a low-income household in the village (moreover, the market need is low in this region).
 
One of the most critical challenges that she faces is that she does not have a latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and other equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Lai joined the Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business.  Lai has successfully repaid 3 loans from the Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.  With her business profits, Lai hopes that she is able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, that her business does well, and that she is able to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and other equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 23 years old and married. She lives in Thieu Hoa District, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for three years. Her family is a low-income household in the village. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà is 46 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for four years.

Hà lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Hà has repaid successfully three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Along with her business profit, Hà hopes to buy land of her own, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ansata's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 14 Janvier 1998, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même village, et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide.
 
Madame Ansata (assise à l’extrême droite en bleue et avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans, Divorcée et  mère de 05 enfants dont 04 filles et 01 garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus teintée et la transformation de fruits, légumes et céréales

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des tissus teintés d’une valeur de 100000f, de l’huile de palme 02 bouteilles de 20 litre à 17000 la bouteille et de patte d’arachide d’un montant de 24000f pour le revendre en détails.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la gestion des charges familiales et surtout à la scolarité, l’habillement et les soins médicaux  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created on January 14, 1998, this group is made up of women who have mostly acquired solid experience in small-scale commerce, their main business activity. They all live in the same village and share their values of solidarity and helping each other.

Madame Ansata (seated on the far right in blue with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 59, divorced, and the mother of five children, four girls and one boy. Her business is selling dyed cloth and processing fruit, vegetables, and cereals. This new loan will allow her to buy 100,000 francs worth of dyed cloth, two jerrycans of palm oil of 20 liters each for 17,000 francs each, and 24,000 francs worth of peanut butter to be sold retail.

The profits will permit her to participate actively in covering family expenses, especially school fees, clothing, and medical expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy dyed cloth for the amount of 100,000 francs, two jerrycans of 20 liters each of palm oil at 17,000 francs each, and 24,000 francs worth of peanut butter.

loans.name: Lý

texts.en: Lý is 60 years old and married. She lives in Quang Xuong District, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling soup for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in village. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Lý's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Lý hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Dũng

texts.en:
Mr. Dũng is 49 years old and he is married. He has had a service business repairing bicycles for three years.

Dũng lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. His family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. He has no collateral and can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is his latrine is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2014, Dũng joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve his  business. Dũng has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Along with his business profit, Dũng hopes for his business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 33 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She has raised pigs in the Philippines for four years. Grace requested a 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ekata Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Banjarani, a 23-year-old woman, was chosen to lead this group. (She is standing to the left side in the photo). She is a single mother and has two kids who are attending elementary school. 

In order to support her family, Banjarani runs a kiosk business. Her kiosk provides daily needs such as shampoo, soap, detergent, instant noodles, snacks, and soft drinks. In addition to that, she also sells some cakes for the elementary school students, as her house is close to an elementary school and the pupils always love to buy meals from her. 

Banjarani realizes that to increase her business income, she needs extra capital to add various stock to her kiosk and food stall. Unfortunately, she does not have cash to do so. 

Banjarani, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to renew her kiosk stock, such as shampoo, soaps, detergents, conditioner, instant noodles, snacks, soft drinks, and some cake ingredients such as eggs, wheat flour, sugar, margarine, etc. 

Banjarani has a dream to start a restaurant business in order to increase her cash flow so that she becomes financially self-sufficient in order to build a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to renew her kiosk stock

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 53 years old and married with four children; one child is still in school. Adelfa works very hard to provide for them.

Adelfa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee and other personal care products.

Adelfa has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee and other personal care products

loans.name: Po Joaju Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Po Joaju está en su ciclo número 17 Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mary, quien se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata que ella vende por su barrio.
Mary comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela por medio de sus ventas, y también gracias a su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar anillos, pulseras, cadenas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder crecer y mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The group called Po Joaju is in its 17th cycle of the program of the women’s committee, where all are in the poverty elimination program. One of the members is Mary, who is dedicated to selling silver jewelry which she sells in her neighborhood. 
Mary comments that she has formed a good customer base through her sales, and also, thanks to her job, has the means to support her family and her loved ones. 
She requests this loan to buy rings, bracelets, chains, and more, so that she can continue with her sales as she is doing. The members are grateful for the opportunity they receive to grow and improve their lives.

loans.use: Comprar joyas variadas para la venta, como ser: anillos, pulseras, cadenas y otros.

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en:
She is a 56-year-old, widowed woman with one grown child. Her name is Ma. Aida. She is a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has gone fishing for almost 16 years now. She sells fish, crabs and seashells. She earns 6,000 PHP a month out of fishing. 

She decided to take a loan to support her ongoing source of income. Ma. Aida is asking for a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP to buy fishing net. The brand new fishing net enables her to improve her yield and be able to augment her daily income. Thus, she could pay her obligations and be able to buy nutritious foods, which are very essential in her day to day livelihood activity. She could now be able to start to set aside some money in preparation of old age. 

She is determined that she could improve her fishing business to be productive and sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Agida

texts.en:
As a married parent of 12 children, Agida works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa (palm) roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Agida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials like bamboo sticks, nipa leaves, rope and other materials for her nipa roofing making.

Agida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like bamboo sticks, nipa leaves, rope and other materials for her nipa roofing making

loans.name: Carmela Joy

texts.en:
Carmela Joy works hard to support her family. Carmela Joy is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Carmela Joy requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Carmela Joy has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Carmela Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemma is 51 years old and has one child still in school.

Gemma has a nipa (palm) roofing making business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, rope and other materials for her business.

Gemma has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, rope and other materials for her business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of oysters and fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of oysters and boxes of fish to sell for her buying and selling of oysters and fish business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of oysters and boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El Comité San Rafael  se  encuentra en 4to ciclo. están iniciando con muchas expectativas que quieren invertir para poder tener más ingresos en la casa y así  poder salir de la pobreza.  Todas ellas son personas muy sacrificadas que luchan por sus seres queridos.
Liz, una de las integrantes de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. Comenta que por medio de su trabajo tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia y darles una vida digna y sin privaciones. Liz es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para sus comidas, como verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y de esa forma ganarse la vida de una manera digna.
texts.en:
The San Rafael communal bank is in its fourth cycle. As they are starting it they have a lot of hopes. They want to invest in order to be able to have more income at home. This way they will be able to get out of poverty. All of them are very self-sacrificing people who struggle every day for their loved ones.

Liz is one of the members of this group. She sells food that she makes herself. She then goes out to sell it in an itinerant manner. She says that through her work she has earnings in order to be able to help her family and give them a decent life without hardships. Liz is a very tenacious woman, who wants to get ahead in order to be able to give her family everything that she was not able to have.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy supplies like vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, and others to make her food. This way she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. This way she will earn a living in a decent way.

loans.use: to buy supplies like vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, and others in order to make food.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.

Lourdes requested a loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks such as noodles, rice, soft drinks, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, rice, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, a capable man, was born in the northern part of Jordan 1991. Single and living with his parents, he is a university student majoring in Special Education. He is well known among friends and students.
	
Ahmad lacks sufficient funds to pay his tuition fees and he is one of the guys who is ambitious, so he did not want to giveup without doing anything. Therefore he requested a loan to help him pay for his university fees and achieve his dreams. 

He hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to help him pay his university fees for his BA in Special Education

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Mercedes has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Mercedes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Hilda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Hilda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish net and gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Hilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish net and gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is 40 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband works at a barber's shop. 

One year ago, Zeinab started a small clothing project to help her husband with the family income. She is requesting a 4000 EGP loan to buy children's clothing to expand her project and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing for her shop.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: 4 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 4 de Mayo está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual es una zona que aún se encuentra en crecimiento, rural y de difícil acceso.
La Sra. Lorenza se dedica a la panadería y comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella los ricos panes que prepara. Ella es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, es por eso que está creciendo, y con lo cual está ayudando a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar harina, levadura, huevos, sal, y otros, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo y sus ventas, y luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias. Agradece por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The 4 de Mayo group is in its first cycle of the women's committee program in the city of Curuguaty. It is a rural area with difficult access that is still growing.

Lorenza has a bakery business. She says that she has very good clientele that always buy the delicious breads she makes. She is a woman who is very good at what she does. That is why the business is growing. With the business she is helping her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy flour, yeast, eggs, salt, and others. With this she will be able to continue with her work and her sales.

They will continue to struggle to improve their living conditions and those of their families. They are grateful for the opportunity they are getting to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy bakery supplies like flour, yeast, eggs, salt, and others.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is a 57-year-old married mother with a dependent child who lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She earns her main income from making Khmer cake to sell. She has been doing her business for over 5 years. Her child is a factory worker and her husband is 58 years old, he is a rice farmer. Together, they can earn approximately $13.5 daily.

Mom would like to buy lumber and zinc sheets to renovate her house, but she is short of the money, so she needs a loan. This loan will help her have enough money to renovate her house and have a proper house to live in. For her future, Mom wants to expand her business and buy more soil to fill in the yard around her house.

loans.use: to buy lumber and zinc sheets to renovate her house

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 14 Janvier 1998, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même village, et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. 

Madame Aissatou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans, veuve et  mère de 05 enfants dont 01 fille et 04 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de glace et de crème glacée

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 01 frigo à 100000f de l’oseille pour son jus 01 sac de sucre à 26000f des sachets et d’autres condiments pour après transformation le revendre en détails.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront de payer  à la scolarité, l’habillement et les soins médicaux  de ses enfants et de gérer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created on the 14th of January 1998 and is made up of women who have, in the main, built up a solid experience in the retail sector and are primarily retailers. They all live in the same village and share the same values of solidarity and mutual help.

Aissatou (sitting on the far right and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is 56 years old, widowed and the mother of 5 children, 1 girl and 4 boys. She sells ice and ice cream. This new loan will enable her to buy a 100,000 franc fridge, some sorrel for her juice, one bag of sugar for 000 francs, some small bags, and condiments, so that she can prepare her refreshments and sell them to her retail customers. The profits she earns will allow her to pay for her children's education, clothing, and health care needs, and to manage the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, some sorrel, sugar, small bags, and condiments.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 46 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, noodles, biscuits, etc., to sell.

Nida has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, noodles, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane. 

Joan dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 34 years old and has three children. Nieves is married and has two of her children still in school.

Nieves is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nieves requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nieves has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 38 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business, and pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 8 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 48 years old and married with one child. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, bread, drinks, spices and shampoo.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, bread, drinks, spices and shampoo.

loans.name: Ronila

texts.en:
Ronila is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ronila is 53 years old and has one child still in school.

Ronila has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Ronila requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables like squash, eggplant, etc. to sell in the market.

Ronila has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables like squash, eggplant, and pechay to sell in the market.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 73 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as rice, soft drinks, milk, etc.

Virginia has been in this business for 22 years. 

In the future Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as rice, soft drinks, milk, etc

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 40 years old and married with four children, three of whom are still in school. Bella works very hard to provide for them.

Bella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks, etc.

Bella has been in this business for five years. 

Bella would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks, etc

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites is 57 years old and her two children are presently in school.

Marites has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice and maintenance for her business.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purhcase additional sacks of rice and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Rolita

texts.en:
Rolita works hard to support her family. Rolita is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Rolita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rolita has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 32 years old, and married with three children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Rowena has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retail.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, softdrinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.es:
La Sra Alice, vive con sus padres , gracias a la ayuda de ellos puede estudiar,  para el próximo año tiene proyectado trabajar en su profesión.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder conseguir sus metas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Alice lives with her parents, thanks to their help she can study. By next year she is planning to work in her field.

She is studying for a degree in nursing, and is doing her best effort to achieve her goals. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her fees and in this way to continue with her studies. She is thankful for this opportunity she will receive.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Pamfila

texts.en:
Pamfila is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 60, married in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, she runs a store that primarily supports for their family. Everyday she never get tired tending her store. Pamfila is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. 

Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities.In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell

loans.name: Jendilyn

texts.en:
Jendilyn is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 18 and the youngest is two. She resides in Talibon, Bohol, and she is 35 years old.

Jendilyn's husband is a fisherman. She helps her husband by selling fish, crabs and sea shells. She needs capital to sustain her fishing activity.

Jendilyn is asking for a loan to purchase materials for pump boat repair such as plywood, epoxy (adhesive) and paint. This will improve the condition of the boat and boost its yield. Therefore, she will be able to sell more fish, and her earnings will improve. Her children will have enough food eat and she will continue send them to school.

In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase materials for pump boat repair like plywood, epoxy (adhesive) and paint

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby works hard to support her family. Ruby is married with three children and has a buy-and-sell drinks business in the Philippines.

Ruby requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more drinks to sell.

Ruby has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and managing a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old and married with one child.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is 42 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school. Nita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

Nita has been in this business for 17 years.

In the future, Nita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is married, and she works hard to support her family.

Rosalyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell from her stall.

Rosalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell from her stall

loans.name: Ekata Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Rajalini, who is age 24 and standing to the right in the photo, is a hardworking woman with a positive attitude in life. She is married and the mother of two children and is from Koraput district. She is the featured borrower of Ekata SHG-A.

Rajalini works as a tailor and earns her livelihood through that. Everyone respects her at work. At home, her children love her and value her work. She is a kind, sympathetic, and determined person who always likes to help others.

Rajalini, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR). She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase another automated tailoring machine in order to meet the rising demands of her customers and help them in getting their orders at the required time.

Rajalini aspires to train two girls and hire them in order to expand her business and rent a shop for the same.

loans.use: to purchase an automated tailoring machine.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is 38 years old, driver, married, has 4 children and takes care of his aging mother. 

He is requesting a 3000 EGP to buy birds such as chickens, geese and ducks to start a poultry sales project in a place he prepared in his house

loans.use: To buy poultry, such as chickens, geese and ducks.

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es: Adriana proviene de una familia de trabajadores independientes de quienes aprendió diferentes labores y que le han favorecido al momento de desarrollar alguna idea de negocio.  Diariamente su día laboral inicia a partir de las 6 a.m.  desde su vivienda en donde comercializa buñuelos y alquila lavadoras a sus vecinos, esta emprendedora de 33 años reside en el municipio de Barranquilla y cuenta con tres años de experiencia.  Como su principal desafío  es incrementar su base de clientes, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar harina, huevos, levadura y demás ingredientes para sus buñuelos.  Con esta inversión pretende poder responder a la creciente demanda.  Su meta a futuro es tener casa propia e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Adriana comes from a family of hardworking and independent people, from whom she learned different skills that have helped her to develop business ideas. 

She starts every day at 6:00 a.m. in her place of residence selling sweet fritters and renting washing machines to her neighbors. This entrepreneur of 33 years of age lives in the town of Barranquilla and has 3 years of experience. Her main challenge is to increase her customer base. 

She is requesting her first loan with Kiva through foundation Mario Santo Domingo to buy flour, eggs, yeast and other ingredients that she needs to prepare her fritters. With this investment she hopes to meet the growing demand. 

Her goal for the future is to have a house of her own and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, yeast and other ingredients to prepare fritters.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Сурайё милая и скромная женщина из Шахритузкого района. Ей 38 лет. Сурайё в разводе с мужем. У неё один ребенок, которому всего 2 годика. После развода Сурайё было трудно найти доход, чтобы обеспечит своего ребёнка. Потом она решила заняться животноводством и к счастью в этом деле она добилась успеха. Огромную поддержку ей оказал ее отец. И теперь у неё есть своя собственная деятельность и доход. Сейчас Сурайё хочет, расширит свою деятельность, и приобрести несколько голов телят и комбикорма для них. Но, к сожалению, для этого у неё нет средств. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом и надеется только на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Surayo is a nice, humble woman from the Shahrituz region. She is 38 and divorced from her husband. She has one two-year-old child. After the divorce, it was difficult for Surayo to earn money to care for her child. Then she decided to work in animal husbandry and has happily achieved success in this area. Her father supported her greatly, and now she has her own business and income. 

Now Surayo wants to expand her business by purchasing a few calves and feed for them. But unfortunately she doesn't have enough money for this. Therefore she is looking for a loan and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a few calves

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Mrs Minh is 59 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 4 years.
Minh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.
In 2015, Minh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Minh has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rea Glyn

texts.en:
Rea Glyn is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Rea Glyn requested her eighth loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks, etc. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks, etc

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 23 years old, a single man who received little education. 

After his father's death, Ali became the only breadwinner of the family. He has a small grocery store project and is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator and some grocery products to increase his sales. 

That way he will be able to afford the education for his younger siblings and also help his sister with her marriage expenses.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and some grocery products.

loans.name: Marta Vicenta

texts.es: Marta es una mujer de 38 años de edad que siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida, es por ello que anteriormente solicito un crédito a la institución el cual le permitió instalar energía eléctrica en la vivienda que habita junto a su hijo de 17 años de edad. Marta se gana la vida con su venta de cocos, bebidas frías y golosinas, actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su hija como madre soltera. Marta desea reparar el techo de su vivienda y construir la pila y lavadero de su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir el lavadero y la pila y de esta manera contribuir a la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en: Marta is a 38-year-old woman who is always seeking ways to improve her quality of life. This is why she applied previously for a loan with the institution which allowed her to install electricity in the home that she inhabits with her 17 year old son. Marta earns a living with the sale of coconuts, cold drinks, and candies, an activity that has allowed her to help her child get ahead as a single mother. Marta wants to repair the roof of her house and build a sink and a laundry area in her house. For this reason, she requests a loan with FUSAI to invest in: brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build the laundry space and sink and thus contribute to the health of her home.

loans.use: to invest in: brick, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a laundry area and sink and thus contribute to the health of her home.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. Agnes has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her vulcanizing shop.

In the future, Agnes would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for her vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 35 years old and helps her husband to earn a living. She runs a direct-selling Avon products business in the Philippines.

Anne requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs.

Anne dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Rat

texts.en:
Rat is a 37-year-old married man with two children who resides in the Takeo Province, Cambodia. He makes his main income from working as a construction worker, and he has been in this work since 2014. His wife is 41 years old, and she earns her main income from selling Khmer cake at a primary school. 

Rat and his wife can earn approximately $14 per day. 

Rat is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and for family use. This loan will help him have enough finances to buy a motorcycle, which will improve his traveling conditions. In the future, Rat wants to save money for his wife to run a small business at home, build a proper house and support his children to go through higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and for family use

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser una buena profesional en obstetricia y por medio de su trabajo poder ayudar a las demás personas y también a sus seres queridos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente con sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Luz is studying hard and with all her might to become a good professional midwife and to help other people and her loved ones thanks to her job. She said she used her previous loan to pay for her college fees.
She is requesting this loan to keep on paying for her college fees, in oder to succeed in carrying her studies on.

loans.use: To pay for college fees.

loans.name: Kyeni Kya Kyasioni S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Ruth. She is 47 years old, married and a mother of four children. Ruth joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from the training on enterprise development and financial management.

Ruth operates a general store where she sells fruits, vegetables and cereals. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more cereals and vegetables, and, hence, to add stock for increased income. With increased income, she will be able to pay for family expenses, e.g., food, medicine and school fees for her children.

Ruth is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more cereals and vegetables, hence, to add stock for increased income to pay family expenses, e.g., food, medicine and school fees.

loans.name: Annie Rose

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Annie Rose works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Annie Rose is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish for her fish vending business.

Annie Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish for her business

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es: María es una persona responsable y trabajadora de 40 años de edad que se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de prendas de vestir actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, llevando el sustento necesario a su hogar. María vive con su grupo familiar que son sus 3 hijos de 14, 7 y dos meses de edad, ya que el mayor ha ello su propia familia, además vive su esposo que siempre le brinda su apoyo. María siempre busca la manera de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por lo que anteriormente solicito un crédito con el cual mejoro su vivienda, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, blusas, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, etc., para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria, 40 years of age, is a responsible and hard-working person who has dedicated herself for the last five years to selling items of clothing. This has allowed her to advance her family, providing necessary sustenance to her home. 

Maria lives with her family group, composed of their three children, ages 14, 7, and two months. Now, her eldest has her own family. Maria's husband always provides help.

Maria is always looking for a way to improve her family's quality of life. For that reason, she previously received a loan with which she made improvements to her house. Now, she is requesting a new loan through FUSAI to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, underwear, etc., in order to improve her business.

loans.use: invest in pants, blouses, skirts, dresses,underwear, etc., to improve her business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 43 years old and married and has two children to provide for. In her sari-sari (general) store business she built, she gains more income, which she uses to expand her business.

Marife raises a small number of pigs to earn income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She raises pigs and sells them to the market.

She aims to have more income, so she decided to avail a loan to buy feed for the pigs. The feed will enable her to produce a good quality of pigs so she can deliver pigs to supply her customers' demand. This will result a greater income.

Marife's plans for life are to use the profits that she raises from production to improve the quality of their lives.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her small number of pigs.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon earns a living by being an herbal scent dealer. He sells it to the locals in the community. He has been engaged in that kind business for more than 10 years. He is in need of additional capital to support his present livelihood.

Gideon is asking for a loan to buy supplies of herbal scent. With the presence of these resources, Gideon will be able to continue selling herbal scent to his respective customers. His income will improve, and he could be able to settle his finances as well. He could provide his family with nutritious diets and better shelter to live in.

He is married with four children, ages 17, 15, 13 and 8 years old, respectively. Gideon is determined enough that he could educate his children and would like to work hard for the improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies of herbal scent

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works very hard to help her husband earn a living for their children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, sugar, sardines, etc., to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for five years. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, sugar, sardines, etc., to sell

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Berlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Berlinda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish for her fish vending business.

Berlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish for her business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge es estudiante y pretende ser un gran profesional, por medio de la carrera que eligió el cual es la de Licenciatura en Ciencias Económicas, sus padres trabajan pata poder ayudarlo en su carrera.
Él es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matriculación y también la cuota de sus carreras. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge is a student who wants to be a great professional through the studies he chose which is a degree in Economic Sciences. His parents are working to be able to help him in his studies.

He is a person who makes an effort to be somebody in life and be able to help his loved ones.

He is requesting this loan so he can pay his registration and also pay his university fees. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to pay registration and fees for his studies.

loans.name: Cloie

texts.en:
Cloie is 30 years old and with two children, who are in school, Cloie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Cloie has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Cloie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 33-year-old married woman with two children, one attends school.  Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 10 years and requests 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, and soft drinks.

In the future, Daisy would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz hoy se está formando para ser Docente en lengua guaraní y geografía, vive con mis padres en la cuidad de Carapeguá.
Su meta es siempre luchar para salir adelante, con ganas de terminar y encontrar un puesto donde poder enseñar.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Liz today is studying to be a teacher of the Guaraní language and geography. She lives with her parents in the city of Carapeguá.

Her goal is to always fight to get ahead and she wants to finish her studies and find a job where she can teach.

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees and doing this be able to continue to study as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fish vending business for 5 years. Demetria earns additional income raising chickens.

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

She has  sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish.

loans.name: Efipanio

texts.en:
Efipanio is a married man with three children who works hard to support his family.

He has a motorcycle transportation business and  earns additional income raising pigs. Efipanio is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts to maintain his motorcycle.

Efipanio has sustained the business through 10 previous loans from NWTF. He hopes that hard work will help to attain his dream which is to save enough money to build a family house.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 44-year-old woman  with one child who works very hard to provide for them.

She  has run a general store for 15 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

In the future, Faith would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José, es un joven que vive en casa de sus padres junto a su madre y un hermano, practica la crianza de ganado, tiene más de tres años de realizar esta actividad, aprendió el oficio de amistades, ya que en la zona donde vive es bastante común la ganadería.
Con el capital podrá comprar ganado que cuidará para posteriormente venderlo y atender a nuevos clientes, ya que actualmente solo está comercializando ganado de corta edad, espera tener resultados positivos de la inversión.
Su visión es aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio y en el futuro tener mayor cantidad de ganado.
texts.en:
José is a young man who lives in his parents home with his mum and a brother. He breeds livestock and has been doing this for over three years. He learned it from friends as in the area livestock breeding is quite common.
With this money, he will be able to buy livestock which he will look after in order to then sell it and reach new customers as currently he is only selling young animals, he hopes to have positive results from the investment.
His vision is to increase the profitability of his business and in the future have more livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock that he will look after and then sell and reach new customers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 23-years-old and a university student majoring in Computer Science.

He has three siblings and his father is retired, so his pension in not enough to cover the household expense and Mohammad`s fees.

He needs finances to pay his tuition fees, so he would like to get a loan. With the loan, Mohammad will be able to have enough finances to pay his tuition fees for a bachelor’s degree successfully. His plans after graduation are to find a work in IT and to save money to guarantee his future.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for his B.Sc. in Computer Science

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is 24 years old, married, and has one son and one daughter. 

She has a small poultry sales project in a place she prepared in her house which is near the local market. Most of her customers are living in her neighborhood. 

She is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy more birds such as chickens and geese to help her husband with the family income.

loans.use: to buy more birds such as chickens and geese

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
El Sr. Rodrigo es de la ciudad de Santaní, es soltero, trabaja como oficial de Secretaria, también trabaja en una playa de vehículos, es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta y  responsable es muy dedicada al estudio.
El está estudiando para ser abogado, y por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino para poder ser un buen profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is from the city of Santaní. He is single and he works as an official for a government department. He also works at a car dealership. He is a hard-working, honest and responsible person who is very dedicated to his studies.

He is studying to be a lawyer and through his studies he wants to open the way to becoming a good professional.

He is requesting this loan in order to pay his university fees and continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Ronielyn

texts.en:
Ronielyn hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She raises and sells hogs to support her young children. She is 21 years old with two young dependents. In addition to hog raising, she also engages in the food vending business. Her partner has an income as a barber and helps to defray the family's daily expenses.

She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy pig feed and supplies for food vending These could improve her hog raising livelihood and able to sell  quality pigs. It also enables her to provide an abundant supply to cater to the needs of her customers.
 
In the future, Ronileyn hopes that she can manage her sources of income in order to be financially stable and also for her to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and also supplies for food vending

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene un hijo de 4 años, trabaja en una playa de vehículos como secretaria, es una persona trabajadora, honesta y  responsable.
Estudia para poder seguir sus estudios en derecho y por medio de ello poder cumplir con sus metas de ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lourdes is from the city of Santaní and she has one four-year-old son. She works in a vehicle parking lot as a secretary. She is a hard-working person, honest and responsible. 

She goes to school to be able to continue her law degree and through that be able to accomplish her goals of being somebody in life.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay the fees she has been paying for her degree.

loans.use: to pay for university fees

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es:
Justiniano, se dedica a reparar bicicletas y realizar viajes en su vehículo, para tener estabilidad económica, aprendió por cuenta propia su negocio hace 18 años, con esfuerzos lo ha logrado mantener en el mercado, es casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, en ocasiones recibe ayuda económica de familiares.
Requiere de un crédito para comprar repuestos como parches, neumáticos, tubos, pedales para reparar bicicletas, trabajara tranquilamente con todo lo necesario a su alcance, al fortalecer su negocio busca mejorar sus ingresos para que su familia tenga un mejor estilo de vida.
Sus aspiraciones son reconstruir su casa, agregar otro rubro a su negocio para tener oportunidad de mejores ingresos, resarcir su deuda y seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
To earn a living, Justiniano engages in repairing bicycles and making trips using his vehicle. He learned by himself how to repair bicycles about 18 years ago, and he has succeeded in staying on the market thanks to his hard work. He is married, he lives with his wife and their two children, and his relatives help him economically from time to time.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts such as parches, tires and pedals to repair the bicycles. He works in a relaxed environment, with everything he needs at his reach; by strengthening his activity, he tries to increase his earnings so that his family can enjoy a better standard of living.

He wishes to succeed in rebuilding his house, to add another component to his business to have better chances to increase his earnings, to repay his debts and to keep on supporting his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts such as parches, tires and pedals.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and married with two school-aged children. Grace works very hard to provide for them.

She has  run a general store for 6 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, coffee, and spices.

In the future Grace would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, coffee, and spices.

loans.name: Maria Nieves

texts.es: Maria de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, ella posee un chalet ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de golosinas, jugos, gaseosas, agua, galletas, etc.  y asi poder  continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her five children. She has a sales stand located close to her house in a busy area with which she obtains her income and manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy sweets, juice, soft drinks, water, cookies, etc. and be able to continue with her sales in order to have greater income.

loans.use: to buy sweets, juice, soft drinks, water, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Monica is 55 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Monica has a nipa roof-making business in the Philippines. Monica requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials such as nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, rope and other materials for her business.

Monica has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, rope and other materials for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 55 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to purchase items like canned goods, milk, spices, noodles, sugar, etc.

Juliana has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruit.

Juliana aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like canned goods, milk, spices, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Juana Marleni

texts.es:
Juana, ha notado la que las ventas de productos de belleza se han mantenido estables y que sus servicios son más demandados, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar cosméticos, tratamientos para el cabello, fragancias, cremas, etc., mantendrá surtido el inventario de su salón de belleza con el propósito de tener su fuente de ingresos estables.
De manera atenta agradece el apoyo que tanto Padecomsm como kiva le brindan con créditos para que su negocio siga funcionando, su familia se mantiene y sus condiciones económicas han mejorado un poco, es así como puede mantenerse responsable en el pago de su deuda.
texts.en:
Juana has observed that the sales of beauty products have remained stable and that her services are more in demand. She needs a new loan to buy cosmetics, hair treatments, fragrances, creams, etc. and will keep her beauty salon stocked up with the aim of having a stable source of income.
She is truly grateful for the support that Padecomsm as well as Kiva bring her with loans so that her business continues to work, so that her family is sustained and that her financial situation his improved a little, this is how she can continue to be responsible for the payment of her debt.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair treatments, fragrances, creams, etc. and to keep her beauty salon stocked up.

loans.name: Belen

texts.es:
La Sra. Belen es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería, está cursando el segundo Año de la carrera, su meta es culminar sus estudios, y su sueño es ser una profesional destacada. Belen se está esforzando cada día para poder crecer y mejorar cada día sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Belen is a Nursing student and she is in her second year of her studies. Her goal is to complete her studies and her dream is to become an outstanding professional. Belen is exerting herself every day to grow and improve her living conditions.

She is requesting this loan so she can pay her university fees and in this way be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: Ester de 75 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo.
