Ella es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 41 años trabaja en la crianza y venta de pollos de lunes a viernes, además los fines de semana elabora atoles y tamales para vender por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes que la conocen y recomiendan con lo que ha logrado un ingreso económico extra. Ester con el crédito anterior realizo mejoras en su vivienda y para brindar mejor comodidad a su familia, además realizo mejoras en la granja donde tiene la crianza de pollos, gracias a ello Ester ha logrado una buena estabilidad económica. Ella desea mejorar sus ingresos adquiriendo una cantidad mayor de pollos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, también en la comida para pollos, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI  para invertir en: pollos, comida para pollos, materiales para el cuido de pollos, etc., para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ester is 74 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She is a hardworking woman, who, for 41 years, has earned her living raising and selling chickens from Monday to Friday. On weekends she also makes atole (corn-based drink) and tamales to sell as she has many customers who know and recommend her, which provides her with extra income.

With her previous loan, Ester made improvements to her home to make her family more comfortable, as well as making improvements to the farm where she raises chickens. Thanks to this loan she has achieved good economic stability. She hopes to improve her income by purchasing more chickens to meet the demands of her clients, and she wants to chicken feed. For this reason she is asking for a FUSAI loan to invest in chickens, chicken feed, and materials to care for chickens, etc., in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, chicken feed, and materials to care for chickens, etc., in order to improve her business.

loans.name: Zoila Noemy

texts.es: Zoila tiene 44 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto con su esposo y sus dos hijas de 8 y 16 años en casa propia y humilde.Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable con sus hijas.Ella se dedica a la venta de comida y pupusas; ella lo elabora en su hogar y lo ofrece a los vecinos de su comunidad;es así como cubre las necesidades básicas y saca adelante a sus hijas.Ademas, su esposo se dedica a brindar servicios de seguridad ; es así como colabora con la economía de su hogar. Zoila tiene deseos de superación es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir más en su negocio y así mejorar los ingresos de su negocio.Ella comprará insumos básicos: maíz, frijoles y otros insumos básicos.
texts.en:
Zoila is 44 years old. She lives happily together with her husband and two daughters, who are 8 and 16 years old. They live in their own, modest home. She is a fighter who is responsible to her daughters. 

She dedicates herself to the sale of food and pupusas (stuffed tortillas). She prepares it in her home and offers it to the neighbors in her community. That is how she covers the basic necessities and moves forward with her daughters. In addition, her husband provides security services. That is how he contributes to the household economy. 

Zoila has a desire to excel. That is the reason she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in her business and increase the earnings. She will buy basic inputs: corn, beans, and other basic inputs.

loans.use: To invest in: corn, beans and other basic inputs

loans.name: Tum

texts.en:
Tum is a 48-year-old married mother with three children in her care. She resides in Takeo Province in Cambodia. She earns some income from cultivating rice and she has been in this work for over 28 years. 

Two of her children are factory workers and her husband is 49 years old, he is a fish pastes vendor (prahok). Together, they can earn approximately $23 daily. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva. 

Now Tum would like to request a loan because she is short of finances to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work. With this loan, she will have enough money to buy a motorcycle for her children to have better traveling conditions. In the future, she wants to save money to build a new proper house and support her youngest child to get a higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Victoria De Jesus

texts.es: Victoria de 59 años de edad,vive muy feliz junto a su hija de 36  años y 2 nietas de 1 y 9 años de edad en casa propia y humilde.Victoria siempre sea caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable.Ella se dedica al comercio informal lo que incluye venta de ropa para dama,caballero y niño de forma ambulante en la comunidad que ella reside; es así como cubre sus necesidades básicas.Además la hija brinda sus servicios en una empresa es así como  aporta económicamente para los gastos de el hogar.Victoria solicita un crédito a FUSAI  para poder invertir en su negocio y generar más ganancias.Ella comprará más mercadería entre ellos: pantalones,camisas, blusas entre otros.
texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old. She lives very happily with her 36 year-old daughter and two granddaughters who are one and nine years old. They live in their own modest house. 

Victoria has always been characterized as a very hard-working and responsible woman. She is employed in informal trade, as a traveling saleswoman in her community, selling clothing for women, men and children. That is how she covers her basic needs. In addition, her daughter works in a company and contributes economically to the household expenses. 

Victoria requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in her business and generate greater earnings. She will purchase more merchandise, including: pants, shirts, blouses and others.

loans.use: To invest in pants, shirts, blouses and other items to improve her sales and her finances.

loans.name: Yesica Diomara

texts.es: Yesica  tiene 28 años de edad,vive muy feliz junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 6 y 7 años  en casa propia y humilde. Yesica es una madre muy entregada que se esfuerza por dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos. Yesica se dedica a la venta de ropa, lociones y sandalias lo cual ofrece de forma ambulante en los alrededores de su comunidad; es así como ella puede llevar el sustento diario a sus hijos.Ademas, su compañero de vida se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su comunidad de esta forma el aporta a su familia. Yesica solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir más en su negocio y así poder generar más ingresos, ella comprará:ropa, sandalias y lociones.
texts.en:
Yesica is 28 and lives very happily with her partner and her two children, who are six and seven, in their own humble home.  Yesica is a very committed mother who tries hard to give her children a better future. 

Yesica makes a living selling clothes, lotions and sandals which she sells door-to-door in the areas around her community. This is how she is able to support her children on a daily basis. Furthermore, her life partner makes a living offering a transport service to the community, which is how he provides for his family. 

Yesica is asking FUSAI for a loan so that she can invest more in her business and generate more income. She will buy clothes, sandals and lotions.

loans.use: to invest in clothes, sandals and lotions in order to improve her business and her earnings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está casada, vive con sus padres, en la ciudad de Paraguarí, es estudiante de la Carrera de Veterinaria, su meta es culminar sus estudios y abrir su propia veterinaria.
Ella está esforzándose para poder ser una buena profesional que ayude a los animales.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Carapeguá. She is married and lives with her parents in the city of Paraguarí. She is a veterinary student and her goal is to finish her studies and open her own veterinary clinic. 

She is working hard to be able to be a good professional that helps animals. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay the university tuition and in this way be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Lucenda

texts.en:
Lucenda works hard to support her family. Lucenda is widow and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Lucenda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lucenda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Michelle dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un hombre casado de 66 años de edad esta pensionado, los últimos meses su calidad de vida se ha visto afectado ha enfrentado serios  problemas de salud debido a las cataratas que padece. Para el es imposible realizar sus necesidades mas básicas por lo que tiene que depender de alguien lo que le ha provocado un estado de depresión. A el le urge una operación para poder recuperar su vista.
texts.en:
This mans is married and is 66 years old which is the age of retirment. In the last few months his quality of life has been affected by serious health problems which he has been facing due to the cataracts that he has suffered.

It is impossible for him to obtain his most basic necessities because he must rely on someone else. This has induced a state of depression in him. He badly needs an operation to recover his sight.

loans.use: to get ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Luisa is 48 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Luisa has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to offer for sale.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marialyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Marialyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Ekata Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Labalinajarita, 24, is married and the mother of a little girl who is four years old. She is the one standing to the left in a green saree. They live together happily in a small village of Koraput district. She is a young, hardworking, dynamic woman who not only works at agriculture production but also as a village nurse while her husband is a driver of a small truck.

Labalinajarita has diversified farming and breeding production with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice, potato, and raising chickens, pigs, ducks. 

Along with her group member, she has requested a loan of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy goats and piglets to increase her production in animal husbandry. She hopes that her investment will go well and bring a good income for her family. 

Labalinajarita dreams that her daughter will grow up healthily, and have a good education and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy goats and piglets to increase her production in animal husbandry.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 53 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like milk, coffee, chips, bread, canned goods, etc.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Lolita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like milk, coffee, chips, bread and canned goods.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Lourdes is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her vegetables business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Magdy

texts.en:
Magdy is 25, single and lives with his family. He tried many times to find a job but in vain. 

So, he decided to start a mobile accessories sales-project as this kind of project is not common where he lives. 

He is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy new mobile accessories for modern cell phones. Magdy believes that the income from this project will help him afford his marriage expenses.

loans.use: To buy new mobile accessories for modern cell phones.

loans.name: Saye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 4 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été  crée le 13 décembre  2008. Il regroupe des femmes du même village qui ont de bonnes relations et qui s'activent dans le commerce et l'embouche.
SAYE   assise  à droite   de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est veuve  et mère de  7 enfants dont 3  filles et 4  garçons .
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter un bœuf à 250 000 FCFA. Elle achète aussi de l’aliment de bétail pour un montant de 55 000 FCFA. Après élevage elle le  revend à 350 000 FCFA
Les bénéfices récoltés serviront à assurer  les dépenses quotidiennes en achetant de la nourriture pour la famille.
texts.en:
This group of 4 people is part of a "banc villageois" which was created on the 13th of December 2008. It groups together women from the same village who get along well and who work in retail and livestock-fattening.

Saye, sitting on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is 56 years old. She is a widow and the mother of 7 children, 3 girls and 4 boys. With the loan money that she receives, she will buy a head of cattle for 250 000 francs. She will also buy 55 000 francs worth of cattle feed. After raising the animal, she plans to resell it for 350 000 francs. The profits she earns will be used to cover the daily expenses and buy food for the family.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Mariluz Del Carmen

texts.es: Mariluz de 38 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 18 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de tortillas, negocio con el que brinda todos los insumos necesarios para su familia y con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, además desea apoyar a su compañero de vida comprando repuestos para su pequeño taller de reparación de motos y así poder tener un ingreso extra. Mariluz desea invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de mayor cantidad de tortillas y así satisfacer las demandas de sus numerosos clientes es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: adquirir maíz por mayor, repuestos para motos, etc., para mejorar los ingresos de su negocio y apoyar a su compañero en el negocio de él.
texts.en:
Mariluz is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and 18 year old daughter. She is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living selling tortillas, a business with which she provides the necessary income for her family and has provided for her children. 

She also wants to support her life partner to buy spare parts for his small motorcycle repair shop in order to have extra income. Mariluz wants to invest in supplies to produce more tortillas and meet the demand of her many clients. This is why she is asking for a FUSAI loan to invest in corn in bulk and spare parts for motorcycles, etc., to improve the income from her business and support her life partner’s business.

loans.use: to invest in corn in bulk and spare parts for motorcycles, etc., to improve the income from her business and support her life partner’s business.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar aceite, carnes, verduras, granos básicos, condimentos, etc., para elaborar el menú de comida que ofrece en su negocio, espera que el comedor continúe funcionando y además poder atender mejor a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior pudo fortalecer el negocio de servicio de transporte y venta de frutas y verduras, actividades que actualmente ya no desarrolla, opto por dedicarse únicamente a la venta de comida, sus condiciones de vida familiar son más confortables y ha mantenido puntualidad en el pago de sus deudas.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan to purchase cooking oil, meats, vegetables, basic grains, spices, etc. to prepare the food menu that he offers in his business. He hopes that the dining room continues operating and he is able to better serve his customers. 

With the last loan he was able to strengthen his transport business and the sale of fruits and vegetables, activities that he no longer develops. He decided to dedicate himself solely to the sale of meals. His family life is more comfortable and he has been punctual in the repayment of his debt.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, meats, vegetable, basic grains, spices, etc. to prepare the food menu he offers in his business

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina, requiere de un nuevo crédito para reactivar la tienda de productos de primera necesidad, comprara granos básicos, bebidas, sal, azúcar, golosinas, etc., con la finalidad de ofrecer la mercadería que sus clientes necesitan.
Para Ernestina el crédito anterior ha sido de mucha ayuda, pues pudo surtir la tienda con más productos, atender a nuevos clientes y generar más ingresos que utiliza para cubrir los pagos de deudas y las necesidades familiares, se siente feliz por haber logrado remodelar su casa para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Ernestina needs a new loan so she can buy more everyday groceries for her store. She plans to buy basic grains, drinks, salt, sugar, candy etc. so she can provide her customers with what they need.

The previous loan was a great help to Ernestina as she was able to add more stock to her store, serve new customers, and generate more income which she used to make payments on debts and pay for family necessities. She is happy that she has been able to renovate her house and live more comfortably.

loans.use: buy stock such as basic grains, drinks, salt, sugar, candy etc.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Agée de 43 ans, Edoh est une femme mariée habitant à Baguida. Edoh est une marchande  de savons et bassines ayant deux enfants à charge. Edoh s’approvisionne au marché trois fois par mois et le revend de quartier en quartier. Edoh sollicite ce prêt pour commander des savons et des bassines. Avec les bénéfices, Edoh compte appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et les besoins en  nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en: Edoh is a 43-year-old married woman living in Baguida. She sells soap and bowls, and has two children in her care. Edoh gets her supplies at the market three times per month and sells from neighborhood to neighborhood. She is seeking this loan to order soap and bowls. With the profits, Edoh plans to support her husband in caring for the children and the food and health [care] needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase one box of soap and a dozen bowls.

loans.name: Nirina

texts.fr:
Nirina est une femme dynamique et sérieuse dans son activité d’épicerie. Avec le prêt d’avant, elle a pu diversifier les marchandises à vendre et acquérir un autre pavillon dont son mari s'en assurera. Ce prêt va lui servir à acheter plus de sucre, de la farine, du café et de l’huile pour étaler dans les deux pavillons, l'objectif de Nirina étant de devenir grossiste en produits de première nécessité.
Nirina constate une nette amélioration dans ses conditions de vie telle que la nourriture et la santé. Elle a de même augmenter son épargne qui lui permettra de subvenir aux imprévus et construire une maison plus tard.
texts.en:
Nirina is a hard-working and serious woman when it comes to her grocery store business. With the prior loan she was able to diversify her inventory and acquire another sales point that her husband will be responsible for.

This loan will allow her to buy more sugar, flour, coffee, and oil to display in the two shops. Nirina's goal is to become a wholesaler of staple goods.

Nirina has noticed a clear improvement in her living conditions, for example in nutrition and health. She has even been able to put aside more in savings which will allow her to cover unexpected expenses and later on, to build a house.

loans.use: to buy a stock of basic products such as sugar, flour, coffee, and oil to display in her two shops

loans.name: Worood

texts.en:
Worood is a 24 years old, single lady, living in Irbid.  She is third year student at university majoring in Finance. Her parents is facing some financial problems that lead Worood to apply for an educational loan to help her cover the semester fees.

Her future plane is to find good work so she can help her brothers to complete their study.  Worood needs your support.

loans.use: to help her cover the semester fees for her BA in Finance

loans.name: Bessy Lourdes

texts.es:
Bessy tiene 23 años y es madre soltera de 1 hija, Bessy se dedica a la producción de café y productos de hortaliza, con el apoyo de su familia esta logrando sacar adelante a su pequeña hija, Bessy sueña con que su hija tenga un buen futuro; que pueda optar a una educación de calidad y que crezca teniendo todo lo necesario para un vida digna.
El cultivo de hortalizas en una actividad muy novedosa en la región y con mercados locales asegurados por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual Bessy es socia, las condiciones climáticas son propicias y los mercados son muy rentables.
En la actualidad Bessy quiere incrementar la producción de hortalizas como ser: pepinos, lechugas y repollos los cuales le permitirán tener ingresos para poder suplir sus necesidades y las de su pequeña hija lo que le ayudara a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Bessy solicita un crédito para comprar materiales necesarios para la preparación del huerto como ser: semillas, abonos orgánicos, pago de mano de obra, insecticidas y plaguicidas entre otros, con las ganancias obtenidas por sus productos Bessy espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija.
Un crédito ayudara a Bessy a tener mayores fuentes de ingresos y mas posibilidades de sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en:
Bessy is 23 years old and the single mother of one daughter. Bessy works cultivating coffee and vegetables. With the support of her family, she is working on helping her young daughter get ahead. Bessy dreams of her daughter having a secure future through the option of a quality education and everything else necessary for a dignified life.

Growing vegetables in a very new activity in the region and local markets are insured through Kiva partner COCAFCAL, where Bessy is a partner. The weather conditions are favorable and markets are very profitable.

Currently Bessy wants to increase vegetable production of cucumbers, lettuce and cabbage, which allow her to earn income to meet her needs and those of her little daughter to help her have a better quality of life.

Bessy is requesting a loan to buy materials necessary for the preparation of the garden, including seeds, organic fertilizers, manual labor, and insecticides and pesticides, among others. With her earnings from these products, Bessy hopes to improve her quality of life and that of her daughter. A loan would allow Bessy to have better income and more possibilities for helping her daughter get ahead.

loans.use: to buy seeds, organic manure and other materials, and to pay laborers to prepare a vegetable garden.

loans.name: Familia Velasquez Group

texts.es:
Provenientes del Estado de México y ubicados en una localidad con raíces mazahuas, la Familia V. es un grupo de personas comprometidas con su trabajo y sus valores. Para llegar a su localidad hay que caminar un gran trecho a pie sin embargo la belleza del paisaje hace del recorrido una experiencia gratificante. Ellos se sienten muy contentos de su hogar al estar tan alejados del ruido pero tan cerca de la vegetacion. 
   Don Pedro es una persona que ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al trabajo del campo; su padre le inculco el amor por la tierra y pretende continuar hasta que sus fuerzas lo permitan. Es padre de seis hijos de los cuales sólo una aún estudia la educacion secundaria. 
   Para mantener los ingresos de su hogar elabora escobetas desde hace más de treinta años. Utiliza una raíz originaria de la región y después de lavarla y secarla la somete a un proceso de coloración por medio de azufre. Una vez lista corta las cerdas y construye cada una de las piezas. Actualmente su negocio ha crecido considerablemente pues tiene clientes que incluso viajan hasta su domicilio a comprar el producto, de lo contrario Don Pedro lo vende en tiendas de su comunidad o aledañas. 
   De igual forma está realmente agradecido con el préstamo pues además de invertir en escobetilla podrá comprar becerros para su cría ya que esta actividad secundaria la había suspendido durante un tiempo. "Quiero volver a retomar este negocio pues se obtienen muy buenas ganancias con las ventas" comentó contento. Una de sus metas es tener más éxito es sus negocios para que su hija estudie una carrera universitaria, "mi hija quiere ser una excelente doctora" agregó. 
  Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Rene quien invertirá en becerros; Jovita y María de la Luz, en ovejas mientras que Hilda y Humberto, en una tienda de abarrotes. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en su comunidad donde se pueden apreciar algunos animales, Don Pedro es quien sostiene las escobetillas con las manos*
texts.en:
The V Family lives in the State of Mexico in a community with roots from Mazahua people. They are committed to their work and their values. To get to their community you have to walk a long way, but the beauty of the landscape makes it a great experience. They are happy to be away from the noise and close to  nature.

Don Pedro has lived most of his life working in the fields; his father taught him the love for the land and he would try to continue until he is unable to. He is a father of six children and only one of them studies in high school.

To sustain his family, he has been making ‘escobetas’ (handmade handheld brushes) for more than thirty years. He uses a root originated in the region and after washing it and drying it he puts it through the process of sulfur coloration. Once it is ready, he cuts the bristles and builds each brush. By now, his business has grown considerably and he has clients that come to his house to buy the product; otherwise, Don Pedro goes to sell the product in the stores in the communities nearby.
  
The same way, he is very grateful with the loan; in addition to investing in handheld brushes business, he will be able to buy calves as his secondary activity, which he had suspended for a while. “I want to get back in this business because it is very profitable” he happily said. One of his goals is to do well in his business so that he can support his daughter’s studies at the university level. “My daughter wants to be an excellent doctor” he said.

The other members of the group are: Rene who will invest in calves; Jovita and María de la Luz in sheep; and Hilda and Humberto in their grocery store.

*The photograph was taken in their community. It shows the animals, and Don Pedro is the one with the brushes ‘escobetillas’ in his hands*

loans.use: to buy materials to make hand held brushes, so that he can sell them and buy calves for his secondary business

location.town: Barrio las Palomas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market for her fish vending business.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising chickens.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos, vive junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa e hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, manifiesta no tener parientes en el extranjero, tiene como negocio la administración de una tienda de productos domésticos, uso personal, entre otros, sus clientes son sus vecinos y con los ingresos que genera puede salir adelante con su familia.
Carlos ha solicitado un crédito que tiene planeado invertirlo únicamente en su negocio, piensa comprar granos básicos, bebidas, pan, huevos, golosinas, etc., surtirá su negocio con mercadería que sus clientes necesitan y espera poder ofrecer precios bajos para atraer a nuevos clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son ser reconocido como una persona honesta y trabajadora, así como también dar  a su familia un estilo de vida mucho más confortable.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and children. His children are students. He doesn't have any relatives living overseas. Carlos runs a store selling household items, personal products etc. His customers are his neighbours. With the money he earns he and his family can make ends meet.

Carlos is seeking a loan which he plans to use solely for his business. He is thinking of buying basic grains, drinks, bread, eggs, candy etc. and thus stock his store with the items his customers need. He hopes to be able to offer low prices to attract new customers.

His aspiration is to be known as an honest and hardworking person, and as well to be able to provide his family with a much more comfortable life.

loans.use: buy stock such as basic grains, drinks, bread, eggs, candy for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in jeans, pants, perfumes, and other orders from her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow his working capital and buy a cow to slaughter so as to sell a large quantity of meat and earn more.

loans.name: Sabugnuman Group

texts.fr: l’homme qui tient les cordes des moutons sur la photo est Mahamadou. Malien, Mahamadou est âgé de 60 ans. Il a quitté l’école en 4e année du primaire. Il est de teint noir. Marié, il est père de 4 enfants dont deux garçons et deux filles qui sont tous à l’école. Son rêve est de faire le toit de sa maison en tôle afin de ne plus avoir des problèmes à la saison des pluies et cela en comptant sur les intérêts des prêts qu’il prend avec le RMCR. Il prend le prêt au RMCR pour acheter des moutons pour l’élevage. Il s’approvisionne au marché environnant et vend au même marché après l’engraissement. Le bénéfice récolté sur la vente des moutons lui permet de prendre en charge : la santé, la nourriture et l’habillement de ses enfants. Mahamadou n’a pas eu de problème avec le prêt du RMCR. Il compte s’encourager dans son activité afin de voir son rêve naître un jour et cela pour l’amélioration de sa condition de vie dans le village.
texts.en:
The man holding the sheep's ropes in the photo is Mahamadou. Mahamadou is 60 years old and from Mali. He left school during the fourth year of primary school. He has dark skin. He is married and the father of four children, two boys and two girls who all attend school. His dream is to build the roof of his house from sheet metal in order to no longer have problems during the rainy season, taking into consideration the interest from the loans he takes from RMCR.

Mahamadou is taking the loan from RMCR in order to purchase sheep to raise. He gets his supplies from a nearby market and sells at the same market after fattening [the sheep]. The profit gathered from the sale of the sheep allows him to see to health [care], food, and clothing costs for his children.

Mahamadou has had no problem with the loan from RMCR. He plans to support himself in his business in order to one day realize his dream and improve his living conditions in the village in doing so.

loans.use: To purchase sheep to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 49 years old, married and has 3 sons and 2 daughters. 

He has a small paints and hardware sales project that he started 4 months ago. He is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy more paints and hardware such as nails and other iron tools to increase his sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more paints and hardware such as nails and other iron tools.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalina is married and has six children. She works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested her thirteenth loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline, and other fishing materials for her fishing business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline and other fishing materials

loans.name: Eduardo Luis

texts.es:
Eduardo se encuentra acompañado, vive con su pareja, no tienen hijos, el papá de su compañera de vida les ayuda económicamente, su negocio propio se trata de comercializar ganado, cuenta con 6 años de haberlo puesto en marcha.
Desea aumentar el número de animales que actualmente posee, por lo que requiere de un crédito para poder hacerlo, comprara ganado para fortalecerá su negocio, atender nuevos clientes e incrementar sus ganancias.
Los proyectos de Eduardo son resarcir su deuda y hacer mejoraras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and lives with his wife. They do not have any children. His father-in-law helps them financially. Eduardo owns a business which he's had for six years selling livestock.

Now he wishes to increase his herd so he needs a loan to be able to do this. He will buy more animals and thus strengthen his business, attract new customers, and increase earnings.

His plans include paying off his debts and making improvements to his house.

loans.use: Buy more livestock

loans.name: Yenny Cristy

texts.es: Yenny de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una cafetería y venta de licuados ubicada en el mercado municipal desde hace más de 17 años, posee muchos clientes por el buen servicio que brinda y con las ganancias que obtiene es como puede salir adelante junto con su familia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de azúcar, frutas, vainilla, chocolates, pan dulce, café, té, sopas instantáneas, entre otras cosas y así poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
39-year old Yenny lives in her own house with her son. She runs a cafe where she has sold milk shakes for more than 17 years.  The stall is located in the local market and she has many customers because of the fine service she provides. With the money she earns she manages to help her family get ahead.

Now Yenny is seeking a loan to buy sugar, fruit, vanilla, chocolates, sweet bread, coffee, tea, instant soups, etc. Then she will be able to continue her business and improve her income.

loans.use: Buy sugar, fruit, vanilla, chocolates, sweet bread, coffee, tea, instant soups, etc.

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Juntas Podemos está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, a través del trabajo en equipo con que cuenta el  grupo. Todas  se han comprometido a  trabajar y a realizar actividades   para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo. 
La Sra. Basilicia es una de las que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a hacer comidas ella misma todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, y luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y dar a su familia todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como los viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group “Juntas Podemos” (Together We Can) is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can get ahead. They can accomplish this by focusing on teamwork as a group. All of them have committed to working at their activities so that they can reach the common goal that they have set as a group.

Sra. Basilicia is one of the members of this group. She prepares food every day, beginning in the early hours of the day, and then sells it as a street vendor. Basilicia is a hardworking and determined woman who strives to move forward and provide her family with everything that she was not able to have.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for preparing her dishes such as vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, and other items. As a result, she will be able to continue her sales just as before. Basilicia appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nolita

texts.en:
Nolita works hard to support her family. Nolita is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, margarine, yeast, etc.  Nolita has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, margarine, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Nafi's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe a été crée le 28 septembre 2012 et regroupe 37 femmesqui habitent le même village. Fatydiop l'emprunteur en vedette est le responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 43ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont trois filles la plus grande a 08 ans et 01 garçon 23 ans. Tatydiop s'active dans le commerce et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Avec son de prêt, Elle compte acheter des chaussures, des produits détergents et alimentaires (Madar, savons, omo), et du bouillon, poivre, piment, ail, piment,de l'huile. Il y a d'autres femmes qui font cette activité mais elle arrive à écouler toute sa marchandise. Avec ses bénéfices elle compte appuyer son mari sur la scolarité des enfants, la nourriture, et renforcer son épargne
texts.en:
This group was created on September 28, 2012. It consists of 37 women who all live in the same village. Fatydiop is the featured borrower and representative of the group. At age 43, she is married with four children, three girls and one boy. The eldest girl is 8 years old, and the boy is 23. 

Fatydiop runs a commercial activity. She has substantial experience in her sector. She will use her loan to buy shoes, cleaning products (Madar, soaps, Omo), and food items such as bouillon, pepper, garlic, oil, etc. She manages to sell out despite her competition in this activity. 

She plans to use her profits to help her husband pay for the children’s tuition and for food, and to bolster her savings

loans.use: to buy shoes, cleaning products and food items to sell.

loans.name: Sreyya

texts.en:
Sreyya is a 27-year-old married factory worker with two children in her care who resides in Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2014. Her husband, 27, is a construction worker. Sreyya and her husband can earn around $13 per day.

Now, Sreyya would like to buy construction materials to renovate her house, so she is applying for this loan. With this loan, she will have enough money to renovate a proper house and achieve better living conditions. In the future, she wants to support her children to earn high educations.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Winniefreda

texts.en:
Winniefreda is 43 years old and married with seven children, six of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Winniefreda has been raising pigs for one year.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.es:
Romeo, vive en compañía de su esposa y su madre en casa propia, es propietario de una pupusería, su esposa trabaja junto a él, por el momento no representa dificultades para continuar trabajando.
Para aumentar la productividad de su negocio, opta por solicitar un crédito en Padecomsm, lo utilizara para comprar chicharrón, quesillo, harina, maíz, aceite, tomates, repollo, etc., para preparar la venta de pupusas, brindara un buen servicio y productos con más calidad.
Su sueños es tener estabilidad económica para y disminuir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Romeo lives with his wife and mother in his own house. He owns a shop selling stuffed tortillas. His wife works alongside him, and at the moment there are no problems continuing to run the business.

In order to increase productivity, Romeo is seeking a loan from Padecomismo which he will use to buy crackling, cream cheese, flour, maize, oil, tomatoes, cabbage etc.--ingredients for the tortillas. He will be able to offer good service and higher quality products.

His dreams are to have greater economic stability and decrease the needs of his family.

loans.use: buy crackling, cream cheese, flour, maize, oil, tomatoes, cabbage etc.--ingredients for the tortillas

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor de granos básicos, tienen 2 hijos, de los cuales 1 está estudiando y el otro trabaja y depende económicamente de ella solo su hijo menor.

Elsa, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 15 años, esta actividad la aprendió con su esposo, ya que al ser afectados por los terremotos del 2001 solo tenían esta actividad para mantener a su familia, anteriormente solo se dedicaba al cuido de sus hijos y de su casa, para ir a sus cultivos y trabajarlos ella tiene que caminar 4 kilómetros desde su vivienda y sus hijos y esposo le ayudan en esta labor.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono, semilla y plagicidas para sus cultivo de maíz y frijol, ya que la sequía le afecto su cultivo anterior, ahora con este préstamo estará asegurando sus ingresos y la alimentación de su familia hasta el próximo ciclo de cultivo.

Elsa, desea poder seguir cultivando las tierras que ha arrendado, ya que con esto podrá mejorar un poco la calidad de vida de su familia, procurando que su ultimo hijo pueda seguir con sus estudios y poder verlo graduado de bachillerato.
texts.en:
Elsa is 46 years old, she studied up to 4th grade. She is married and her partner is a farmer who grows basic grains. They have two children of which one is studying and the other works. Only the younger one depends on her financially. 

Elsa earns a living growing basic grains and has done this for 15 years. She learned this with her husband. As they were affected by the earthquakes of 2001 they only had this work to sustain their family. Before, she only used to look after her children and her home. To get to her crops and work them she has to walk four kilometres from her home and her children and husband help her in this work.

The loan will be used to buy fertiliser, seeds and insecticides for her corn and bean crops. As the drought affected her last harvest, now with this loan she will insure her income and the food for her family up until the last cycle of the harvest. 

Elsa hopes to be able to continue working the land that she has rented as with this she will be able to improve a little the quality of life of her family, ensuring that her youngest son can continue with his studies and that she will be able to see him gain his baccalaureate.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, seeds and insecticides for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El Joven Marcos es una persona trabajadora sacrificada, que tiene como meta finalizar sus estudios en sistema informático y poder así mejorar su calidad de vida y poder crecer como persona y profesional.
Marcos está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir estudiando así.
texts.en:
Marcos is a young man who is a hardworking and self-sacrificing individual. His goal is to finish his studies in Information Systems so that he can improve his quality of life, in addition to growing as a person and as a professional.

Marcos is doing everything he can so that he can grow and improve. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay his degree fees, which will help him to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Fatuma owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma operates a paraffin selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business from other operators in her business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase two tanks of paraffin for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two tanks of paraffin for resale

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна добрая и отзывчивая женщина. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Мавзуна дома предоставляет услуги швеи. Этим бизнесом она приносит домой значительный доход. Мавзуна давно мечтала приобрести новую швейную машинку. Ее средств не хватает для покупки, и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Она верит, что ей не откажут в кредите, и она приобретет швейную машинку свой мечты.
texts.en: Mavzuna is a wonderful, responsible woman. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children. Mavzuna works as a seamstress from home. The business enables her to earn a significant income. She has long wished to get a new sewing machine. She doesn't have enough capital to buy one, so she decided to seek a loan. She believes that she will be approved for a loan and will obtain the sewing machine she has dreamed of.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Mariamu operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Doña Reyna de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella trabaja en una empresa privada desde hace más de 8 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como puede salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto y colocando piso pero como no posee de suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra y así poder tener una mejor vivienda junto con su esposo.
texts.en: Reyna is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has worked in a private company for over 8 years. With what she earns she manages to get ahead in life. She wants to improve her home by building a room and putting in flooring. However, as she does not have enough money she is asking for a loan to buy construction materials and to pay for labour and thus be able to have a better home along with her husband.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business of perishable goods where neighbors and town dwellers are her clients. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding her business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Syombua

texts.en:
Syombua is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, for neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients; hence perishability of goods leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Bahati operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She mentioned transportation as a challenge in her business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has been blessed with one child. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Asha has operated a poultry sales business for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Asha dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

Asha wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Mpitakaula

texts.en:
Mpitakaula is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mpitakaula has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her place of operation. 

Mpitakaula wants to use the requested loan to purchase stock of goats to slaughter to get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter to get meat for resale

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 44 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman and to supplement the family's income, she operates a banana farm. She grows bananas and sells them to the market. Because of her children's increasing needs, Liezl wants to increase her income. That's why she took out a loan to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm. She will produce quality bananas and deliver plenty of bananas to the market to generate more income.

Liezl 's plan for the future to save money from her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Zoida

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Zoida works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Zoida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice for her business.

Zoida has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice for her business

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past three years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit and transportation.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a married mother of three children, one in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces major challenges of the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. 

With the loan Mwanaharusi is requesting of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, Mesaid has operated an open air food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

Mesaid wants to use this KES 10,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, Fatuma has operated an open air food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

Fatuma wants to use this KES 10,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, potatoes and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, potatoes and cooking fat

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Zawadi has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation of goods to her place of operation.

Zawadi wants to use the requested loan to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanasha operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Maricela Beatriz

texts.es:
Marisela, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja es jornalero en las fincas de café de la zona, tienen un hijo en edad preescolar y es la única persona que depende económicamente de ellos.

Marisela, tiene un cafetín donde vende antojitos y otros productos desde hace 1 año, con su mamá aprendió esta actividad; Marisela, decidió poner su propio negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con la carga familiar; ya que anteriormente solo estaba al cuidado de su hijo y de los oficios domésticos de su casa, el cafetín se encuentra en el centro de la comunidad donde ella vive y su pareja le ayuda en las tardes después del trabajo.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, yuca, papas, etc. para la elaboración de los antojitos, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos, ya que estará adquiriendo sus productos a un mejor precio al comprarlos por mayor.

Marisela, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y darle a su hijo una educación adecuada, para verlo convertido en profesional algún día, esto lo podrá lograr invirtiendo las ganancias de su negocio, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maricela is 23 years old. She studied up until 9th grade. She is married and her partner is a day working in the coffee fields in the area. They have one child of preschool age who is the only person who depends financially on them.

Maricela has a small café where she sells snacks and other products. She has done this for a year. She learned this from her mother. Maricela decided to start her own business to help her husband with the family as previously she was only looking after her child and doing the household tasks. The small café is in the centre of the community where she lives and her partner helps her in the evenings after work.

The loan will be used to buy fizzy drinks, sweets, yucca and potatoes, etc. to make snacks. This will help her improve her earnings as she will be getting her products at a better price by buying them in bulk.

Maricela dreams of making her business grow and giving her child a good education in order to see him become a professional one day. She could achieve this by investing the earnings of her business to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, sweets, yucca and potatoes, etc. to make snacks.

loans.name: Ekata Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Sanjibani is 31 years old and studied until reaching fourth grade, but due to the economic situation could not continue studying. She is the one standing to the left in the photograph. She has a partner who works in agriculture, and has two children who are dependent on her. Both are studying in a primary school in the village where she resides with her family.

Since Sanjibani was 12 years old, she has worked in the village, especially in agriculture, and she learned everything she knows from her father. She has also worked in a shop for five years. She learned this through the necessity and desire to help her partner support their family. Together with her partner, they plant corn, wheat, and bananas.

Their crops are a few kilometres from their house, and they have to travel there on foot, starting work at 6:00 a.m. and working until 12:00 p.m.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Sanjibani will use her loan amount in order to buy seed, manure, and pesticides, and to prepare the land for planting the crops.

Sanjibani dreams of building her house out of brick, as it is currently made from adobe, and buying a vehicle in order to transport her produce.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, and pesticides, and to prepare the land for planting the crops.

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en:
Mrs Tâm is 46 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 4 years.
Tâm lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.

In 2015, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Tâm has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman and lives with her husband and two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a paraffin-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. 

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase more paraffin for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more paraffin for resale

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en:
Dzine is a married mother of three children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Dzine sells fruits and green vegetables. She always strives to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money for have a more formal establishment. Dzine is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruit and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruit and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanaisha operates a business distributing water at the market. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business. She also operates a car wash business as an additional source of income.

Mwanaisha wants to use this loan to purchase a new car wash machine to use in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a new car wash machine to use in her business

loans.name: Mpoko

texts.en:
Mpoko is a married woman with seven children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Mpoko operates a business selling coconuts at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Mpoko wants to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Vinani

texts.en:
Vinani is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Vinani operates a market stall, selling vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation. Vinani wants to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Raheelah

texts.en:
Raheelah is 60 years old but she has a spirit of a twenties lady.  She is very adorable woman living in southern Ghour. 

She is married and caring mother of seven kids, her husband is working with low income and he cannot cover all needs of his family.

Raheelah is working hard to provide good life for her kids, she opened her own simple and independent mini market beside her home.
Now she applied for a loan to expand her business and buy food supplies and more kinds of products to sell to help her improve the standards of living for her family.

loans.use: buy food supplies and more kinds of products to sell

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Эту милую женщину зовут Сарвиноз. Она из Шахритузкого района. Сарвиноз 37 лет, замужем и мать двоих замечательных детей. Сарвиноз гостеприимная и очень обаятельная женщина. Она занимается сельским хозяйством около 10 лет. Всему этому её научил отец. Она занимается растениеводством и одновременно выращивает крупнорогатый скот. Также Сарвиноз успевает делать работу по дому. Ей можно позавидовать, потому что ни каждый человек способен на на такое. В данный момент Сарвиноз нужны средства для покупки минеральных удобрений, чтобы обработать посев для корма животных. Она с нетерпением ждет Вашу поддержку!
texts.en:
This sweet woman is called Sarvinoz. She is from the Shahrituz region. Sarvinoz is 37 years old, married, and the mother of two wonderful children. Sarvinoz is a hospitable and very charming woman. She has worked with agriculture for around 10 years. Her father taught her everything about it. 

Sarvinoz works with field crop cultivation and at the same time she breeds cattle. She also manages to do household work. One can envy her, because not every person is able to do this. 

Currently Sarvinoz needs money for purchasing mineral fertilizers, in order to cultivate the harvest that will become livestock feed. She impatiently awaits your support!

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business selling goat meat for the past six years. She faces a major challenge of creditors as she repays for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. In addition, she also operates a livestock selling business. She faces a major challenge of creditors as she repays for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan,  she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mapenzi has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.  She also operates a business selling vegetables, tomatoes and onions in her retail shop. Mapenzi faces a major challenge of competition in her business from other operators.

Mapenzi wants to use the requested loan to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sikudhani

texts.en:
Sikudhani is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, Sikudhani has operated a clothing sales business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. Sikudhani dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

Sikudhani wants to use the requested loan of KES 10,000 to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids, who attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Fatuma has operated a poultry-selling business for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge for the business. Fatuma dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Laith

texts.en:
Laith is a 24 years old, single man, who goes to the university to study Finance and Banking.  Laith is one of six member-family that is supported by their father’s retirement salary from the ministry of education. 

Lately the family went through some financial commitments that did not allow Laith to pay for his semester fees.  For that he is applying to this loan to help him pay for the university tuition and move forward with his studies.

loans.use: to help him pay his university tuition for a BA in Finance and Banking

loans.name: Ekata Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Pramila is a 33-year-old lady living with her mother and child. She is a single mother and is standing to the right in the photograph. She manages a tailoring shop, where she sews dresses like salwars (traditional Indian dress), kurtis, ethnic women’s tops, etc. for her customers who give orders for sewing. She hails from a small village of Koraput district.

After her husband left her, she was burdened with responsibilities for her child, so she started a tailoring shop. She earns only 5,000 INR per month from this business. She has planned to purchase two new sewing machines so that she can enlarge her business and take orders from her customers in bulk.

Pramila, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase two sewing machines and fabrics. She also wants to hire some workers to help her.

She wants her child to study in a good school and wants to save some money for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines and fabrics.

loans.name: Tsongo

texts.en:
Tsongo is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Tsongo operates a vegetable stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: На фотографии 35 летняя Садбарг. Она замужем, но ее муж находится за пределами Родины на заработках. Вся домашняя работа с четырьмя детьми возложена на хрупкие плечи Садбарг. Садбарг активная женщина и со временем успевает во всех делах, сделать хозяйственную работу, делать с детьми уроки, собрать их в школу и ухаживать за скотами. Садбарг хочет, чтобы ее дети пили натуральное молоко, поэтому она держит корову и к тому же она может и продать соседям (молоко). Садбарг на этом хочет создать бизнес и купить еще корову. Ее капитал не позволяет ей купить одну корову, и она просит финансовой поддержки. Садбарг надеется, что с помощью кредита она осуществит свой план и купит корову.
texts.en:
In the photo you see 35 year old Sadbarg. She is married, but her husband is abroad as a migrant worker. All the household work, including raising four children, rests on Sadbarg's frail shoulders.

Sadbarg is an active woman and currently she manages everything: Doing household work, raising her children, taking them to school and looking after the familiy's livestock.

Sadbarg would like her children to drink natural milk, and therefore she keeps a cow. Due to this she is also able to sell milk to her neighbors. She would like to make a business out of this, and purchase another cow. However, her funds do not enable her to purchase a cow, and she requests financial support.

Sadbarg hopes that with the help of the loan she can realize her plan and purchase a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Bharati is a 31-year-old woman. She is the featured borrower of Maa Durga SHG-A group and is standing to the extreme left in the photo. She is married and has a beautiful family with three children between the ages of five months and ten years. This modest family lives in a community in Koraput district of Odisha, India.

To provide for her family and support her differently abled husband in paying for household expenses, Bharati buys and sells groceries for a living. She has had this business for four years and, thanks to the friendly way she runs her store, Bharati has many clients.

In an effort to improve her business and to offer her customers more and better products, Bharati, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to be able to acquire capital and buy more grocery products such as candy, sugar, salt, cereals, detergents, flavored beverages, and soft drinks to make her store into one that sells better products.

Bharati’s biggest dream is to be able to build a bigger house out of cinderblocks to give her family greater comfort.

loans.use: to acquire capital and buy more grocery products such as candy, sugar, salt, cereals, detergents, and flavored beverages.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors as she repays for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mchekwisha

texts.en:
Mchekwisha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past eight years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors as she repays for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman; she has four children all of whom attend school. Mwanahamisi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanahamisi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es: Juana de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una sala de belleza ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años el cual lo inicio con capital propio, tiene muchos clientes por su buen servicio, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo es como pueden salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de tintes, peróxidos, tratamientos, uñas acrílicas, shampoo, cremas, entre otras cosas que necesita  y así continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Juana is 35 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and their two children.  For 10 years she has had a beauty salon in her home which she started with her own capital.  She has many clients due to her good service.  With what she earns from her work and with the help of her husband, they are able to move forward.

She is requesting a loan to buy dyes, peroxides, treatments, acrylic nails, shampoo, creams and other items that she needs and in this way continue working and improving her economic earnings.

loans.use: to buy dyes, peroxide, treatments, acrylic nails, shampoo, and creams among other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Этого молодого  и благородного человека зовут Абдусамад. Он из района Шахритуз. Ему всего 23 года, но он уже добился много успеха. Абдусамад работает учителем в одной из школ своего района. Несмотря на свой юный возраст, он знает, как обращаться с учениками, и старается удовлетворить их. Он знает характер каждого своего ученика.
