К сожалению, зарплата Абдусамада очень мала, но, не смотря на это, он все ещё продолжает работать. Его миссия в том чтобы дать детям хорошее образование. Вся его семья зависит только от него и чтобы обеспечит её всем необходимым, Абдусамад  занимается растениеводством. Большой доход он получает от этого дела. Абдусамад уже успел посадить урожай, но для обработки земли ему необходимо купить минеральные удобрения. У него не осталось средств, и поэтому обратился за кредитом. Абдусамад ждет и верит в Вашу поддержку!
texts.en:
This young and generous man is called Abdusamad. He is from the Shahrituz region. He is only 23 years old, however he already had quite some success. Abdusamad works as a teacher at one of the schools in his region. Despite his young age, he knows how to treat the students, and strives to meet their needs. He knows the character of each of his students.

Unfortunately Abdusamad's salary is very low, but despite this he continues to works. His mission is to give the children a good education. His whole family is dependent only on him, and in order to provide them with everything necessary, Abdusamad also works with crop production. He gets a good income from this business.

Abdusamad already succeeded with the sowing, but to cultivate the land he needs to purchase mineral fertilizers. He does not have enough money left and therefore he applied for a loan. Abdusamad believes in and awaits your support!

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian, a forty-three year old woman hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married  with six children. Her oldest child is 17 while the youngest is 8. 

Her main source of income is raising and selling of hogs.  Aside from hog raising, she also engages in rice retail business. She has been engaged in hog raising business for 15 years now. She needs additional funds to support her both livelihoods.

She has requested a loan to buy pig feed, vitamins and rice for reselling. With these, she will be able to improve her livelihood well and be able to augment her earnings.  

Slowly, she will be able to do some expansion and can provide her family with nutritious foods. In that way, she could settle her obligations and handle her finances as well.

Vivian is hoping that could continue finance the schooling of her children for brighter future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and rice for re selling

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. 

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku is a married woman with three children and owns a house that  has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
Nduku has operated a tailoring business for the past two years. She makes women and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima  is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling goat meat at the market. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman and has four school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman with five children. She lives at her own house that has electricity, but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Nyavula

texts.en:
Nyavula is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of fish to resell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to resell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Agnes dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a business selling clothes from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 KES, Rosemary wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Raila is 28 years old. She is standing to the right side in a red saree. She is a divorced woman who lives in a village of Koraput district in Odisha with her parents and two children. Raila's children are studying in a government school near her village. For lack of other opportunities, Raila herself, though educated until class eight, has been running a grocery shop from her home for the last eight years to add to the family income.

If Raila wants to expand her business and really benefit from increased inventory, she must buy the goods in wholesale quantities. As the market prices keep fluctuating, buying in bulk guards against price spikes, and hence ensures decent profits. She is, therefore, seeking a loan of 36,000 INR with her group member. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase grocery items in bulk, such as edible oil, spices, condiments, sugar and biscuits, for her shop.

Raila plans to have a good amount of savings and use it for her children's education and health care.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items in bulk, such as edible oil, spices, condiments, sugar and biscuits, for her shop.

loans.name: Silvia Petrona

texts.es:
Silvia, de 54 años de edad, no estudio debido a que sus padres no poseían la capacidad económica para poder darle el estudio, sin embargo, ella siempre ha salido adelante, actualmente está acompañada y tiene dos hijas, las cuales ya tienen su propio hogar, su esposo se dedica a manejar tractores en una finca de su comunidad y con ella solo vive su hermana y su esposo.

Silvia, se dedica a vender comida desde hace 10 años, aprendió este negocio de su mamá ya que desde pequeña ella le ayudaba a realizar la comida del hogar para toda la familia, con su mamá aprendió a realizar diversos platillos y fue eso lo que la motivo a poner su propio negocio, ella también hace tortillas para vender y es la fuente de ingreso alterna que posee, el comedor lo tiene en su propia casa de habitación y su horario de atención al cliente es de 6:00 de la mañana a 6:00 de la tarde.

Silvia, utilizara el préstamo para ampliar su negocio de comida y comprar maíz, frijol y carnes, debido a que estos son los productos que necesita con mucha más frecuencia en su negocio, ella espera mejorar su negocio y así obtener ingresos mucho más elevados, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Silvia, sueña con tener un lugar más apropiado para tener su comedor, ya que actualmente no tiene el suficiente espacio para poder atender a sus clientes, con el préstamo espera ir mejorando las condiciones de su negocio y así tener satisfechos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia is 54 years old.  She didn't go to school since her parents didn't have the economic capacity to have her study; however, she has always moved forward in her life.  She is in a relationship and has two daughters, each of whom has their own home.  Her husband works driving tractors on a farm in their community.  Her sister and her sister's husband live with them.

Silvia has worked selling food for 10 years.  She learned this business from her mother since from an early age she helped to make the family meals.  She learned from her mother how to make a variety of dishes and this was the reason for starting her own business.  She also makes tortillas to sell, which is an alternate source of income that she has.  The dining area is in her own home and her customer hours are from 6:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening.

Silvia will use the loan to expand her food business and to buy corn, beans and meats since these are the products that are most frequently needed in her business.  She hopes to improve her business, thus obtaining a much higher income in order to improve the living conditions for her family.

Silvia dreams of having a more suitable place to have her eatery since she currently does not have enough space to be able to attend to her customers.  With the loan she hopes to continue improving the conditions of her business and thus take good care of her customers.

loans.use: to expand her food business and to buy corn, beans and meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a professional sewing machine

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a  married woman and has four school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is married and has been blessed with six children. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 15 years, Rajab has operated a dairy farming business, selling as retail and at the market to his local residents and restaurant operators. In addition, Rajab also runs a business of selling poultry that earns him another source of income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. He dreams of adding more dairy cows and expand to a motorcycle business. 

With the 50,000 KES, he wants to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Jumwa operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 25,000 KES, Jumwa wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Luvuno has operated a butcher shop business for the past six years, selling goat meat at the market. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, Luvuno wants to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Agatha has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation of her goods to her place of operation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, Agatha wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has owned a food stall business of perishable goods, where neighbors and town dwellers are her clients. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, potatoes, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding her business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, potatoes, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is 42 years old. She is a just and talented woman. Fotima is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is a single mother with three children.

Fotima divorced from her husband and raised and educated her children by herself. It has not been easy for her. When the children were small, she did the household work alone, and in order to ensure her children's future, she started to sew women's clothing. Currently her children are grown up and help their mother. They are very thankful to her and proud that they have such a strong and enduring mother.

Fotima always dreamed of opening her own sewing workshop at her house. Finally, this year she decided to appy for a loan and realize her dream. To do this she needs to purchase a few sewing machines. She is doing all this for the sake of her children, in order to provide for them and give them a good education. Fotima impatiently awaits your answer.

loans.use: to purchase a few sewing machines and open a sewing workshop.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Мохира молодая женщина из района маленького района Турсунзаде. Ей 36 лет. Она воспитанная и умная женщина. Мохира после развода с мужем детьми живет отдельно и растет их одна. Мохира всю свою жизнь посвятила и посвящает своим детям. 
   Мохира на рынке занимается продажей овощей. Этим бизнесом она зарабатывает себе и детям на жизнь. На данный момент в ассортимент ее товара входит только лук и морковь. Она хочет расширить ассортимент товара и привезти картошки, свеклу, баклажаны. Для всего этого нужны средства и она планирует привести их с помощью заемных средств. Она верит, что у нее все получится.
texts.en:
Mohira is a young woman from the small region of Tursun-zoda. She is 36 years old. She is an educated and smart woman. After divorcing her husband, Mohira lives separately with her children, and raises them alone. Mohira dedicates her whole life to her children.

Mohira works with selling vegetables at the market. She earns a living for herself and her children through this business. Currently her assortment of goods consists only of onions and carrots. She would like to expand her assortment and bring in potatoes, beets and eggplants. To do this she needs moeny, and she plans to make the purchases with the help of a loan. She believes that she will succeed with this.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, cabbage and eggplants

loans.name: Twunguke Group

texts.fr:
Dieudonné fait partie du groupe  Twunguke et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 32 ans et est marié à Adélaïde, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 14 ans, dont  3 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de  riz et pain  depuis  5 ans. 

Il est son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait faire le commerce de matériaux de construction, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Dieudonné, age 32, is a member of the Twunguke group and he lives in Bujumbura. He is married to a farmer named Adélaïde, and they have five children ages 2 to 14, three of them attending school.  

Dieudonné has been selling rice and bread for 5 years. This is his 3rd loan cycle with Turame, and he plans to use the credit to strengthen his capital. He will buy a large quantity of rice to bolster his sales and revenue.  

In the coming years, he wants to start a business selling building materials. He would like his children to continue their studies.

loans.use: to strengthen his capital and buy a large quantity of rice to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Changa

texts.en:
Changa is a married woman with five kids, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Changa operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 30,000 KES, Changa wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Mwanamkasi has owned a food stall business, selling to neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients, leading to losses in perishable goods.

With the 50,000 KES, Mwanamkasi wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity, but no piped water.

Pauline has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, Pauline wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Noe Isaac

texts.es:
Noé es un joven reconocido en la zona por ser trabajador y por luchar para salir adelante con su familia, es casado y padre de un niño de un año de edad, sus vecinos dan buenas referencias de él, sus padres no viven con él; su negocio consiste en cultivar granos básicos, el oficio lo heredo de sus padres y hoy en día es su medio de subsistencia, con la cosecha puede tener alimento para su familia y otra parte para vender y generar así ingresos.
Ha decidido trabajar con créditos para mejorar su negocio, comprara abono, insecticidas y semilla mejorada para realizar la siembra de granos básicos, de esta manera no tendrá dificultades para seguir trabajando, espera tener a futuro mejores cosechas para contar con los recursos económicos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Sus sueños son ampliar el área de cultivo, tener una mejor situación económica y mejorar el estilo de vida que comparte con su familia.
texts.en:
Noé is a young man known throughout the region for being a hard-worker and for fighting for his family to get ahead. He is married and father to a one year old. His neighbors give him good references, his parents don't live with him. His business is cultivating basic grains- a trade he inherited from his father. It serves as a form of subsistence for his family and also to sell and generate income. 

He has decided to work with loans to improve his business, purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and better seeds to produce basic grains. This way he won't have difficulty pursuing work. He hopes to have better crops in the future to rely on the economic resources necessary to move forward with his family. His dreams are to increase the land area of cultivation, have a better economic situation and better living standard to share with his family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and better seeds to produce basic grains.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира 40 летняя жительница города Душанбе. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем за Исмоила. Ее муж Исмоил таксист. У них двое маленьких детей. Нодира дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она принимает все заказы на дому. Но она мечтает открыть собственное ателье, где у нее будет своя мастерская. Нодира идет к своей мечте постепенно. Она собирается покупать компьютерную швейную машинку, чтобы создать хорошие условия работы. Она долго работает на старой машинке и очень давно хотела иметь модернизированную машинку с новыми функциями. Она верит, что вместе с KIVA ее мечта осуществится.
texts.en:
Nodira is a 40 year old resident of the Dushanbe region. She is married to Ismoil. Her husband is a taxi driver. They have two small children. Nodira works with sewing women's clothing at her home. She takes all her orders at home, however she dreams of opening her own studio, where she can have her own workshop.

Nodira approaches her dream step by step. She has decided to purchase a digital sewing machine, in order to create good working conditions. She has worked on her old sewing machine for a long time, and long wanted to have a modern sewing machine with new features. She believes that together with Kiva her dream can come true.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with new features

loans.name: Gerberth Arnoldo

texts.es: Gerberth de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y yuca desde hace mas de 13 años inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sulfato, formulas, insecticidas, foliares, pago de mano de obra, etc. y así poder tener una buena cosecha, para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Gerbeth is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He has made a living cultivating corn and yuca for more than 13 years, all with his own capital. He sells his products in different markets nearby and with what he earns he is able make ends meet. He is requesting a loan to purchase sulfate, formulas, insecticide, fertilizer spray, pay day laborers, etc...This way he'll be able to have better crops and obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase sulfate, formulas, insecticide, fertilizer spray, pay day laborers, etc...

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a  married woman and has been blessed with four school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Mwanaisha has operated a farming business, selling as retail and at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the 50,000 KES, Mwanaisha wants to purchase seedlings and seeds for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and seeds for her business

loans.name: Talaye`

texts.en:
Talaye` is 40 years old and married with four children and lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. As all mothers want to insure a good life for their children, Talaye` is working hard to provide them a good life and to educate them. She hopes to see them as successful people in the future.

Talaye` didn’t stand in front of the obstacles without doing anything, she faced all challenges. Her husband is working for a very low income, so she decided to help him and start her own business. She started selling a few quantities of blankets in her home, and now she wants to buy more products and blankets to sell to increase her income and to be ready for the winter season. 

Talaye` needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more products and blankets to sell

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра 32 летняя жительница района рудаки. Она замужем и имеет одну дочку. Ей 9 лет. Гулчехра дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Гулчехра с годами приобрела большой опыт работы в данной сфере и клиентов. Теперь она хочет расширить свой бизнес и приобрести швейные принадлежности (нитки, иголки, флезелин, клей...), чтобы шить больше одежды и увеличить доход. С такими намерениями она обратилась за кредитом и верит, что ей помогут.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a 32 year old woman from the Rudaki region. She is married and has one daughter who is 9 years old. Gulchehra works with sewing women's clothing at her home. Over the years she has gotten much experience with working in this area and many customers.

Currently Gulchehra would like to expand her business and purchase sewing accessories (thread, needles, interfacing fabric and glue), in order to sew more clothing and increase her income. With this intention she applied for a loan, and believes that you will help her.

loans.use: to purchase sewing accessories

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмине 34 лет. Она живет в районе Носири Хусрав. Тахмина честная женщина. Она замужем и у неё трое детей. Её муж с сыном разнорабочие. Они строят и ремонтируют дома. Сама Тахмина занимается растениеводством у себя дома. Так как у её мужа и сына нет постоянной работы, деятельность Тахмины является основным дохода для них. В данный момент у них нет заказов, и они помогают Тахмине. Тахмина свежими овощами обеспечивает свою семью, а также продает их на рынке. Она занимается растениеводством около 6 лет. Сейчас она уже посадила осененный урожай, но у нее не осталось денег на покупку семян лука и минеральных удобрений.  По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом и надеется только на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Tahmina is 34 years old. She lives in the Nosiri Khusrav region. Tahmina is an honest woman. She is married and has three children.

Her husband and son are general workers. They build and renovate houses. Tahmina works with crop production at home. As her husband and son do not have permantent work, Tahmina's business is the main income for them. Currently they do not have any orders, and they are helping Tahmina.

Tahmina provides her family with fresh vegetables, and also sell them at the market. She has worked with crop production for around six years. Now she has already sown the fall harvest, but she does not have enough moeny left to purchase onion seeds and mineral fertilizes. For this reason she applied for a loan and depends only on your help.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Cristina America

texts.es:
Cristina, de 34 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, quienes aún se encuentran en etapa escolar, ella solo estudio hasta noveno grado, por que sus padres eran de escasos recursos y no le pudieron apoyar para continuar su formación, ella es madre soltera y es la que cubre todos los gastos de su hogar, actualmente solo sus 3 hijos viven con ella.

Cristina, tiene 12 años de experiencia vendiendo comida tipicos, vende tostadas, papas fritas y siempre se ha dedicado a esa actividad, la venta está ubicada frente a su vivienda y aprovecha los días en que pasan los estudiantes a la escuela porque vive muy cerca de ella, en sus momentos libres sus hijos le ayudan a preparar los materiales para su negocio.

Cristina, utilizara el crédito para comprar materia prima para su negocio como: papas, yuca, platano, aceite, leña y bolsas.- Con el crédito Cristina, pretende ampliar más su volumen de venta y de esa forma obtener una mejor ganancia para poder dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Cristina, sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales, ya que ella no lo pudo lograr, espera que con el crédito su negocio mejore, para poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones, también sueña con ampliar su casa porque donde actualmente vive es muy pequeño y no tiene las condiciones ideales para su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina is 34 years old and mother to three children who are still in school.  She only studied until the 9th grade because her parents didn't have the necessary resources to support her in continuing her studies.  She is a single mother and she takes care of all of the household expenses.  Only her 3 children live with her at this time.  

Cristina has 12 years of experience selling local cuisine.  She sells tostadas and friend potatoes and she has always devoted her time to this business.  Her stand is located in front of her home and she takes advantage of the days when students pass by on their way to school because they live very close to her.  When they have free time, her children help her prepare the ingredients for her business.  

Cristina will use the loan to buy primary ingredients for her business such as potatoes, yuca, plantain, oil, firewood, and bags.  With this loan, Cristina intends to further expand the volume of sales and therefore bring in more profit so that she can give her children a better quality of life.  

Cristina dreams of seeing her children become professionals, since she wasn't able to do so herself.  She hopes that the loan will allow her business to improve so that she can give her family a better life.  She also dreams of expanding her home because where she lives now is very small and the conditions aren't ideal for her family.

loans.use: to buy primary ingredients for her business such as potatoes, yuca, plantain, oil, firewood, and bags.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 35, married and has 2 children. He takes care of his aging parents and has a small poultry sales project. 

He is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy more hens to increase his sales and generate more income to his family.

loans.use: To buy more hens to increase sales and profits

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a sari-sari store owner from Ubay, Bohol. She has been doing this business for four years. Nila is a married woman and has five children. Her oldest child is 27 years old and her youngest child is 17 years old. 

Her greatest dreams in life are to send all her children to school and finished their degree. With that, she is requesting a loan of PHP10000 to buy dressed chicken to sell for additional income.

loans.use: to buy dressed chicken

loans.name: Muntaha

texts.en:
Muntaha is 47 years old and caring mother of seven children she is working hard to provide good education for her children.
 
Her husband is working with a very low income, and because she believes that she has to help him because the marriage is like a partnership in the bad and good life.

She started to sell blankets and her home to be able stay in her home to care of her children and now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets with a wider collection for summer and winter use.

She needs your support to provide living for her big family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of blankets with a wider collection for summer and winter use.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a retail hardware business for the past five years, selling to the neighbors and passersby. He mentioned seasonality in his place of operations.

With the loan he wants to purchase a stock of hardware items to sell.

He decided to join Yehu to access loan and boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of hardware items to sell.

loans.name: Kareema

texts.en:
Kareema is a 50-year-old married woman from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So Kareema took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable her to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Kareema will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).

Kareena’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Kareema appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family

loans.name: Haminton Alex

texts.es: Hamilton es socio hace ya 2 años atrás. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una empresa que se dedica a la publicidad. Ya se encuentra en el noveno ciclo. Comenta que quiere especializarse en Imagen Corporativa e Identidad Empresarial. Ademas de trabajar se da siempre un tiempo para poder dedicarse a la música ya que es lo mas le gusta. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad. Se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que le puedan ayudar a cumplir sus objetivos y metas.
texts.en:
Haminton has been a member for 2 years.  Currently he is working at a publicity firm.  He is already on his 9th cycle.  He notes that he wants to specialize in Corporate Image and Corporate Identity.  In addition to working, he always gives himself some time to play music since that is what he loves the most.

He is requesting a loan to pay for his university expenses.  He feels very grateful to all of the people who are helping him fulfill his goals and objectives.

loans.use: to pay tuition and living expenses

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a married woman with three children. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past seven years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking for too long to pay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past eight years she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

Rehema requested a loan from Yehu for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase crates of tomatoes, onions, and vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase crates of tomatoes, onions, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana, nunca estudio, vive con su madre y su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura.

Ana, se dedica a la agricultura junto con su esposo, toda la vida han trabajado juntos y han vivido de la agricultura, asi como también sus padres trabajan en el terreno que posen a 2 kilometros de su casa y todos los días están laborando en la tierra.

Ana, necesita el financiamiento para comprar abono, semilla de maíz y herbicidas para prepararse para las siembras que se aproximan, ya que ese es el sustento de todo un año de su familia y los beneficia en gran manera.

Ana, sueña con obtener una mejor cosecha que el año pasado y tener siempre buena salud para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ana never went to school.  She lives with her mother and her husband.

Ana and her husband make a living in agriculture.  They have worked together all of their lives and have sustained themselves through agriculture.  Like their parents, the work a piece of land that they own which is 2 kilometers from their home and they work in the fields every day.  

Ana needs the loan to buy manure, corn seeds, and herbicides to prepare for the coming planting, since this will be the sustenance for her family for the whole year and it will benefit them greatly.  

Ana's dream is to bring in a better harvest than last year and to always be in good health so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy manure, corn seeds, and herbicides to prepare for the coming planting.

loans.name: Ceci Masiel

texts.es:
Ceci, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada y vive con su esposo y su pequeña hija que estudia segundo grado, mientras que su esposo es motorista de un bus.

Ceci, se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde muy joven salía a vender con su madre, porque ese fue el trabajo de su mamá, de esa manera aprendió el negocio y decidió dedicarse a eso también, además de esto trabaja en la escuela de Lunes a Viernes y sale a vender ropa todos los fines de semana.

Ceci, necesita el dinero para comprar mas ropa para vender, porque tiene clientes a los cuales les gusta la variedad y de esa manera tendrá más ventas y mejores ingresos.

Ceci, sueña con tener su propio puesto en el mercado y de igual manera poder ver crecer su pequeña niña y que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Ceci studied up till second grade. She is married and lives with her husband and her young daughter, who is currently in second grade. Her husband is a bus driver.

Ceci works in the sale of clothes. Since an early age, she would go out to sell with her mother, as she worked in this field as well. It is in this way that she learned the business and chose to work in it too. In addition to that, she also works at the school from Monday to Friday, and goes out to sell clothes every weekend.

Ceci needs the loan the money so she can buy more clothes for resale, because she has clients that like variety. By doing this, she will have increased sales and a better income.

Ceci dreams of having her own stand at the market, and to see her little girl grow up and become a professional woman.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en:
Mkambe is a married woman with eight children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a mat weaving for sale business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a married woman with seven children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a mat weaving for sale business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en:
Rodalyn is 43 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Rodalyn has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is married and has two kids who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a motorcycle transport business from door-to-door. She mentioned competition as a major challenge in her business.

With the Ksh 25,000, she wants to add on her savings and purchase another motorcycle.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her largest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past two years, she has operated a soft drink fruit juice-selling business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality and high costs for transporting raw materials. With the KES20,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of mangoes, passion fruits, and other fruits for making fruit juice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of mangoes, and passion fruits, and other fruits for making fruit juice to sell

loans.name: Cesia Vanessa

texts.es:
Cesia, es una joven emprendedora, está estudiando una carrera universitaria, está soltera, vive con sus padres, los cuales poseen una tienda y una distribuidora de agua.

Cesia, tiene un cafetin desde hace más de tres meses, el cual atiende al público solo por las tardes, el cafetín está ubicado en una cancha de basketball y viaja en bus aproximadamente 2 kilómetros para poder llegar a su lugar de trabajo.

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para remodelar el local del cafetín e instalarle un lavamanos; de esa manera podra atender mucho mejor a sus clientes. 

El sueño de Cesia, es seguir trabajando en su cafetin y de igual manera poder pagarse la carrera universitaria y en un futuro próximo casarse y poder formar una familia.
texts.en:
Cesia is a young entrepreneur who is studying to get a university degree.  She is single and lives with her parents, who own a store and a water distribution business.  

Cesia has owned a small cafe for more than 3 months which is open only in the afternoons.  It is located at a basketball court and she travels by bus for approximately 2 kilometers to get to her workplace.  

She needs the loan to remodel the cafe locale and install a sink.  Therefore, she will be able to serve her clients better.  

Cesia's dreams are to continue working in her cafe,  to be able to pay for her university degree, and to get married in the near future so that she can start a family.

loans.use: to remodel her small cafe and install a sink

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a cafe business for the past three years, selling at the market and to the neighbors. She mentioned competition as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase plastic chairs, tables, plates and tea mugs for her business.

She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs, tables, plates and tea mugs for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Siriana

texts.en:
Siriana is a married woman of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 40,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a smart man. He is not married and lives with his parents. Mohammad is in the first year in a university majoring in information technology. He reads a lot of books and usually goes to the library. His parents are proud of him because he is clever and a hard-working man. His aim is to be a high quality specialist and to work in the same field to get experience, perhaps he will be a scientist someday.

Mohammad now needs your financial support because his parents do not have money to pay for his fees, therefore he asked for a loan to pay his education fees.

loans.use: to pay his education fees.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman who has four children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 54 years old, married, and has three children to raise. He is the only one who provides for the daily needs of his family. He has a great number of livestock, and he is working for the needs of his children in their schooling.

They sell to the market the eggs that they get out their livestock. He wants to improve the income they earn, so he took a loan to buy feed for his livestock business.

Robert's plan for his future is to save more money for the educational plan for his children and to uplift the living condition of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one and a half years, she has operated a clothing sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 25,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school . They live in their own house that has electricity but no piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Juliet dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her largest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as the major challenge in her business. Agnes is requesting 20,000 KES to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Luz Enid

texts.es:
Un Humilde deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar, fue lo que impulso a la señora Enid a volverse independiente y montar un negocio de confección a terceros, apoyándose de toda la experiencia que adquirió trabajando como operaria en diferentes empresas.

Ella tiene dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad, pero uno de ellos es adolescente y tiene sueños de universidad, y como madre es la responsabilidad de Enid ayudarlo a cumplir ese primer sueño.

Enid trabaja tiene una empleada, espera que  al finalizar este año pueda contar con dos o tres trabajadoras más, está confiada de los resultados ascendentes de este último año.

Buscando mejores ingresos, impulsar la marca propia, Enid quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual usara para la compra de insumos de confección, tales como telas, hilo, agujas, remaches, entre otros.
texts.en:
A humble desire to improve the quality of life in her home was the impulse that drove Enid to become independent and set up a third party dressmaking business, supporting herself with all of the experience she obtained working in various firms.  

She has two children who are both of legal age, but one of them is an adolescent who has dreams of going to college, and as a mother it is Enid's responsibility to help him fulfill this first dream.  

Enid has an employee and she hopes that at the end of the year she can add two or three more.  Her confidence is boosted by the improving results from this last year.  

Enid wants to take out a loan which she will use to buy dressmaking materials such as fabric, thread, needles, and rivets, among other things so that she can launch her own brand and bring in more income.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking materials such as fabric, thread, needles, and rivets, among other things, so that she can launch her own brand.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana es una madre cabeza de familia de 32 años de edad, tiene un pequeño que ama con todo el corazón de 36 meses de edad.
Diana se dedica a vender una de las bebidas más típicas de la región azucarera la cual es guarapo, un refresco natural elaborado con caña de azúcar y limón.
Inicio la actividad empíricamente en el año 2012, guiada por la necesidad económica de mantener a su pequeño.
Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida en su vivienda, lograr una estabilidad económica, donde el dinero alcance para pagar las deudas y generar progreso en su hogar, eso es lo que espera Diana y trabajara para lograrlo.
Diana quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra del insumo principal en su labor que es la caña, ya que no es un producto perecedero lo comprará en cantidades para que salga más económico y genere mayor utilidad en las ventas.
texts.en:
Diana is 32 years old, a mother, and head of the family. She has a little one (36 months old) whom she loves with all her heart. 

Diana works in the sale of guarapo [sugarcane juice], one of the most distinctive beverages of the sugar-producing region. It is a natural refreshment made with sugarcane and lime. She begun this activity in the year 2012, driven by the economic necessity of supporting her little one.

Her dream is to improve the conditions of her house and reach an economic stability where there's enough money to pay debts and get work started on her house. This is what Diana hopes for and works to achieve.

Diana wishes to request a loan for the purchase of the main ingredient in her work, which is sugarcane. As it is not a perishable product, she will buy it in large quantities so it's cheaper and she can generate a greater utility from her sales.

loans.use: to purchase sugarcane in bulk, which is the main ingredient of the beverage she sells, guarapo [sugarcane juice].

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 53 años de edad, creativa y emprendedora que nunca se dejó vencer por las adversidades que se le presentaron a lo largo de su vida, ya que está mujer con coraje y valentía, se independizó.
Rosa trabaja desde su hogar, ante todo es madre y sabe que sus muchachos necesitan de ella, por ello empleo la venta de mercancía como medio de generación de ingresos y hasta el día de hoy mantiene su hogar con la venta de calzado, accesorios, ropa, pijamas.
Su deseo es uno que trata de cumplir todos los días, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y ser una familia feliz.
Debido a la fuerte competencia que hoy existe en la venta de mercancía, rosa quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de sandalias, tennis, accesorios, pijamas entre otros productos, la estrategia es comprar en cantidades para ofrecer a sus clientes buenos precios y comodidades de pago.
texts.en:
Rosa, aged 53, is a creative and enterprising woman who has faced adversity throughout her life but has never given up. With courage and determination, she became self-employed.

Rosa works from her home. Before anything else, she is a mother and knows that her children need her. For this reason, she sells merchandise as a means to generate income. To this day, she has been supporting her household by selling footwear, accessories, clothing, and pajamas. 

Her wish is one that she tries to fulfill every day: to improve her living conditions and have a happy family.

Given the strong competition that exists nowadays from other retailers, Rosa wants to ask for a loan to buy an assortment of sandals, sneakers, accessories, and pajamas, among other products. Her strategy is to buy these products wholesale so that she can offer good prices and easy payments to her customers.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of sandals, sneakers, accessories, and pajamas, among other products. Her strategy is to buy these products wholesale so that she can offer good prices and easy payments to her customers.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Amina wants to start a business of hiring out a music system. She decided to join Yehu to get loan facilities and boost her business. With the loan of KES 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to add to her savings and purchase a music system for hiring.

loans.use: to add to her savings and purchase a music system for hiring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cured pork and sausages to sell

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Basanti is a 32-year-old lady. The lady standing to the right in the photograph is Basanti. She lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and three children in a small village in Koraput district in Odisha, India. Her husband is a farmer engaged in vegetable cultivation.

Basanti runs her terracotta business with the help of her husband and her son. She learned this work in her childhood, as it is their family occupation. She makes earthen pots and statues of gods and paints them. Her son helps her to supply those finished products to the dealers in the market.

She plans to expand her business, appoint new work staff to help her, and to own a shop in the marketplace for direct sale of the product to end customers. She, along with her group member, have requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more resources like paints, brushes, and ornaments for statues (statues of Indian Gods and Goddesses) and to set up her own shop in the market.

She wants to give her children a better education and let her family live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy more resources like paints, brushes, and ornaments for statues (statues of Indian Gods and Goddesses) and to set up her own shop in the market.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Nelly dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: Martha Diela

texts.es:
Martha es una fiel representación de esas mujeres guerreras, que dan todo por su familia, que no se dejan vencer ante ninguna adversidad y buscan cualquier medio para sobrevivir y sacar adelante a los suyos.
Ella es una mujer de 57 años de edad Viuda que se dedica a la venta de comida y que tiene 4 hijos.

Fue su hermana la que le enseño como cocinar y gracias a ella tiene un negocio que le genera el dinero suficiente para solventar sus deudas, pero, ella no quiere solo sobrevivir, se sueña teniendo un restaurante, comprar vivienda, automóvil, enorgullecer a su esposa que la mira desde el cielo.

Martha en el momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo que desea invertir en la compra de insumos para variar su menú, tales como productos fritos, o alimentos de otras regiones.

Este préstamo ayudara a impulsar su negocio y simbolizara una fuerza enorme para esta aguerrida mujer.
texts.en:
Martha is a faithful representation of those hard-working women who give their all to their family, who don't allow themselves to be defeated by any adversity, and who look for any means to survive and get their loved ones ahead. She is a 57-year-old woman, widowed, has 4 children, and works in the sale of food.

It was her sister who taught her how to cook, and thanks to her she has a business that generates enough money to settle her debts. But she doesn't want to merely survive. Her dream is to have a restaurant, buy a house, a car, and to make her spouse proud as he watches over her from above.

Currently, Martha is requesting a loan that she wishes to invest in the purchase of ingredients so she can add variety to her menu with products such as fried foods, or dishes from other regions.

This loan will help boost her business and will be a symbol of this brave woman's great strength.

loans.use: to buy ingredients so she can add variety to her menu with products such as fried foods or dishes from other regions.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Parwati is a single mother, 48 years old, who lives with her children in a community in Koraput district of Odisha, India.

Parwati (on the right in the photo) is a woman who struggles each day to help her family. Since she was 15 years old, she has been dedicated to elaborating typical clothing. She enjoys this activity and is able to do it in her home in the community. This allows her to perform household chores as well. With this activity, Parwati is able to help cover family expenses and provide fees for her children’s education.

With the intention of elaborating additional typical clothing, Parwati, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR to invest in her sewing business. With this money, she will purchase thread of the following types: silk, German, and lustring, and buy a semi-automated sewing machine.

Parwati dreams of someday opening her own boutique where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase different qualities of thread and a semi-automated sewing machine.

loans.name: Melisa Saida

texts.es: Melisa es una joven universitaria de 20 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el tercer ciclo de su carrera de Administración Bancaria. Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gustaría desempeñarse en áreas administrativas y financieras de las empresas en general. Comenta que quiere especializarse en finanzas. Además de ser una joven muy aplicada en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar básquet con sus amigos. Para obtener algún ingreso adicional trabaja esperodadicamente vendiendo verduras en el mercado. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a 3 años de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecido con las personas que lo ayudan a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Melisa is a 20-year-old college student. She is currently in her third semester of a Banking Administration degree, which she decided to study because she would like to work in the administrative and financial areas of a company, with a specialization in finance.

In addition to being hard-working, in her spare time she enjoys playing basketball with her friends. 

As a way to make extra income, she occasionally sells vegetables at the market. 

She is asking for a loan to be able to pay her university fees. It takes 3 years to finish her degree, and she feels very grateful to the people who help her accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She has a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell to customers.  She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Chona dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mwanakombo has  operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mwanakombo dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married mother of three children,  two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwanamwee

texts.en:
Mwanamwee is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 15 years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman and has four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Majaliwa

texts.en:
Majaliwa is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two and half years, she has owned a food stall business, where she sells to neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of competition.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Kadzo operates a grocery and vegetable stall.  She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase two crates of tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two crates of tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Elizabeth operates a vegetables  stall at the market. She is challenged by the high cost of transportation to her business. 

She wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Mahadeb Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Jamuna, age 30, is a married woman. The lady standing to the left side in the photo is Jamuna. She is in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

Her husband has severe health issues and has been bedridden for almost three and a-half years. Jamuna is the only breadwinner for her family. She works really very hard to earn her livelihood and pay her husband's medical expenses.

To help her to continue her operations, she, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. Jamuna will use her portion of the loan amount to buy spools of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently.

She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman and owns a house without running water or electricity.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Mnyazi has operated a tailoring business for 4 years to make suits for men and women. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

She wants to purchase fabrics and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase fabric and sewing thread.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es: “MUJERES AL PROGRESO” es un grupo conformado por socios responsables en sus cuotas de grupo. Marizola es casada tiene 43 años de edad con dos hijos educando. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por campaña hace varios años. De esa manera apoya a su esposo con los gastos de su familia. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para niños y adultos que los expende a pedido y ofreciéndoles a sus vecinos y conocidos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Marizola es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho. Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Gloria en la parte superior izquierda ya que no pudo estar presente en la reunión grupal.
texts.en:
“Mujeres al Progreso” [Women in Progress] is a group made up of members who are responsible in their group payments. 

Marizola is married, 43 years old, and has two children that are studying. She has sold clothing from catalogues for several years. In this way she supports her husband with her family’s expenses. She will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing for children and adults, which she sells by taking orders and by offering items to her neighbors and acquaintances. 

Unfortunately, Gloria couldn't attend the group meeting, therefore a picture of her has been put in the top left corner of the photo. 

The group thanks KIVA lenders for the loan offered. Marizola is the second person standing on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi is a married woman with three children, all  attend school. She lives at her own house that is without electricity and running water.

She has operated a butcher shop  for four years to sell meat at the market . She is challenged by the cost of transportation to her business.

She wants to purchase goats to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Azela

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Azela works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Azela is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc., for her general store business.

Azela has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two school-aged children. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a dairy farm to sell products at the market and restaurant operators. She is challenged by the changing seasons. 

She wants to purchase goats to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goats.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and with three school-aged children. She lives at her own house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Fatuma has  operated a poultry  business for 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business.

She wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She lives at her own house without electricity and running water.

She has operated a butcher shop for  three years to sell meat at the market. She is challenged by transportation costs  to her place of operation.

She wants to purchase  goats for her butcher shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a business selling clothes, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of 15,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
