Rebecca is a married woman and has two children. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated an open air food stall business; her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality of products in the market.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat oil, wheat flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat oil, wheat flour, and rice

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos   en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 21  años al negocio de venta de Abarrotería, también vende Golosinas en su glorieta donde vende tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos, baleadas, pollo frito con tajadas y carnitas, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y demás personas que a diario la visitan en su negocio.
Doña María es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de arroz, azúcar, huevos, manteca, frijoles, maíz, frescos, jugos, etc. en general para surtir su negocio y también piensa comprar 2 juegos de mezas con sillas para ampliar su negocio de las golosinas.
Doña María con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es crecer su negocio tener más clientes y poder mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own home. For the last 21 years she has worked at the business of selling groceries. She also sells candies at her food stall where she sells tacos, enchiladas, pastries, baleadas, fried chicken with fried plantains and barbecued pork. Her customers are all of her friendly neighbors and other people who visit her business daily.
María is an enterprising woman with dreams of getting ahead who fights day by day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, eggs, butter, beans, corn, cold drinks, juices, etc. in general to stock her business and she is also thinking of buying two board games and chairs to expand her candy business.
With the support from this loan, María intends to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a successive client with a desire to continue working with Prisma.
Her dream is to grow her business to have more customers and to be able to improve her quality of life as well as that of her family.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, butter, beans, corn, cold drinks, juices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Amamfredo

texts.es:
Amamfredo tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Aramango que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Bagua, región Amazonas, en la selva norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Amamfredo se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de piña así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Amamfredo espera ofrecer piña de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amamfredo is 45 years old. He lives with his wife and his son in his own rustic house in the Aramango district, located in Bagua province, Amazon region, in Peru's northern jungle. The life in this district is peaceful; the villagers make a living principally in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Amamfredo makes a living in agriculture, specifically in pineapple cultivation. He has experience in the industry with very good professional and work references from the area. The loan that will be issued, will be used to buy compost and fertilizer in order to carry out proper maintenance for pineapple cultivation and for contracting labor for harvest season. With this, Amamfredo hopes to offer higher quality pineapples to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level and thus improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer to carry out proper maintenance for pineapple cultivation and for contracting labor for harvest season.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman  with four children, all  attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house without electricity and running water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for  ten years. She is challenged by changing seasons.

She wants to purchase bundles of fish and plans to expand her business and establish another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is married with three school-aged children. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a cosmetic shop.  She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

She wants to purchase perfume, lipstick, and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, lipstick, and body lotions.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

She has operated an outdoor food selling business for a year. She is challenged by the changing  seasons. 

She wants to purchase  wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a single woman with two children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

Gladys has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbors and people at the marketplace. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating more hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, Gladys wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman with two children, all attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

She has operated an outdoor food selling business for a year. She is challenged by the changing seasons. 

She wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a motorcycle business for the past five years.She mentioned competition from other operators as a challenge in her business

With the loan she wants to add to her savings and purchase another motorcycle for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access a loan and expand her business.

loans.use: purchase another motorcycle for her business

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
Blandina is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past one year. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Neddy

texts.en:
Neddy is a married woman and owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Saumu has operated a tailoring business for the past two years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Sreynoy

texts.en:
Sreynoy is 29 years old married factory worker. She lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2014, earning $5 each day. Her husband is 27 years old and he is a construction worker. He has been in the business since 2014, earning $5 per day. 

Sreynoy would like to take out a loan, because she needs finances to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy cows and improve her family’s finances. 

For her future plans, she wants to save money to open a small grocery store at home and renovate a proper house.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Mujeres Unidas, es un grupo nuevo, la integran 15 mujeres que trabajan día a día para brindarles lo mejor a sus familias, y que no les falte nada.
Una de las integrantes del comité es la señora Adolfina, quien trabaja en la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Es una mujer muy luchadora que se esfuerza para poder crecer y salir adelante y dar lo mejor a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo, y otros,  y así seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee known as Mujeres Unidas is a new group comprised of 15 women that work every day to provide the best to their families so that they do not lack anything. 
One of the committee members is Adolfina who works selling foods that she makes herself, and afterwards, she sells them as a street vendor. She is a determined woman who pushes herself to grow, forge ahead, and give the best to her family. She requests this loan to buy products to make her food like The committee known as Mujeres Unidas is a new group comprised of 15 women that work every day to provide the best to their families so that they do not lack anything. One of the committee members is Adolfina, who sells foods that she makes, and afterwards, sells them as a street vendor. She is a tenacious woman who pushes herself to grow, forge ahead, and give the best to her family. She requests this loan to buy products in order to make her food like vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and more with her sales like she has been doing.  with her sales like she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and more.

loans.name: Dúo Jesús Mi Mejor Refugio Group

texts.es:
JESUS MI MEJOR REFUGIO
Este dúo está integrado por Evangelina ella vive en Sumpango, Sacatepequez, es casada y madre de familia,  ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y así mismo a la agricultura, ella necesita de capital para el cultivo de verduras ya que el invierno está muy escaso y tiene que pagar los servicios de un cisterna para que le venda agua y así poder regar las plantaciones que tiene sembradas junto con su esposo, actualmente está cosechando tomates pero el precio no mucho le está ayudando por lo que solicita un crédito con kiva para poder seguir manteniendo la cosecha que esta pronto a empezar.
texts.en:
JESUS MI MEJOR REFUGIO [JESUS, MY GREATEST REFUGE]

Evangelina is a member of this duo. She lives in Sumpango, Sacatepequez. She is married and a mother.

She works selling vegetables and also in agriculture. She needs capital for the vegetable crop, since the winter is very scarce and she has to pay for the services of a tanker to sell her water, and in that way is able to water the fields that she has planted together with her husband.

She is currently harvesting tomatoes, but the price is not helping her much, which is why she requests a loan with Kiva in order to continue maintaining the harvest that will begin soon.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a 22-year-old, single man from Deir-Albalah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Musa took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for his family house. By taking this loan, Musa will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Musa’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. 

Musa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his family's house

loans.name: El Progreso De Capilla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL PROGRESO DE CAPILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Toribia ella es casada y tiene 55 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank “EL PROGRESO DE CAPILLA”. This bank is located in the district of Echarate, in the province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

Toribia is 55 years old and is married. She works growing fruit and has land where she grows plantains, coffee, mandarin oranges, and oranges. She works from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. She has had this business for a number of years and it is doing well. Her dream is to expand her farmland. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The other members of the group work in animal sales, the agricultural business, in a grocery store, and in food sales. The members of this group whose photos are added received permission to miss the meeting for work reasons. For this reason, their pictures were taken afterwards.

Toribia is thankful for all who are part of this dream through this means. She commits herself to paying her quotas and the established repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en:
Rommel is 29 years old, married and has two children to provide for. He owns a farm that he uses to plant corn in order for them to live. He aims to have a greater income so he plants more corn and sells it to his customers in the market. And because of the increasing price of commodities nowadays, he took a loan to purchase fertilizer for his corn to produce a good quality of corn, deliver it to the market and generate more income.

Rommel’s plan for the future is to earn more profit and expand the business to support his children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his corn production

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting for too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman and owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Zawadi has operated a tailoring business for the past eight years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells shoe soles and also repairs shoes . She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of leather and soles. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of leather for repairing shoes

loans.name: Fundi

texts.en:
Fundi is a married man and he has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest.

Fundi operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

Fundi will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and a previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Sarouen, 43, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and sells the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for around twenty years. She is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day, on average.

Recently she wants to operate one more farming business by growing cassava. Therefore, she would like to apply for Kiva loan to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for her cassava farming. With the supporting from this loan, she hopes that she can get more income and improve her living standard. She would like to thank to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Scola operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase two crates of tomatoes, vegetables and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two crates of tomatoes, vegetables and onions for resale.

loans.name: Guy

texts.fr: Guy, 37 ans, est marié et père d’un enfant. Originaire de la ville de Jacmel dans le sud-est d’Haïti, il habite actuellement dans la ville de Cabaret et y mène ses activités commerciales. Il revend des lampes solaires, panneaux solaires, et quelques petits appareils électroniques. Il demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de lampes solaires.
texts.en: Guy is 37 years old, married, and has one child. He is from the city of Jacmel in southeast Haiti. He currently lives in the city of Cabaret, where he conducts his business. He sells sunlamps, solar panels, and some small electronics. He is requesting a microloan to increase his stock of sunlamps.

loans.use: to buy sunlamps.

loans.name: Diego Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Diego tiene 26 años de edad, tiene pareja con la cual se encuentra conviviendo desde hace 4 años. Desde hace más de 3 años que se dedica al rubro de la producción y embotellado de refrescos de pelón, siendo propietario en la actualidad de su propia embotelladora  obteniendo éxito por el sabor y calidad de su producto,  el señor quiere tener mejores ingresos económicos para salir adelante; el señor Diego está consolidando la ampliación de su planta, es por esto que requiere un préstamo para terminar de construir, equipar, adecuar sus instalaciones y comprar insumos,  para seguir con su actividad, brindando así al señor Diego la oportunidad de mejorar su producción y así poder tener mejores réditos en el rubro que trabaja. Además comenta que quiere mejorar el nivel de vida, como así también realizarse en el ámbito laboral.
El señor Diego es conocido por ser un hombre trabajador por su negocio, el cual le costó mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para constituirlo.
texts.en:
Diego is 26 years old, is partnered, and has lived with her for 4 years. For more than three years he has worked in the field of producing and bottling nectarine drinks, and is currently the owner of his own bottling company, having success for the quality and flavor of his product. He wants to have more income to get ahead. Diego is consolidating the expansion of his factory and for this he needs a loan to finish building, equipping and outfitting his facilities and to purchase supplies to continue with his work, offering Diego the opportunity to improve his production and to be able to have better yields in his field. In addition, he wants to improve his quality of life and also to be able to realize himself in the work arena.

Diego is known as being a very hard-working man in his business, which has cost him a lot of effort and dedication to build.

loans.use: to finish building and outfitting his facilities to bottle nectarine drink and to be able to promote his product.

loans.name: Manuel Arturo

texts.es:
Manuel es un agricultor que con el paso del tiempo ha perfeccionado sus conocimientos para cultivar maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de dedicarse a desarrollar dicha actividad, el oficio lo aprendió de su familia, trabaja de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde. Manuel vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos todos son dependientes y no reciben apoyo económico de parientes.
El crédito que está solicitando le servirá para comprar abono, semilla mejorada e insecticidas, podrá sembrar en el tiempo indicado y darle a sus cultivos un mejor trato para aumentar la productividad y tener oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos con los que piensa cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Los sueños de don Manuel son ampliar su vivienda y que sus hijos puedan estudiar en la universidad para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Manuel has been a farmer for many years.  He learned farming from his parents as a boy and knows what it takes to successfully grow maize and beans.  He works from 6:00am to 2:00pm.  Manuel and his wife have three children and are not receiving financial help from family members.
Manuel is applying for a loan that he will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his next crop.  The investment will allow him to maximize his yields and increase his income.  
For the future, Manuel hopes to expand his house and see his children go first to university and then on to good careers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman and she has four children, all of whom attend school. Dama owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Dama has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a married woman; she has two children, both of whom attend school. Subira owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Subira has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Eunice has operated a poultry selling business which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. In addition she also operates a business selling charcoal that earns her another source of income.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Denia Lorena

texts.es:
Denia siempre ha sido una mujer soñadora y perseverante, por ello desde temprana edad comenzó a trabajar para pagarse sus estudios superiores. En la actualidad, a sus 22 años ha terminado la carrera en contabilidad pública y solo le hace falta tramitar su título universitario. 	

Por ello solicita un crédito para pagar su título, esto le permitirá obtener un trabajo en su área de estudio.  Denia planea continuar estudiando, porque a pesar de haber  cumplir su sueño de ser contadora profesional, siempre ha querido estudiar ingeniería acuícola porque en la zona en la que vive es de mucha utilidad. Asimismo planea  ahorrar para una vivienda.
texts.en:
Denia has always been a dreamer and a hard worker. Because of this she began working at a young age in order to pay her own higher education costs. Currently 22, she has finished a major in public accounting, and only needs to process her university degree.

For that reason, she is applying for a loan in order to pay for her degree, which will allow her to get a job in her area of study. Denia plans to continue her studies--despite having achieved her dream of being a professional accountant, she has always wanted to study aquacultural engineering, because it is very useful in the area where she lives. She also plans to save up for a house.

loans.use: pay for a university degree.

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es padre de 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda y a cuidar de sus hijos, solo vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos.

Alejandro, junto a su padre y sus hermanos cultivan la tierra y siembran maíz y frijol, desde muy pequeño su padre le ha enseñado a trabajar y a cultivar la tierra, pero también se dedica a los trabajos de jornalero en donde gana $5.00 diarios.- Para llegar al lugar donde cultiva tiene que caminar un kilómetro y aparte de estas actividades también tiene 5 vacas, que tiene que darles pasto y ordeñarlas por la mañana.

Gracias al financiamiento anterior Alejandro, tuvo una gran producción en sus cosechas, compro y aplico los  fertilizantes necesarios para el desarrollo de la planta y esto le permitió obtener una buena cosecha, logro vender una parte y el resto fue para la alimentación de su familia.- Ahora, este nuevo financiamiento lo necesita para comprar abono, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra; de igual forma gracias al préstamo le permitirá obtener mayor producción y mayores ingresos para el sustento diario de su familia.

Alejandro, desea tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia y obtener una mayor producción de granos básicos y vivir cómodamente en un lugar digno para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 26 year old, and has a sixth grade education.  He is the father of two children, ages 5 and 2, and he is in a common-law marriage.  His partner does the household chores, and cares for their children.  He lives with only his partner and two children.

Alejandro, along with his father and brothers, cultivate the land, growing corn and beans.  When he was very young, his father taught him how to work and cultivate the land, but he is also engaged as a day laborer where he earns $5.00 per day.  He has to walk a kilometer to get to his farm land.  In addition to these activities, he also has five cows, which he has to put out to pasture and milk in the morning.  

Thanks to the previous loan, he had a very good production from his crops because he bought and applied the necessary fertilizers for plant growth, and this allowed him to obtain a good harvest.  He managed to sell a part of his harvest, and keep the rest to feed his family.  Now, he needs this new loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor costs.  Likewise, this loan will allow him to obtain greater production, and higher income for his family’s daily sustenance. 

Alejandro wishes to have a better quality of life for himself and his family, obtain a greater production of basic grains, and live comfortably in a decent place with his children

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer,and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Mahadeb Shg-B Group

texts.en:
The lady standing on the left-hand side in the photo is Daimati. She is age 43, and comes from a small village in Koraput district. She is married and her husband is her business partner. She has three children. Two of them are working and the youngest is still in the elementary level. They may not have the luxuries but Daimati's family is happy and content living a simple life.

Daimati has been running a small general store for more than 20 years already. She values her store for this has been their main source of income. It has greatly helped raise all of her children. Although at times she has difficulty collecting receivables from some customers, she maintains her positive outlook and faith that God will provide for their needs.

To help sustain and expand her store, she along with her group member, is seeking your help for a 36,000 INR loan to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages, etc. She wants to make sure that her store has most of the essential food and household items to offer. She will be grateful and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Daimati's simple dream is to build her store into a big grocery store. She prays for a victorious and united family.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, and beverages.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 31-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.  He wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for his family house. By taking this loan, Muhammad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Muhammad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Muhammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his family house

loans.name: Señor De Qoyllority De Lucre Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE LUCRE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lucre, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teodocia ella es soltera y tiene 69 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz y papa, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante su familia. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE LUCRE” communal bank. It is located in the district of Lucre, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and Cusco department.

Teodocia is 69 years old, single and has 5 children. She works in her agriculture business. She has land where she grows corn and potatoes. She is a hard-working woman who by doing this work wants to get ahead and help her family. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The members who's photos are attached to the group photo had their photos taken after the meeting as they asked permission to be late due to work reasons. The other members have businesses selling cereals, selling clothing, a grocery store and a restaurant.

Teodocia thanks those who form part of this dream by way of this loan and promise to pay her loan installments in the established time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sophoeurn

texts.en: From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Sophoeurn, 35, is an active and honest rice farmer. She is a mother of two dependent children. Her farmland is located near her house. So far, she has been a farmer for more than 10 years. She can make an income of USD 2.50 a day, on average. To accelerate her farming process, she wants to buy a cow to help in plowing the land and carrying many heavy farming materials. Because there is insufficient money, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a cow. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can help to process her farming faster. She is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Nimer took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for his family house. By taking this loan, Nimer will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Nimer’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Nimer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his family house.

loans.name: Eduar

texts.es:
Eduar 36 tiene años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 03 hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Colasay que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Eduar se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 20 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Eduar espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eduar is 36 years old, and he lives with his wife and their 3 children in their own home made of rustic materials in the district of Colasay, which is found in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in this area is peaceful, the inhabitants work primarily in agriculture, retail and ranching. 
Eduar works in agriculture, specifically cultivating coffee. He has 20 years experience and very good personal and work references in this area. The loan that he will receive will be used to buy fertilizer in order to adequately maintain his cultivation of coffee as well as to hire manual labour for the harvesting season. 
With this Eduar hopes to offer better quality coffee to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his level of income and consequently improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire manual labour for the harvesting season.

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es:
Berta es una señora con 66 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatros hijos ya mayores.
Con el propósito de generar más ingresos para su familia, monto una guardería, la cual ubico en la sala de la casa donde reside, su única dificultad es que no tiene un baño en buenas condiciones para prestar un buen servicio, es por esto que solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de un lavamanos, sanitario, cemento, baldosas, pega y demás implementos que sean necesarios para la construcción de este.

Su meta es continuar trabajando para remodelar su casa y cumplir el sueño de ayudar económicamente a sus hijos para continuar sus estudios profesionales.

Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva todos sus sueños se cumplirán.
texts.en:
Berta is a 66-year-old married woman who has four adult children. In order to generate more income for her family, she set up a daycare, which she runs out of the living room of her home. Her only challenge is that she doesn't have a bathroom in good condition in order to deliver good service. Because of this, she is requesting a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of a sink, plumbing, tiles, glue, and other items needed in the construction of a bathroom.

Her goal is to continue working to remodel her home and to achieve her dream of helping her children economically so that they can continue their professional studies.

She knows that with the support of Interactuar and their partners at Kiva, her dreams will come true.

(The faces of the children have been blurred out for privacy reasons)

loans.use: to purchase a sink, plumbing, tiles, glue, and other items needed in the construction of a bathroom

loans.name: Obaida

texts.en:
Obaida is 21 years old and is studying for a diploma degree in communication engineering. He lives in Ajloun, and he is working really hard to get ahead and to grow.

Obaida dreams of having a good job so that he could help to pay for his daily expenses and help his family with household expenses. 

He requested a loan to pay for his educational expenses so that he can continue with his education and graduate, then he will try to find a good job to do what he wants and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his educational expenses

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Yolidis Eline

texts.es: Yolidis es una carismática mujer apasionada por la belleza y el cuidado personal, desde joven su interés en aprender todo lo relacionado sobre este arte se hizo notar, decidió en tomar un curso de estética y en cuanto se graduó, inauguró su salón de belleza con un escaso capital pero con una dedicación y esmero que le permitieron tener éxito.  En la actualidad cuenta con 10 años de funcionamiento y una clientela fidelizada a quienes ofrece servicio de corte de cabello, tinturación, blower, deriz y demás tratamientos capilares.  Con la finalidad de ofrecer servicios oportunos y de calidad, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar tintes, tratamientos capilares para deriz, queratinas entre otros. Esta inversión permitirá mejorar su stock de productos y con ello la agilidad en el servicio. Su meta a futuro es mejorar la imagen del negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolidis is a charismatic woman who is passionate about beauty and personal care. From a young age her interest in learning everything related to this art was evident. She decided to take a beautician course. When she graduated, she opened a beauty salon with just a small amount of capital but through a lot of dedication and care she achieved successful results. 

She has now been operating for 10 years and she has a faithful customer base to whom she offers haircuts, colouring, blow-waves, straightening and other hair treatments. In order to offer appropriate and quality services, she is requesting her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to purchase hair dyes, hair straightening treatments, and keratin, as well as other things. This investment will allow her to improve her stock of products and therefore her customer service. Her future goal is to improve the image of the business and her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase products such as hair dye, hair straightening treatments and keratin.

loans.name: Pablo Roberto

texts.es:
Pablor Roberto es un joven estudiante de Licenciatura en Negocios internacionales, él solicita un prestamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Pablo Roberto, tengo 22 años vivo en el Sector 24 de abril, nací y crecí en Santo Domingo, tengo 4 hermanos de parte de padre y soy hijo único de parte de madre. No estoy casado ni tengo hijos. Mi madre actualmente no está trabajando y no he tenido contacto con mi padre.
Quisiera estudiar en Unapec  la carrera de Negocios internacionales porque me gusta esa área en lo que es el comercio internacional y es una carrera con mucho futuro porque ya todos los países están abriendo sus fronteras para comercializar sus productos y también recibir algún producto que no produzca ese país. Actualmente estoy ejerciendo mi 6to cuatrimestre. He tomado muchas materias y he visto que en verdad quiero estudiar y  aprender más sobre la carrera. Entre las materias que he estudiado, me gustó  mucho Introducción a los Negocios es la base de lo que esta carrera en sí.
Estoy solicitando este préstamo porque en verdad lo necesito para seguir estudiando ya que mi madre no está trabajando y no tengo una relación con mi padre desde que era pequeño. Actualmente en mi casa estamos recibiendo una pensión de mi abuela de parte de su trabajo porque tuvo una grave enfermedad y ya no puede trabajar y mi madre se tiene que quedar cuidándola en mi casa. Esa pensión es muy mínima, es lo que entra mensualmente a mi casa aparte de mi sueldo que también es bajo, esos son los únicos ingresos que estamos obteniendo en mi casa mensualmente, actualmente trabajo en una tienda de suplementos dietéticos como vendedor.
Si no me aceptaran el préstamo tendría que parar mis estudios hasta que consiguiera un trabajo de mayor ingreso para ver si puedo pagar y también mantener los gastos de la casa mensualmente. Este préstamo  cambiaria positivamente mi vida porque me quitaría un peso de encima de siempre estar pensando de donde voy a conseguir el dinero para pagar la universidad y mantener la casa; me daría un gran respiro económico y mentalmente.
Mi meta es graduarme y poder hacerlo con notas excelentes para poder regalarle  eso a mi familia que me ha apoyado siempre en lo que es este gran desafío. Personalmente quiero ir creciendo como persona y también como ciudadano para poder ser un hombre estudiado que pueda aportar su conocimiento al país para bien. Después de terminar mi carrera me gustaría hacer una maestría en esta carrera. Después que le haga, estudiar economía o fisicoculturismo.
texts.en:
Pablor Roberto is a young student in the International Business degree program. He is asking for a loan to cover his educational costs. This is his story: My name is Pablo Roberto. I am 22 years old and I live in the 24 de abril sector. I was born and raised in Santo Domingo. I have 4 siblings on my father's side and I am the only child on my mother's side. I am not married and don't have children. My mother is not currently working and I haven't had any contact with my father. 

I wanted to study for a degree in international business at Unapec because I like this area which is international commerce and it is a degree with a lot of future since all the countries are opening their borders to sell their products and also get some products which they don't sell in that country. Currently I am in my 6th term. I have taken many courses and have seen that I really want to study and learn more about this field. Among the courses I have studied, I liked Introduction to Business a lot; it is the base of this entire major. 

I am asking for this loan because I really need it to continue studying since my mother is not working and I haven't had a relationship with my father since I was little. Currently, in my house we are getting a pension for my grandmother from her work because she had a serious illness and now can't work and my mother has to stay home to care for her. This pension is very small, it is our income each month in my house, apart from my salary which is also very small. This is the only income we are getting in my house each month. Currently I work in a dietary supplement store where I am a salesperson. 

If my loan is not accepted, I will have to stop my schooling until I get a job with more income to see if I am able to pay and also to keep up the monthly household expenses. This loan will positively change my life because it will take off the weight of always thinking of where I am going to get the money to pay for university and support the household. It would give me a great economic and mental relief.

My goal is to graduate and be able to do it with excellent grades to be able to give this to my family who has always supported me in this which is a great challenge. Personally, I want to continue growing as a person and also as a citizen to be able to be an educated man who can contribute his knowledge to the country for its good. After finishing my degree, I would like to get a masters in this field. After I do that, to study economy or bodybuilding.

loans.use: to cover higher education costs.

loans.name: Grupo Chocola Sector Cerro Partido Group

texts.es:
Azucena es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es casada ella vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez. 
Azucena (es la que aparece de primero en el lado derecho de blusa blanca) es una mujer que lucha cada día para apoyar a su familia, pues desde hace dos años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, le gusta hacer esta actividad ya que lo hace desde la plaza de su comunidad, y esto le permite también realizar los oficios de su casa, con lo que ella obtiene contribuye con su esposo en complementar los gastos de la casa.
Azucena con el afán de seguir comprando y vendiendo ropa típica, ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, con este dinero ella estará comprando güipiles, cortes, fajas y todo lo relacionado con la línea de ropa. Azucena tiene el sueño de instalar un local donde pueda vender mejor su producto y construir una casa propia.
texts.en:
Azucena is a 25-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family in a community called Suchitepéquez. Azucena (who appears first from the right side of the photo in the white top) is a woman who fights every day to support her family. Two years ago she started earning a living by buying and selling traditional clothing. She likes this work because she can carry it out in the plaza in her community and it allows her to take care of her household obligations. With the money she earns, Azucena helps her husband with their household expenses.  

Azucena, with the desire to keep buying and selling traditional clothing, is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her business. With this money, she will buy güipiles (traditional dresses), skirts, belts, and everything related to this line of clothing. 

Azucena's dream is to open a store where she can better sell her products and to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Santos Irene

texts.es:
Irene, de 61 años de edad, no estudio debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos y no alcanzaban para mandarla a la escuela, actualmente tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales ninguno vive con ella porque todos se independizaron y tiene sus propias familias, su esposo se fue para los Estados Unidos y por eso a quedado soltera, sin embargo ella vive con sus cuatro nietos y son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Irene, se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeña, debido a que sus padres siempre la llevaban  a trabajar en las milpas que ellos hacían, actualmente siembra sus propios cultivos junto a sus nietos y a la vez todos los días sale a comprar leche para elaborar queso para la venta, la leche la compra a 3 kilómetros de su casa.

Irene, utilizara el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizante, herbicida, con el propósito de tener un cultivo sano, que le genere la suficiente fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante con los servicios de educación, salud y alimentación de su familia.

Irene, sueña con que sus nietos estudien y logren lo que ella no pudo lograr.
texts.en:
Irene, who is 61 years old, did not attend school since her parents had scarce resources which were not enough to send her to school. Currently, she has 9 children who do not live with her since all of them became independent and have their own families. Her husband left to the United States and because of this, she is now single. Nevertheless, she lives with her four nephews and they are the only ones who depend on her.

Irene works in agriculture ever since she was very young since her parents always took her to work in the cornfields which they worked in. Currently, she plants her own crops together with her nephews and everyday she leaves to buy milk to make cheese for sale. She buys the milk 3 kilometers from her house.

Irene will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs like organic fertilizer, chemical fertilizer, and herbicides, with the purpose to have a healthy harvest which will generate sufficient income to be able to get ahead with education, health and nutrition for her family.

Irene dreams that her nephews will be able to study and achieve what she was not able to achieve.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like organic fertilizer, chemical fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer de 39 años de edad que actualmente se encuentra casada, fruto de su matrimonio nacieron 5 hijos, esos 5 muchachos se han convertido en el pilar, en la fortaleza, en sueños, en deseos de superación para Margarita quien debe permanecer en casa para cuidar a sus retoños ya que aún están en etapa de crecimiento y necesita esa figura maternal que siempre está corrigiéndolos.
Ella para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar inicio a vender artículos de joyería, precisamente cadenas y manillas fabricadas en plata y acero, las distribuye a amigos, familiares y vecinos.
Su mayor deseo es comprar una casa, es la meta que se ha propuesto junto con su esposo y aspita a cumplirla.
Como su negocio aún se encuentra en etapa de crecimiento, Margarita quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de mercancía  principalmente artículos en acero y plata.
El motivo del préstamo es buscar crecer y captar mayor público, no estancarse en sus actuales ventas.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 39 year old women who is currently married. From her marriage she had 5 children. These 5 boys have become the pillar, strength, dreams and wishes for overcoming for Margarita which should stay home to care for her little ones considering that they are at a growing stage and need this maternal figure who is always improving them.

To help her husband in household expenses, she began to sell jewelry items, specifically necklaces and bracelets made out of steel and silver. She distributes them to friends, family, and neighbors. 

Her biggest wish is to buy a house. This is a goal which she has decided together with her husband and she aspires to achieve it.

Since her business is still in the growing phase, Margarita wants to request a loan to buy an assortment of merchandise, mainly steel and silver items.

The motive for the loan is to find, grow and gain a greater customer base, and to not stagnate on her current sales.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of merchandise, mainly steel and silver items.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a married woman with eight children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business selling chickens, which she has done for six years. Her business is located in a populated place, and she has regular customers. Her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more chickens to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and the past loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en:
Nesa owns and operates an agricultural farm, growing coconut, banana and other crops for a living. Nesa has been engaged in this business for many  years helping with her husband working on it and earns well from these activities. Her  farm is doing well and yet, she needs financial assistance to improve it. 

Recently,she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Merliza

texts.en:
Merliza is 29 years old and has three children.  Merliza is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Merliza requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merliza has been pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, soap, milk, etc. .

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming corn.

Ana dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, soap, and milk

loans.name: Protus

texts.en: Protus is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be loyal. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to have several business outlets within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his family house

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Desde el año 2010 inicio un sueño la joven Yessica, ella con tan solo 21 años de edad tenía muy definido su futuro, ser independiente y manejar sus tiempos, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo y juntando unos ahorros monto un salón de belleza que se encuentra en etapa de crecimiento.
A pesar de haber empezado en el año 2010, el crecimiento ha sido a pasos pequeños debido en gran parte a la falta de capital para comprar equipo y herramientas que capten la atención de un mayor número de clientes.
Su primer propósito en la vida es comprar una casa para vivir junto a la persona que más ama, su madre, y es por ello que se encuentra ahora en la corporación Interactuar dispuesta a pedir un apoyo económico para comprar dotación para su salón de belleza, tales como: delantales, toallas, cepillos, pinzas, secador, e insumos para realizar tinturados y tratamientos.
texts.en:
Since 2010, a dream began for the young women Yessica. At only 21 years old, she had her future clearly defined, which is to be independent and manage her time. Due to this, with lots of effort and by combining some savings, she put together a beauty salon which is currently in its growing stage.

In spite of starting in 2010, the growth has been in small steps due mostly to the lack of capital to buy equipment and tools that capture the attention of the majority of customers.

Her main purpose in life is to buy a house to live together with the person she loves most, her mother. For this reason, she finds herself as a member of the corporation Interactuar ready to ask for economic support to buy resources for her beauty salon, such as aprons, towels, brushes, pins, hair dryer, and supplies to be able to do hair coloring and treatments.

loans.use: to buy resources for her beauty salon, such as aprons, towels, brushes, pins, and hair dryer.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 35 years old, and he works in the military. For security reasons, he asked his brother to take his place in the photo. Mahmoud lives in Salt, Jordan with his family. He is the sole breadwinner in his family, and his wages are low. Consequently, Mahmoud decided to start his own business to increase his income and improve the living standard of his family. Mahmoud opened a grocery near his home, and now he applied for a loan to buy more products and food supplies to sell to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Vath

texts.en: Vath, 56, is a married woman from Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She has seven children. To make a living, she grows and sells rice. She has done this business for more than thirty years. She is able to make an income of 2.50 USD per day. Parts of her house have deteriorated, and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living space for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a KIVA loan via Hattha Kaksekar Limited to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en: Wilfrida is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cattle hides and cows. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more cows and open a butchery. Her business goal is to have several butcheries within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cows and open a butchery.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is married and the mother of one child. She describes herself as honest, and earns a living by running a farm where she grows french beans and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for two years and most of her customers are locals. Lydia describes her biggest business challenge as crop diseases. She has requested a loan for Kes 30,000 to buy fertilizer. This will be her third loan from SMEP Microfinance bank; her previous ones were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a 50-year-old woman from Trindad, Bohol. She is married and has three adult children ages 29, 27 and 24. Her husband is a farmer while she is engaged in a water retailing business. She also helps her husband in running their rice farm. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy purified water to sell and to buy rice seed for their farming business. She also plans to reconstruct their house with part of the money she is requesting. Anecita’s plan in the future is to be successful in her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy purified water and rice seed and to reconstruct her house

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Theresa is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Theresa has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Theresa requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF in order  to buy additional clothing to offer for sale.

Theresa has been in this business for four years.  In the future, Theresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Mephie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mephie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Mephie is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like can goods, egg, soft drinks, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mephie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like can goods, egg, soft drinks, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is married and the mother of two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who is 47 years old and has one child in school. She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as snack food, personal care products and groceries. Mary Grace has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a married woman with four children .She lives in her own house that neither electricity nor piped water.Her greatest monthly expenses is food.

She has operated a weaving business for the past three years selling to the locals. She mentioned a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she wants to purchase more weaving materials for her business.She decided to join Yehu to access loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more weaving materials  for her business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is married and has three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishable of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: For the last five years, Clarita has earned a living by making and selling puto (a steamed rice cake) with cheese toppings. In addition to food vending, she also raises and sells hogs. She is 58 years old, married and cares for three dependents. One of her children is in college, and her husband earns a living as a laborer. Clarita has requested a loan to buy ingredients like flour and sugar as well as pig feed and a piglet. This will allow her to continue to prepare and sell snack foods while she also improves her hog-raising business. It will also allow her to improve her income and settle her finances. In the future, she hopes to finish sending her youngest child to college and enjoy success generating both sources of income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flou and sugar and buy a baby pig and pig food.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is 32 years old and lives in West Irbid. She is a conservative woman and asked her husband to take her place in the photo. She is a caring mother of three kids, and they are all students. Ghada works hard to give them the best education and hopes to see them succeed in the future.

Her husband earns a low income, and he cannot cover all the needs of his family. Ghada believed that she should be a productive woman and help her husband with the household expenses to be able start achieving her dreams. She bought a small quantity of food supplies and sells these products from an empty room in her house. She is running her business in a good way, but she would like to expand it by buying a large quantity of products and food supplies to sell. Because she does not has enough money, she decided to take a loan to help her buy what she needs and increase her income. She hopes to open an independent mini market.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of products and food supplies to sell

loans.name: Muambe

texts.en: Muambe is a single woman. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en: Ednah is married and has three children who range in age from 5 to 14 years old. She describes herself as obedient and operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been in this business for five years, and makes her sales in a good area where most of her customers are locals. She has requested a Kes 60,000 loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will prosper. This will be her third loan from SMEP Microfinance  bank, and she will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, sugar and noodles.

Rose industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as raising pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old, and she is married with 5 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Imelda is borrowing 22,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Imelda has been farming rice for 10 years, though she also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en:
Yolita is an industrious, married woman who resides in Talibon, Bohol in the Philippines. She has 2 children, aged 8 and 10 years. 

Yolita produces and sells souvenir items for occasions like weddings and birthday celebrations. To augment her income, she also farms, growing and selling rice. She has been engaged in these businesses for 10 years now.

Yolita is requesting a loan to buy materials to make souvenir items as well as farm supplies such as fertilizers. With these purchases, she would be able to  not only fulfill various orders for her clients but also boost her farm's yield. Thus, she would be able to pay her obligations and handle her finances. She would now be able to afford nutritious meals and better shelter. 

Yolita would like to expand both her livelihoods, making them sustainable. She is also eager to work hard to support the schooling of all her children and provide them with a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy materials to make souvenir items as well as farm supplies such as fertilizers

loans.name: Walingwaling

texts.en:
Walingwaling is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional cusp and coffee for her cafeteria business. Walingwaling has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional cups and coffee for her cafeteria business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and buy-and-sell ready-to-wear.

Josephine is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. for her general store business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Thokozani

texts.en:
Thokozani is 21 years old. He was old born in Salima and moved to Lilongwe to look for better opportunities. He is the second born in a family of four. Thokozani describes himself as a focused and determined person. He is requesting for his first Kiva loan in order to start running his own Zoona Mobile Money transfer business. His business will provide financial services to people in his community and help him to provide for his siblings.

With this Kiva loan, Thokozani will be able to have the funds needed for him to serve customers on a daily basis. He will also be able to purchase a trading trolley where he will serve his customers and buy web-enabled phone and cash box.

Thokozani's dream is to grow his business so that he can continue his education and keep on helping his community by employing people. He explains that employment in Malawi is very hard to find.

loans.use: purchase a trading trolley, a web-enabled phone and a cash box to start running his own money transfer business
